67#define FRAME_SEEK_THRESHOLD 25
69const std::vector<FFmpeg_Transcoder::PRORES_BITRATE> FFmpeg_Transcoder::m_prores_bitrate =
70{
71 // SD
72 { 720, 486, { { 24, false } }, { 10, 23, 34, 50, 75, 113 } },
73 { 720, 486, { { 60, true }, { 30, false } }, { 12, 29, 42, 63, 94, 141 } },
74
75 { 720, 576, { { 50, true }, { 25, false } }, { 12, 28, 41, 61, 92, 138 } },
76
77 { 960, 720, { { 24, false } }, { 15, 35, 50, 75, 113, 170 } },
78 { 960, 720, { { 25, false } }, { 16, 36, 52, 79, 118, 177 } },
79 { 960, 720, { { 30, false } }, { 19, 44, 63, 94, 141, 212 } },
80 { 960, 720, { { 50, false } }, { 32, 73, 105, 157, 236, 354 } },
81 { 960, 720, { { 60, false } }, { 38, 87, 126, 189, 283, 424 } },
82 // HD
83 { 1280, 720, { { 24, false } }, { 18, 41, 59, 88, 132, 198 } },
84 { 1280, 720, { { 25, false } }, { 19, 42, 61, 92, 138, 206 } },
85 { 1280, 720, { { 30, false } }, { 23, 51, 73, 110, 165, 247 } },
86 { 1280, 720, { { 50, false } }, { 38, 84, 122, 184, 275, 413 } },
87 { 1280, 720, { { 60, false } }, { 45, 101, 147, 220, 330, 495 } },
88
89 { 1280, 1080, { { 24, false } }, { 31, 70, 101, 151, 226, 339 } },
90 { 1280, 1080, { { 60, true }, { 30, false } }, { 38, 87, 126, 189, 283, 424 } },
91
92 { 1440, 1080, { { 24, false } }, { 31, 70, 101, 151, 226, 339 } },
93 { 1440, 1080, { { 50, true }, { 25, false } }, { 32, 73, 105, 157, 236, 354 } },
94 { 1440, 1080, { { 60, true }, { 30, false } }, { 38, 87, 126, 189, 283, 424 } },
95 // Full HD
96 { 1920, 1080, { { 24, false } }, { 36, 82, 117, 176, 264, 396 } },
97 { 1920, 1080, { { 50, true }, { 25, false } }, { 38, 85, 122, 184, 275, 413 } },
98 { 1920, 1080, { { 60, true }, { 30, false } }, { 45, 102, 147, 220, 330, 495 } },
99 { 1920, 1080, { { 50, false } }, { 76, 170, 245, 367, 551, 826 } },
100 { 1920, 1080, { { 60, false } }, { 91, 204, 293, 440, 660, 990 } },
101 // 2K
102 { 2048, 1080, { { 24, false } }, { 41, 93, 134, 201, 302, 453 } },
103 { 2048, 1080, { { 25, false } }, { 43, 97, 140, 210, 315, 472 } },
104 { 2048, 1080, { { 30, false } }, { 52, 116, 168, 251, 377, 566 } },
105 { 2048, 1080, { { 50, false } }, { 86, 194, 280, 419, 629, 944 } },
106 { 2048, 1080, { { 60, false } }, { 103, 232, 335, 503, 754, 1131 } },
107 // 2K
108 { 2048, 1556, { { 24, false } }, { 56, 126, 181, 272, 407, 611 } },
109 { 2048, 1556, { { 25, false } }, { 58, 131, 189, 283, 425, 637 } },
110 { 2048, 1556, { { 30, false } }, { 70, 157, 226, 340, 509, 764 } },
111 { 2048, 1556, { { 50, false } }, { 117, 262, 377, 567, 850, 1275 } },
112 { 2048, 1556, { { 60, false } }, { 140, 314, 452, 679, 1019, 1528 } },
113 // QFHD
114 { 3840, 2160, { { 24, false } }, { 145, 328, 471, 707, 1061, 1591 } },
115 { 3840, 2160, { { 25, false } }, { 151, 342, 492, 737, 1106, 1659 } },
116 { 3840, 2160, { { 30, false } }, { 182, 410, 589, 884, 1326, 1989 } },
117 { 3840, 2160, { { 50, false } }, { 303, 684, 983, 1475, 2212, 3318 } },
118 { 3840, 2160, { { 60, false } }, { 363, 821, 1178, 1768, 2652, 3977 } },
119 // 4K
120 { 4096, 2160, { { 24, false } }, { 155, 350, 503, 754, 1131, 1697 } },
121 { 4096, 2160, { { 25, false } }, { 162, 365, 524, 786, 1180, 1769 } },
122 { 4096, 2160, { { 30, false } }, { 194, 437, 629, 943, 1414, 2121 } },
123 { 4096, 2160, { { 50, false } }, { 323, 730, 1049, 1573, 2359, 3539 } },
124 { 4096, 2160, { { 60, false } }, { 388, 875, 1257, 1886, 2828, 4242 } },
125 // 5K
126 { 5120, 2700, { { 24, false } }, { 243, 547, 786, 1178, 1768, 2652 } },
127 { 5120, 2700, { { 25, false } }, { 253, 570, 819, 1229, 1843, 2765 } },
128 { 5120, 2700, { { 30, false } }, { 304, 684, 982, 1473, 2210, 3314 } },
129 { 5120, 2700, { { 50, false } }, { 507, 1140, 1638, 2458, 3686, 5530 } },
130 { 5120, 2700, { { 60, false } }, { 608, 1367, 1964, 2946, 4419, 6629 } },
131 // 6K
132 { 6144, 3240, { { 24, false } }, { 350, 788, 1131, 1697, 2545, 3818 } },
133 { 6144, 3240, { { 25, false } }, { 365, 821, 1180, 1769, 2654, 3981 } },
134 { 6144, 3240, { { 30, false } }, { 437, 985, 1414, 2121, 3182, 4772 } },
135 { 6144, 3240, { { 50, false } }, { 730, 1643, 2359, 3539, 5308, 7962 } },
136 { 6144, 3240, { { 60, false } }, { 875, 1969, 2828, 4242, 6364, 9545 } },
137 // 8K
138 { 8192, 4320, { { 24, false } }, { 622, 1400, 2011, 3017, 4525, 6788 } },
139 { 8192, 4320, { { 25, false } }, { 649, 1460, 2097, 3146, 4719, 7078 } },
140 { 8192, 4320, { { 30, false } }, { 778, 1750, 2514, 3771, 5657, 8485 } },
141 { 8192, 4320, { { 50, false } }, { 1298, 2920, 4194, 6291, 9437, 14156 } },
142 { 8192, 4320, { { 60, false } }, { 1556, 3500, 5028, 7542, 11313, 16970 } }

145const FFmpeg_Transcoder::DEVICETYPE_MAP FFmpeg_Transcoder::m_devicetype_map =
146{
147 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_VAAPI, AV_PIX_FMT_NV12 },
148 #if 0
149 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_CUDA, AV_PIX_FMT_CUDA },
150 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_VDPAU, AV_PIX_FMT_YUV420P },
151 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_QSV, AV_PIX_FMT_QSV },
152 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_OPENCL, AV_PIX_FMT_OPENCL },
153 #if HAVE_VULKAN_HWACCEL
154 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_VULKAN, AV_PIX_FMT_VULKAN },
155 #endif // HAVE_VULKAN_HWACCEL
156 #if __APPLE__
157 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_VIDEOTOOLBOX, AV_PIX_FMT_VIDEOTOOLBOX },
158 #endif // __APPLE__
159 #if __ANDROID__
160 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_MEDIACODEC, AV_PIX_FMT_MEDIACODEC },
161 #endif // __ANDROID__
162 #if _WIN32
163 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_DRM, AV_PIX_FMT_DRM_PRIME },
164 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_DXVA2, AV_PIX_FMT_DXVA2_VLD },
165 { AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_D3D11VA, AV_PIX_FMT_D3D11VA_VLD },
166 #endif // _WIN32
167 #endif
168};
169
170FFmpeg_Transcoder::StreamRef::StreamRef() :
171 m_codec_ctx(nullptr),
172 m_stream(nullptr),
173 m_stream_idx(INVALID_STREAM),
174 m_start_time(0)
175{
176
177}
178FFmpeg_Transcoder::StreamRef::~StreamRef()
179{
180 reset();
181}
182
183template< typename T >
184struct av_context_deleter
185{
190 void operator ()( T * p) const
191 {
192 avcodec_free_context(&p);
193 }
194};
195
196void FFmpeg_Transcoder::StreamRef::set_codec_ctx(AVCodecContext *codec_ctx)
197{
198 if (codec_ctx != nullptr)
199 {
200 std::shared_ptr<AVCodecContext> sp(codec_ctx, av_context_deleter<AVCodecContext>());
201
202 m_codec_ctx = sp;
203 }
204 else
205 {
206 m_codec_ctx.reset();
207 }
208}
209
210void FFmpeg_Transcoder::StreamRef::reset()
211{
212 m_codec_ctx.reset();
213}
214
215#pragma GCC diagnostic push
216#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wmissing-field-initializers"
217FFmpeg_Transcoder::FFmpeg_Transcoder()
218 : m_fileio(nullptr)
219 , m_close_fileio(true)
220 , m_last_seek_frame_no(0)
221 , m_have_seeked(false)
222 , m_skip_next_frame(false)
223 , m_is_video(false)
224 , m_cur_sample_fmt(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE)
225 , m_cur_sample_rate(-1)
226 , m_audio_resample_ctx(nullptr)
227 , m_audio_fifo(nullptr)
228 , m_sws_ctx(nullptr)
229 , m_buffer_sink_context(nullptr)
230 , m_buffer_source_context(nullptr)
231 , m_filter_graph(nullptr)
232 , m_pts(AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
233 , m_pos(AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
234 , m_current_segment(1)
235 , m_insert_keyframe(true)
236 , m_copy_audio(false)
237 , m_copy_video(false)
238 , m_current_format(nullptr)
239 , m_buffer(nullptr)
240 , m_reset_pts(0)
241 , m_fake_frame_no(0)
242 , m_hwaccel_enc_mode(HWACCELMODE_NONE)
243 , m_hwaccel_dec_mode(HWACCELMODE_NONE)
244 , m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering(false)
245 , m_hwaccel_enable_dec_buffering(false)
246 , m_hwaccel_enc_device_ctx(nullptr)
247 , m_hwaccel_dec_device_ctx(nullptr)
248 , m_enc_hw_pix_fmt(AV_PIX_FMT_NONE)
249 , m_dec_hw_pix_fmt(AV_PIX_FMT_NONE)
250 , m_active_stream_msk(0)
251 , m_inhibit_stream_msk(0)
252{
253#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
254 Logging::trace(nullptr, "The FFmpeg trancoder is ready to initialise.");
255
256 std::memset(&m_mtime, 0, sizeof(m_mtime));
257
258#if LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
259 av_channel_layout_default(&m_cur_ch_layout, params.m_audiochannels);
260#else // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
261 m_cur_channel_layout = static_cast<uint64_t>(av_get_default_channel_layout(params.m_audiochannels));
262#endif // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
263
264 // Initialise ID3v1.1 tag structure
265 init_id3v1(&m_out.m_id3v1);
266}
267
268FFmpeg_Transcoder::~FFmpeg_Transcoder()
269{
270 // Close files and resample context
271 closeio();
272
273 Logging::trace(nullptr, "The FFmpeg transcoder object was destroyed.");
274}
275
276bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::is_video() const
277{
278 bool is_video = false;
279
280 if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
281 {
282 is_video = !is_album_art(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->codec_id, &m_in.m_video.m_stream->r_frame_rate);
283 }
284
285 return is_video;
286}
287
288bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::is_open() const
289{
290 return (m_in.m_format_ctx != nullptr);
291}
292
293int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_input_file(LPVIRTUALFILE virtualfile, FileIO *fio)
294{
295 AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
296 int ret;
297
298 if (virtualfile == nullptr)
299 {
300 Logging::error(filename(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_input_file()! virtualfile is NULL.");
301 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
302 }
303
304 m_virtualfile = virtualfile;
305
306 m_mtime = m_virtualfile->m_st.st_mtime;
307 m_current_format = params.current_format(m_virtualfile);
308
309 if (is_open())
310 {
311 Logging::warning(filename(), "The file is already open.");
312 return 0;
313 }
314
315 // This allows selecting if the demuxer should consider all streams to be
316 // found after the first PMT and add further streams during decoding or if it rather
317 // should scan all that are within the analyze-duration and other limits
318 ret = dict_set_with_check(&opt, "scan_all_pmts", "1", AV_DICT_DONT_OVERWRITE);
319 if (ret < 0)
320 {
321 return ret;
322 }
323
324 // avioflags direct: Reduce buffering.
325 //ret = dict_set_with_check(&opt, "avioflags", "direct", AV_DICT_DONT_OVERWRITE);
326 //if (ret < 0)
327 //{
328 // return ret;
329 //}
330
331 // analyzeduration: Defaults to 5,000,000 microseconds = 5 seconds.
332 ret = dict_set_with_check(&opt, "analyzeduration", "15000000", 0); // <<== honored: 15 seconds
333 if (ret < 0)
334 {
335 return ret;
336 }
337
338 // probesize: 5000000 by default.
339 ret = dict_set_with_check(&opt, "probesize", "15000000", 0); // <<== honoured: ~15 MB
340 if (ret < 0)
341 {
342 return ret;
343 }
344
345 // using own I/O
346 if (fio == nullptr)
347 {
348 // Open new file io
349 m_fileio = FileIO::alloc(m_virtualfile->m_type);
350 m_close_fileio = true; // do not close and delete
351 }
352 else
353 {
354 // Use already open file io
355 m_fileio = fio;
356 m_close_fileio = false; // must not close or delete
357 }
358
359 if (m_fileio == nullptr)
360 {
361 int orgerrno = errno;
362 Logging::error(filename(), "Error opening file: (%1) %2", errno, strerror(errno));
363 return AVERROR(orgerrno);
364 }
365
366 ret = m_fileio->openio(m_virtualfile);
367 if (ret)
368 {
369 return AVERROR(ret);
370 }
371
372 m_in.m_format_ctx = avformat_alloc_context();
373 if (m_in.m_format_ctx == nullptr)
374 {
375 Logging::error(filename(), "Out of memory opening file: format context could not be allocated.");
376 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
377 }
378
379 unsigned char *iobuffer = static_cast<unsigned char *>(av_malloc(m_fileio->bufsize() + FF_INPUT_BUFFER_PADDING_SIZE));
380 if (iobuffer == nullptr)
381 {
382 Logging::error(filename(), "Out of memory opening file: I/O buffer could not be allocated.");
383 avformat_free_context(m_in.m_format_ctx);
384 m_in.m_format_ctx = nullptr;
385 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
386 }
387
388 AVIOContext * pb = avio_alloc_context(
389 iobuffer,
390 static_cast<int>(m_fileio->bufsize()),
391 0,
392 static_cast<void *>(m_fileio),
393 input_read,
394 nullptr, // input_write
395 seek); // input_seek
396 m_in.m_format_ctx->pb = pb;
397
398#if IF_DECLARED_CONST
399 const AVInputFormat * infmt = nullptr;
400#else // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
401 AVInputFormat * infmt = nullptr;
402#endif // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
403
404#ifdef USE_LIBVCD
405 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_VCD)
406 {
407 Logging::debug(filename(), "To avoid misdetection, forcing MPEG format for VCD source.");
408 infmt = av_find_input_format("mpeg");
409 }
410#endif // USE_LIBVCD
411#ifdef USE_LIBDVD
412 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
413 {
414 Logging::debug(filename(), "To avoid misdetection, forcing MPEG format for DVD source.");
415 infmt = av_find_input_format("mpeg");
416 }
417#endif // USE_LIBDVD
418#ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
419 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY)
420 {
421 Logging::debug(filename(), "To avoid misdetection, forcing MPEGTS format for Blu-ray source.");
422 infmt = av_find_input_format("mpegts");
423 }
424#endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
425
448 // Open the input file to read from it.
449 ret = avformat_open_input(&m_in.m_format_ctx, filename(), infmt, &opt);
450 if (ret < 0)
451 {
452 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not open input file (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
453 return ret;
454 }
455
456 m_in.m_filetype = get_filetype_from_list(m_in.m_format_ctx->iformat->name);
457
458#if HAVE_AV_FORMAT_INJECT_GLOBAL_SIDE_DATA
459 av_format_inject_global_side_data(m_in.m_format_ctx);
460#endif
461
462 // Get information on the input file (number of streams etc.).
463 ret = avformat_find_stream_info(m_in.m_format_ctx, nullptr);
464 if (ret < 0)
465 {
466 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not find stream info (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
467 return ret;
468 }
469
470#ifdef USE_LIBDVD
471 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
472 {
473 // FFmpeg API calculates a wrong duration, so use value from IFO
474 m_in.m_format_ctx->duration = m_fileio->duration();
475 }
476#endif // USE_LIBDVD
477#ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
478 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY)
479 {
480 // FFmpeg API calculates a wrong duration, so use value from Blu-ray directory
481 m_in.m_format_ctx->duration = m_fileio->duration();
482 }
483#endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
484
485 m_virtualfile->m_duration = m_in.m_format_ctx->duration;
486
487 ret = open_bestmatch_video();
488 if (ret < 0)
489 {
490 // Already logged
491 return ret;
492 }
493
494#ifdef USE_LIBDVD
495 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD && m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
496 {
497 // FFmpeg API sometimes cannot detect video size or frame rate, so use value from IFO
498 if (!m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->width || !m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height)
499 {
500 m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->width = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->width = m_virtualfile->m_width;
501 m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->height = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height = m_virtualfile->m_height;
502 }
503 if (!m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate.den)
504 {
505 m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate = m_virtualfile->m_framerate;
506 }
507 }
508#endif // USE_LIBDVD
509#ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
510 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY && m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
511 {
512 // FFmpeg API sometimes cannot detect video size or frame rate, so use value from Blu-ray directory
513 if (!m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->width || !m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height)
514 {
515 m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->width = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->width = m_virtualfile->m_width;
516 m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->height = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height = m_virtualfile->m_height;
517 }
518 if (!m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate.den)
519 {
520 m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate = m_virtualfile->m_framerate;
521 }
522 }
523#endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
524
525 ret = open_bestmatch_audio();
526 if (ret < 0)
527 {
528 // Already logged
529 return ret;
530 }
531
532 if (!stream_exists(m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx) && !stream_exists(m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx))
533 {
534 Logging::error(filename(), "The file contains neither a video nor an audio stream.");
535 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
536 }
537
538 if (!params.m_no_subtitles)
539 {
540 ret = open_subtitles();
541 if (ret < 0)
542 {
543 // Already logged
544 return ret;
545 }
546 }
547
548 // Predict size of transcoded file as exact as possible
549 m_virtualfile->m_predicted_size = calculate_predicted_filesize();
550
551 // Calculate number or video frames in file based on duration and frame rate
552 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate.den)
553 {
554 // Number of frames: should be quite accurate
555 m_virtualfile->m_video_frame_count = static_cast<uint32_t>(ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, av_inv_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate)));
556 }
557
558 ret = open_albumarts();
559 if (ret < 0)
560 {
561 // Already logged
562 return ret;
563 }
564
565 if (m_virtualfile->m_flags & VIRTUALFLAG_CUESHEET)
566 {
567 // Position to start of cue sheet track
568 ret = av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, -1, m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_start, 0);
569 if (ret < 0)
570 {
571 Logging::error(filename(), "The track start was nout found (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
572 return ret;
573 }
574 }
575
576 return 0;
577}
578
579int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_bestmatch_video()
580{
581 // Issue #80: Open input video codec, but only if target supports video.
582 // Saves resources: no need to decode video frames if not used.
583 if (m_current_format->video_codec() != AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
584 {
585 int ret;
586
587 // Open best match video codec
588 AVCodecContext * codec_ctx = nullptr;
589 ret = open_bestmatch_decoder(m_in.m_format_ctx, &codec_ctx, &m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO);
590 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_STREAM_NOT_FOUND) // AVERROR_STREAM_NOT_FOUND is not an error
591 {
592 Logging::error(filename(), "The video codec could not be opened (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
593 return ret;
594 }
595 m_in.m_video.set_codec_ctx(codec_ctx);
596
597 if (stream_exists(m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx))
598 {
599 // We have a video stream
600 // Check to see if encoder hardware acceleration is both requested and supported by codec.
601 std::string hw_encoder_codec_name;
602 if (!get_hw_encoder_name(m_current_format->video_codec(), &hw_encoder_codec_name))
603 {
604 // API supports hardware frame buffers
605 m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering = (params.m_hwaccel_enc_device_type != AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_NONE);
606 }
607
608 if (m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering)
609 {
610 // Hardware buffers available, enabling encoder hardware accceleration.
611 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Hardware encoder frame buffering %1 is enabled.", get_hwaccel_API_text(params.m_hwaccel_enc_API).c_str());
612 ret = hwdevice_ctx_create(&m_hwaccel_enc_device_ctx, params.m_hwaccel_enc_device_type, params.m_hwaccel_enc_device);
613 if (ret < 0)
614 {
615 Logging::error(virtname(), "Failed to create a %1 device for encoding (error %2).", get_hwaccel_API_text(params.m_hwaccel_enc_API).c_str(), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
616 return ret;
617 }
618 Logging::info(virtname(), "Hardware encoder acceleration and frame buffering are active using codec '%1'.", hw_encoder_codec_name.c_str());
619 }
620 else if (params.m_hwaccel_enc_device_type != AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_NONE)
621 {
622 // No hardware acceleration, fallback to software,
623 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Hardware encoder frame buffering %1 is not supported by codec '%2'. Falling back to software.", get_hwaccel_API_text(params.m_hwaccel_enc_API).c_str(), get_codec_name(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->codec_id, true));
624 }
625 else if (!hw_encoder_codec_name.empty())
626 {
627 // No frame buffering (e.g. OpenMAX or MMAL), but hardware acceleration possible.
628 Logging::info(virtname(), "Hardware encoder acceleration is active using codec '%1'.", hw_encoder_codec_name.c_str());
629 }
630
631 m_in.m_video.m_stream = m_in.m_format_ctx->streams[m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx];
632
633#ifdef USE_LIBDVD
634 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
635 {
636 // FFmpeg API calculates a wrong duration, so use value from IFO
637 m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
638 }
639#endif // USE_LIBDVD
640#ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
641 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY)
642 {
643 // FFmpeg API calculates a wrong duration, so use value from Blu-ray
644 m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
645 }
646#endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
647
648 video_info(false, m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream);
649
650 m_is_video = is_video();
651
652#if !LAVC_DEP_FLAG_TRUNCATED
653#ifdef AV_CODEC_CAP_TRUNCATED
654 if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->codec->capabilities & AV_CODEC_CAP_TRUNCATED)
655 {
656 m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->flags|= AV_CODEC_FLAG_TRUNCATED; // we do not send complete frames
657 }
658#else
659#warning "Your FFMPEG distribution is missing AV_CODEC_CAP_TRUNCATED flag. Probably requires fixing!"
660#endif
661#endif // !LAVC_DEP_FLAG_TRUNCATED
662 }
663 }
664 return 0;
665}
666
667int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_bestmatch_audio()
668{
669 int ret;
670
671 // Open best match audio codec
672 AVCodecContext * codec_ctx = nullptr;
673 ret = open_bestmatch_decoder(m_in.m_format_ctx, &codec_ctx, &m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx, AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO);
674 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_STREAM_NOT_FOUND) // AVERROR_STREAM_NOT_FOUND is not an error
675 {
676 Logging::error(filename(), "The audio codec could not be opened (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
677 return ret;
678 }
679 m_in.m_audio.set_codec_ctx(codec_ctx);
680
681 if (stream_exists(m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx))
682 {
683 // We have an audio stream
684 m_in.m_audio.m_stream = m_in.m_format_ctx->streams[m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx];
685
686#ifdef USE_LIBDVD
687 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
688 {
689 // FFmpeg API calculates a wrong duration, so use value from IFO
690 m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
691 }
692#endif // USE_LIBDVD
693#ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
694 if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY)
695 {
696 // FFmpeg API calculates a wrong duration, so use value from Blu-ray directory
697 m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
698 }
699#endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
700
701 audio_info(false, m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_audio.m_stream);
702 }
703 return 0;
704}
705
706int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_subtitles()
707{
708 // If target supports subtitles, check to transcode subtitles
709 for (int stream_idx = 0; stream_idx < static_cast<int>(m_in.m_format_ctx->nb_streams); stream_idx++)
710 {
711 AVStream * stream = m_in.m_format_ctx->streams[stream_idx];
712
713 if (avcodec_get_type(stream->codecpar->codec_id) != AVMEDIA_TYPE_SUBTITLE)
714 {
715 continue;
716 }
717
718 if (m_current_format->subtitle_codec(stream->codecpar->codec_id) == AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
719 {
720 // No match, no support for this type of subtitle
721 continue;
722 }
723
724 AVCodecContext * codec_ctx = nullptr;
725 int ret;
726
727 ret = open_decoder(m_in.m_format_ctx, &codec_ctx, stream_idx, nullptr, AVMEDIA_TYPE_SUBTITLE);
728 if (ret < 0)
729 {
730 Logging::error(filename(), "The subtitle codec could not be opened (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
731 return ret;
732 }
733
734 codec_ctx->pkt_timebase = codec_ctx->time_base = stream->time_base;
735
736 StreamRef input_streamref;
737
738 // We have a subtitle stream
739 input_streamref.set_codec_ctx(codec_ctx);
740 input_streamref.m_stream = stream;
741 input_streamref.m_stream_idx = stream_idx;
742
743 m_in.m_subtitle.insert(std::make_pair(input_streamref.m_stream_idx, input_streamref));
744
745 subtitle_info(false, m_in.m_format_ctx, input_streamref.m_stream);
746 }
747 return 0;
748}
749
750int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_albumarts()
751{
752 // Open album art streams if present and supported by both source and target
753 if (!params.m_noalbumarts && m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr)
754 {
755 for (int stream_idx = 0; stream_idx < static_cast<int>(m_in.m_format_ctx->nb_streams); stream_idx++)
756 {
757 AVStream *input_stream = m_in.m_format_ctx->streams[stream_idx];
758
759 if (is_album_art(input_stream->codecpar->codec_id, &input_stream->r_frame_rate))
760 {
761 StreamRef streamref;
762 AVCodecContext * input_codec_ctx;
763 int ret;
764
765 Logging::trace(filename(), "Found album art.");
766
767 ret = open_decoder(m_in.m_format_ctx, &input_codec_ctx, stream_idx, nullptr, AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO);
768 if (ret < 0)
769 {
770 Logging::error(filename(), "The album art codec could not be opened (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
771 return ret;
772 }
773
774 streamref.set_codec_ctx(input_codec_ctx);
775 streamref.m_stream = input_stream;
776 streamref.m_stream_idx = input_stream->index;
777
778 m_in.m_album_art.push_back(streamref);
779 }
780 }
781 }
782 return 0;
783}
784
785bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::can_copy_stream(const AVStream *stream) const
786{
787 if (params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_OFF)
788 {
789 // Auto copy disabled
790 return false;
791 }
792
793 if (stream == nullptr)
794 {
795 // Should normally not happen: Input stream stream unknown, no way to check - no auto copy
796 return false;
797 }
798
799 AVMediaType codec_type = stream->codecpar->codec_type;
800 AVCodecID codec_in = stream->codecpar->codec_id;
801 std::string codec_type_str;
802 AVCodecID codec_out;
803 int64_t bitrate_out;
804 if (codec_type == AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO)
805 {
806 codec_type_str = "video";
807 codec_out = m_current_format->video_codec();
808 bitrate_out = params.m_videobitrate;
809 }
810 else if (codec_type == AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO)
811 {
812 codec_type_str = "audio";
813 codec_out = m_current_format->audio_codec();
814 bitrate_out = params.m_audiobitrate;
815 }
816 else
817 {
818 // Codec is not video or audio
819 return false;
820 }
821
822 if ((params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_MATCH || params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_MATCHLIMIT))
823 {
824 // Any codec supported by output format OK
825 const AVOutputFormat* oformat = av_guess_format(nullptr, virtname(), nullptr);
826 if (oformat->codec_tag == nullptr || av_codec_get_tag(oformat->codec_tag, stream->codecpar->codec_id) <= 0)
827 {
828 // Codec not supported - no auto copy
829 return false;
830 }
831 }
832 else if ((params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_STRICT || params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_STRICTLIMIT))
833 {
834 // Output codec must strictly match
835 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Check autocopy strict: %1: %2 -> %3", codec_type_str.c_str(), avcodec_get_name(codec_in), avcodec_get_name(codec_out));
836 if (codec_in != codec_out)
837 {
838 // Different codecs - no auto copy
839 return false;
840 }
841 }
842
843 if (params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_MATCHLIMIT || params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_STRICTLIMIT)
844 {
845 BITRATE orig_bit_rate = (stream->codecpar->bit_rate != 0) ? stream->codecpar->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
846 if (get_output_bit_rate(orig_bit_rate, bitrate_out))
847 {
848 // Bit rate changed, no auto copy
849 Logging::info(virtname(), "Because the bit rate has changed, no auto copy is possible.");
850 return false;
851 }
852 }
853
854 return true;
855}
856
857int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output_file(Buffer *buffer)
858{
859 if (buffer == nullptr)
860 {
861 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output_file()! buffer == nullptr in open_output_file()");
862 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
863 }
864
865 m_out.m_filetype = m_current_format->filetype();
866
867 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Opening the output file.");
868
869 if (!stream_exists(m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx) && m_current_format->video_codec() == AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
870 {
871 Logging::error(virtname(), "Unable to transcode. The source contains no audio stream, but the target just supports audio.");
872 m_virtualfile->m_flags |= VIRTUALFLAG_HIDDEN; // Hide file from now on
873 return AVERROR(ENOENT); // Report file not found
874 }
875
876 if (!is_frameset())
877 {
878 // Not a frame set, open regular buffer
879 return open_output(buffer);
880 }
881 else
882 {
883 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Opening frame set type '%1'.", m_current_format->desttype().c_str());
884
885 // Open frame set buffer
886 return open_output_frame_set(buffer);
887 }
888}
889
890int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_bestmatch_decoder(AVFormatContext *format_ctx, AVCodecContext **codec_ctx, int *stream_idx, AVMediaType type)
891{
892#if IF_DECLARED_CONST
893 const AVCodec *input_codec = nullptr;
894#else // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
895 AVCodec *input_codec = nullptr;
896#endif // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
897 int ret;
898
899 *codec_ctx = nullptr;
900 *stream_idx = INVALID_STREAM;
901
902 ret = av_find_best_stream(format_ctx, type, INVALID_STREAM, INVALID_STREAM, &input_codec, 0);
903 if (ret < 0)
904 {
905 if (ret != AVERROR_STREAM_NOT_FOUND) // Not an error
906 {
907 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not find a %1 stream in the input file (error '%2').", get_media_type_string(type), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
908 }
909 return ret;
910 }
911
912 *stream_idx = ret;
913
914 return open_decoder(format_ctx, codec_ctx, *stream_idx, input_codec, type);
915}
916
917#if IF_DECLARED_CONST
918AVPixelFormat FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_hw_pix_fmt(const AVCodec *codec, AVHWDeviceType dev_type, bool use_device_ctx) const
919#else // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
920AVPixelFormat FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_hw_pix_fmt(AVCodec *codec, AVHWDeviceType dev_type, bool use_device_ctx) const
921#endif // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
922{
923 AVPixelFormat hw_pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
924
925 if (codec != nullptr && dev_type != AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_NONE)
926 {
927 int method = use_device_ctx ? AV_CODEC_HW_CONFIG_METHOD_HW_DEVICE_CTX : AV_CODEC_HW_CONFIG_METHOD_HW_FRAMES_CTX;
928
929 for (int i = 0;; i++)
930 {
931 const AVCodecHWConfig *config = avcodec_get_hw_config(codec, i);
932 if (!config)
933 {
934 Logging::error(av_codec_is_decoder(codec) ? filename() : virtname(), "%1 '%2' does not support device type %3.\n", av_codec_is_encoder(codec) ? "Encoder" : "Decoder", codec->name, hwdevice_get_type_name(dev_type));
935 break;
936 }
937
938 if ((config->methods & method) && (config->device_type == dev_type))
939 {
940 hw_pix_fmt = config->pix_fmt;
941 Logging::debug(av_codec_is_decoder(codec) ? filename() : virtname(), "%1 '%2' requests %3 for device type %4.\n", av_codec_is_encoder(codec) ? "Encoder" : "Decoder", codec->name, av_get_pix_fmt_name(hw_pix_fmt), hwdevice_get_type_name(dev_type));
942 break;
943 }
944 }
945 }
946
947 return hw_pix_fmt;
948}
949
950#if IF_DECLARED_CONST
951int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_decoder(AVFormatContext *format_ctx, AVCodecContext **codec_ctx, int stream_idx, const AVCodec *input_codec, AVMediaType mediatype)
952#else // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
953int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_decoder(AVFormatContext *format_ctx, AVCodecContext **codec_ctx, int stream_idx, AVCodec *input_codec, AVMediaType mediatype)
954#endif // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
955{
956 while (true)
957 {
958 AVCodecContext *input_codec_ctx = nullptr;
959 AVStream * input_stream = nullptr;
960 AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
961 AVCodecID codec_id = AV_CODEC_ID_NONE;
962 int ret;
963
964 input_stream = format_ctx->streams[stream_idx];
965
966 // Init the decoders, with or without reference counting
967 // av_dict_set_with_check(&opt, "refcounted_frames", refcount ? "1" : "0", 0);
968
969 // allocate a new decoding context
970 input_codec_ctx = avcodec_alloc_context3(nullptr);
971 if (input_codec_ctx == nullptr)
972 {
973 Logging::error(filename(), "Decoding context could not be allocated.");
974 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
975 }
976
977 // initialise the stream parameters with demuxer information
978 ret = avcodec_parameters_to_context(input_codec_ctx, input_stream->codecpar);
979 if (ret < 0)
980 {
981 return ret;
982 }
983
984 codec_id = input_stream->codecpar->codec_id;
985
986 if (params.m_hwaccel_dec_API != HWACCELAPI_NONE)
987 {
988 if (mediatype == AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO)
989 {
990 if (check_hwaccel_dec_blocked(input_stream->codecpar->codec_id, input_stream->codecpar->profile))
991 {
992 const char *profile = ::avcodec_profile_name(codec_id, input_stream->codecpar->profile);
993 Logging::info(filename(), "Codec '%1' profile '%2' is blocked from hardware decoding. Reverting to software decoder.", ::get_codec_name(codec_id), profile != nullptr ? profile : "unknown");
994 m_hwaccel_dec_mode = HWACCELMODE_FALLBACK;
995 }
996 }
997
998 if (mediatype == AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO && m_hwaccel_dec_mode != HWACCELMODE_FALLBACK)
999 {
1000 // Decide whether to use a hardware decoder
1001 // Check to see if decoder hardware acceleration is both requested and supported by codec.
1002 std::string hw_decoder_codec_name;
1003 if (!get_hw_decoder_name(input_codec_ctx->codec_id, &hw_decoder_codec_name))
1004 {
1005 m_dec_hw_pix_fmt = get_hw_pix_fmt(input_codec, params.m_hwaccel_dec_device_type, true);
1006
1007 m_hwaccel_enable_dec_buffering = (params.m_hwaccel_dec_device_type != AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_NONE && m_dec_hw_pix_fmt != AV_PIX_FMT_NONE);
1008 //{
1009 // std::string fourcc2str;
1010 // fourcc_make_string(&fourcc2str, input_codec_ctx->codec_tag);
1011 // fprintf(stderr, "fourcc2str %s\n", fourcc2str.c_str());
1012 //}
1013 }
1014
1015 if (m_hwaccel_enable_dec_buffering)
1016 {
1017 // Hardware buffers available, enabling decoder hardware acceleration.
1018 Logging::trace(filename(), "Hardware decoder frame buffering %1 is enabled.", get_hwaccel_API_text(params.m_hwaccel_dec_API).c_str());
1019 ret = hwdevice_ctx_create(&m_hwaccel_dec_device_ctx, params.m_hwaccel_dec_device_type, params.m_hwaccel_dec_device);
1020 if (ret < 0)
1021 {
1022 Logging::error(filename(), "Failed to create a %1 device for decoding (error %2).", get_hwaccel_API_text(params.m_hwaccel_dec_API).c_str(), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1023 return ret;
1024 }
1025
1026 Logging::info(filename(), "Hardware decoder acceleration and frame buffering are active using codec '%1'.", (input_codec != nullptr) ? input_codec->name : "unknown");
1027
1028 m_hwaccel_dec_mode = HWACCELMODE_ENABLED; // Hardware acceleration active
1029 }
1030 else if (params.m_hwaccel_dec_device_type != AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_NONE)
1031 {
1032 // No hardware acceleration, fallback to software,
1033 Logging::debug(filename(), "Hardware decoder frame buffering %1 not supported by codec '%2'. Falling back to software.", get_hwaccel_API_text(params.m_hwaccel_dec_API).c_str(), get_codec_name(input_codec_ctx->codec_id, true));
1034 }
1035 else if (!hw_decoder_codec_name.empty())
1036 {
1037 // No frame buffering (e.g. OpenMAX or MMAL), but hardware acceleration possible.
1038 // Open hw_decoder_codec_name codec here
1039 input_codec = avcodec_find_decoder_by_name(hw_decoder_codec_name.c_str());
1040
1041 if (input_codec == nullptr)
1042 {
1043 Logging::error(filename(), "Decoder '%1' could not be found.", hw_decoder_codec_name.c_str());
1044 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1045 }
1046
1047 Logging::info(filename(), "Hardware decoder acceleration is active using codec '%1'.", input_codec->name);
1048
1049 m_hwaccel_dec_mode = HWACCELMODE_ENABLED; // Hardware acceleration active
1050 }
1051
1052 if (m_hwaccel_enable_dec_buffering)
1053 {
1054 ret = hwdevice_ctx_add_ref(input_codec_ctx);
1055 if (ret < 0)
1056 {
1057 return ret;
1058 }
1059 }
1060 }
1061 }
1062
1063 if (input_codec == nullptr)
1064 {
1065 // Find a decoder for the stream.
1066 input_codec = avcodec_find_decoder(codec_id);
1067
1068 if (input_codec == nullptr)
1069 {
1070 Logging::error(filename(), "Failed to find %1 input codec '%2'.", get_media_type_string(mediatype), avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
1071 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1072 }
1073 }
1074
1075 input_codec_ctx->codec_id = input_codec->id;
1076
1077 //input_codec_ctx->time_base = input_stream->time_base;
1078
1079 ret = avcodec_open2(input_codec_ctx, input_codec, &opt);
1080
1081 av_dict_free(&opt);
1082
1083 if (ret < 0)
1084 {
1085 if (m_hwaccel_dec_mode == HWACCELMODE_ENABLED)
1086 {
1087 Logging::info(filename(), "Unable to use %1 input codec '%2' with hardware acceleration. Falling back to software.", get_media_type_string(mediatype), avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
1088
1089 m_hwaccel_dec_mode = HWACCELMODE_FALLBACK;
1090 m_hwaccel_enable_dec_buffering = false;
1091 m_dec_hw_pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
1092
1093 // Free hardware device contexts if open
1094 hwdevice_ctx_free(&m_hwaccel_dec_device_ctx);
1095
1096 m_in.m_video.reset();
1097
1098 // Try again with a software decoder
1099 continue;
1100 }
1101
1102 Logging::error(filename(), "Failed to open %1 input codec for stream #%1 (error '%2').", get_media_type_string(mediatype), input_stream->index, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1103 return ret;
1104 }
1105
1106 Logging::debug(filename(), "Opened input codec for stream #%1: %2", input_stream->index, get_codec_name(codec_id, true));
1107
1108 *codec_ctx = input_codec_ctx;
1109
1110 return 0;
1111 };
1112}
1113
1114int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output_frame_set(Buffer *buffer)
1115{
1116 const AVCodec * output_codec = nullptr;
1117 AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx = nullptr;
1118 AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
1119 int ret = 0;
1120
1121 m_buffer = buffer;
1122 {
1123 std::lock_guard<std::recursive_mutex> lock_seek_to_fifo_mutex(m_seek_to_fifo_mutex);
1124 while (m_seek_to_fifo.size())
1125 {
1126 m_seek_to_fifo.pop();
1127 }
1128 }
1129 m_have_seeked = false;
1130
1131 output_codec = avcodec_find_encoder(m_current_format->video_codec());
1132 if (output_codec == nullptr)
1133 {
1134 Logging::error(virtname(), "Codec not found.");
1135 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1136 }
1137
1138 output_codec_ctx = avcodec_alloc_context3(output_codec);
1139 if (output_codec_ctx == nullptr)
1140 {
1141 Logging::error(virtname(), "The video codec context could not be allocated.");
1142 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1143 }
1144
1145 output_codec_ctx->bit_rate = 400000;
1146 output_codec_ctx->width = m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->width;
1147 output_codec_ctx->height = m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->height;
1148 output_codec_ctx->time_base = {1, 25};
1149
1150 const AVPixFmtDescriptor *dst_desc = av_pix_fmt_desc_get(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->pix_fmt);
1151 int loss = 0;
1152
1153 output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = avcodec_find_best_pix_fmt_of_list(output_codec->pix_fmts, m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->pix_fmt, (dst_desc->flags & AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_ALPHA) ? 1 : 0, &loss);
1154
1155 if (output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt == AV_PIX_FMT_NONE)
1156 {
1157 // No best match found, use default
1158 switch (m_current_format->video_codec())
1159 {
1160 case AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG:
1161 {
1162 output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ444P;
1163 break;
1164 }
1165 case AV_CODEC_ID_PNG:
1166 {
1167 output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_RGB24;
1168 break;
1169 }
1170 case AV_CODEC_ID_BMP:
1171 {
1172 output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_BGR24;
1173 break;
1174 }
1175 default:
1176 {
1177 break;
1178 }
1179 }
1180 Logging::debug(virtname(), "There was no best match output pixel format found, so we used the default: %1", get_pix_fmt_name(output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt).c_str());
1181 }
1182 else
1183 {
1184 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Output pixel format: %1", get_pix_fmt_name(output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt).c_str());
1185 }
1186
1187
1188 switch (m_current_format->video_codec())
1189 {
1190 case AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG:
1191 {
1192 // set -strict -1 for JPG
1193 dict_set_with_check(&opt, "strict", "-1", 0);
1194
1195 // Allow the use of unoffical extensions
1196 output_codec_ctx->strict_std_compliance = FF_COMPLIANCE_UNOFFICIAL;
1197 break;
1198 }
1199 case AV_CODEC_ID_PNG:
1200 {
1201 output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_RGB24;
1202 break;
1203 }
1204 case AV_CODEC_ID_BMP:
1205 {
1206 output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_BGR24;
1207 break;
1208 }
1209 default:
1210 {
1211 break;
1212 }
1213 }
1214
1215 //codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio = frame->sample_aspect_ratio;
1216 //codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio = m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio;
1217
1218 ret = avcodec_open2(output_codec_ctx, output_codec, &opt);
1219 if (ret < 0)
1220 {
1221 Logging::error(virtname(), "The image codec could not be opened.");
1222 return ret;
1223 }
1224
1225 // Initialise pixel format conversion and rescaling if necessary
1226 get_pix_formats(&m_in.m_pix_fmt, &m_out.m_pix_fmt, output_codec_ctx);
1227
1228 ret = init_rescaler(m_in.m_pix_fmt, m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->width, m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height, m_out.m_pix_fmt, output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height);
1229 if (ret < 0)
1230 {
1231 return ret;
1232 }
1233
1234 if (params.m_deinterlace)
1235 {
1236 ret = init_deinterlace_filters(output_codec_ctx, m_in.m_pix_fmt, m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
1237 if (ret < 0)
1238 {
1239 return ret;
1240 }
1241 }
1242
1243 m_out.m_video.set_codec_ctx(output_codec_ctx);
1244 m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx = INVALID_STREAM;
1245 m_out.m_video.m_stream = nullptr;
1246
1247 // No audio
1248 m_out.m_audio.set_codec_ctx(nullptr);
1249 m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx = INVALID_STREAM;
1250 m_out.m_audio.m_stream = nullptr;
1251
1252 // Open for read/write
1253 // Pre-allocate the predicted file size to reduce memory reallocations
1254 size_t buffsize = predicted_filesize() * video_frame_count();
1255
1256 if (!buffer->open_file(0, CACHE_FLAG_RW, buffsize))
1257 {
1258 return AVERROR(EPERM);
1259 }
1260
1261 return 0;
1262}
1263
1264int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output(Buffer *buffer)
1265{
1266 int ret = 0;
1267
1268 m_buffer = buffer;
1269 m_insert_keyframe = false;
1270
1271 if (!m_out.m_video_pts && is_hls())
1272 {
1273 m_current_segment = 1;
1274 Logging::info(virtname(), "Starting HLS segment no. %1 of %2.", m_current_segment, m_virtualfile->get_segment_count());
1275 }
1276
1277 while (true)
1278 {
1279 // Open the output file for writing. If buffer == nullptr continue using existing buffer.
1280 ret = open_output_filestreams(buffer);
1281 if (ret)
1282 {
1283 if (m_hwaccel_enc_mode == HWACCELMODE_ENABLED)
1284 {
1285 Logging::info(virtname(), "Unable to use output codec '%1' with hardware acceleration. Falling back to software.", avcodec_get_name(m_current_format->video_codec()));
1286
1287 m_hwaccel_enc_mode = HWACCELMODE_FALLBACK;
1288 m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering = false;
1289 m_enc_hw_pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
1290
1291 // Free hardware device contexts if open
1292 hwdevice_ctx_free(&m_hwaccel_enc_device_ctx);
1293
1294 close_output_file();
1295
1296 // Try again with a software decoder
1297 continue;
1298 }
1299 return ret;
1300 }
1301 break;
1302 }
1303
1304 if (stream_exists(m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx))
1305 {
1306 audio_info(true, m_out.m_format_ctx, m_out.m_audio.m_stream);
1307
1308 if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
1309 {
1310 // If not just copying the stream, initialise the audio FIFO buffer to store audio samples to be encoded.
1311 ret = init_audio_fifo();
1312 if (ret)
1313 {
1314 return ret;
1315 }
1316 }
1317 }
1318
1319 if (stream_exists(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx))
1320 {
1321 video_info(true, m_out.m_format_ctx, m_out.m_video.m_stream);
1322 }
1323
1324 for (const auto & [key, value] : m_out.m_subtitle)
1325 {
1326 subtitle_info(true, m_out.m_format_ctx, value.m_stream);
1327 }
1328
1329 // Open for read/write
1330 // Pre-allocate the predicted file size to reduce memory reallocations
1331 size_t buffsize = predicted_filesize();
1332 if (!buffer->open_file(0, CACHE_FLAG_RW, buffsize))
1333 {
1334 return AVERROR(EPERM);
1335 }
1336
1337 ret = process_output();
1338 if (ret)
1339 {
1340 return ret;
1341 }
1342
1343 // process_output() calls avformat_write_header which feels free to change the stream time bases sometimes.
1344 // This means we have to do the following calculations here to use the correct values, otherwise this can cause
1345 // a lot of havoc.
1346
1347 if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && m_out.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
1348 {
1349 m_in.m_audio.m_start_time = m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time;
1350 m_out.m_audio.m_start_time = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
1351 m_out.m_audio.m_stream->start_time = m_out.m_audio.m_start_time;
1352 }
1353 else
1354 {
1355 m_in.m_audio.m_start_time = 0;
1356 m_out.m_audio.m_start_time = 0;
1357 if (m_out.m_audio.m_stream)
1358 {
1359 m_out.m_audio.m_stream->start_time = AV_NOPTS_VALUE;
1360 }
1361 }
1362
1363 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && m_out.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
1364 {
1365 m_in.m_video.m_start_time = m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time;
1366 m_out.m_video.m_start_time = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
1367 m_out.m_video.m_stream->start_time = m_out.m_video.m_start_time;
1368 }
1369 else
1370 {
1371 m_in.m_video.m_start_time = 0;
1372 m_out.m_video.m_start_time = 0;
1373 if (m_out.m_video.m_stream)
1374 {
1375 m_out.m_video.m_stream->start_time = AV_NOPTS_VALUE;
1376 }
1377 }
1378
1379 for (auto & [key, value] : m_out.m_subtitle)
1380 {
1381 StreamRef * out_streamref = get_out_subtitle_stream(map_in_to_out_stream(key));
1382 if (out_streamref != nullptr)
1383 {
1384 value.m_start_time = value.m_stream->start_time;
1385 out_streamref->m_start_time = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(value.m_stream->start_time, value.m_stream->time_base, out_streamref->m_stream->time_base);
1386 out_streamref->m_stream->start_time = out_streamref->m_start_time;
1387 }
1388 }
1389
1390 m_out.m_audio_pts = m_out.m_audio.m_start_time;
1391 m_out.m_video_pts = m_out.m_video.m_start_time;
1392 m_out.m_last_mux_dts = AV_NOPTS_VALUE;
1393
1394 return 0;
1395}
1396
1397int FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_output()
1398{
1399 // Process metadata. The decoder will call the encoder to set appropriate
1400 // tag values for the output file.
1401 int ret = process_metadata();
1402 if (ret)
1403 {
1404 return ret;
1405 }
1406
1407 // Write the header of the output file container.
1408 ret = write_output_file_header();
1409 if (ret)
1410 {
1411 return ret;
1412 }
1413
1414 // Process album arts: copy all from source file to target.
1415 return process_albumarts();
1416}
1417
1418bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_output_sample_rate(int input_sample_rate, int max_sample_rate, int *output_sample_rate /*= nullptr*/)
1419{
1420 if (input_sample_rate > max_sample_rate)
1421 {
1422 if (output_sample_rate != nullptr)
1423 {
1424 *output_sample_rate = max_sample_rate;
1425 }
1426 return true;
1427 }
1428 else
1429 {
1430 if (output_sample_rate != nullptr)
1431 {
1432 *output_sample_rate = input_sample_rate;
1433 }
1434 return false;
1435 }
1436}
1437
1438bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_output_bit_rate(BITRATE input_bit_rate, BITRATE max_bit_rate, BITRATE * output_bit_rate /*= nullptr*/)
1439{
1440 if (!input_bit_rate || input_bit_rate > max_bit_rate)
1441 {
1442 if (output_bit_rate != nullptr)
1443 {
1444 *output_bit_rate = max_bit_rate;
1445 }
1446 return true;
1447 }
1448 else
1449 {
1450 if (output_bit_rate != nullptr)
1451 {
1452 *output_bit_rate = input_bit_rate;
1453 }
1454 return false;
1455 }
1456}
1457
1458bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_aspect_ratio(int width, int height, const AVRational & sar, AVRational *ar) const
1459{
1460 // Try to determine display aspect ratio
1461 AVRational dar;
1462
1463 ::av_reduce(&dar.num, &dar.den,
1464 static_cast<int64_t>(width) * sar.num,
1465 static_cast<int64_t>(height) * sar.den,
1466 1024 * 1024);
1467
1468 ar->num = ar->den = 0;
1469
1470 if (dar.num && dar.den)
1471 {
1472 *ar = dar;
1473 }
1474
1475 // If that fails, try sample aspect ratio instead
1476 if (!ar->den && sar.num != 0 && sar.den != 0)
1477 {
1478 *ar = sar;
1479 }
1480
1481 // If even that fails, try to use video size
1482 if (!ar->den && height)
1483 {
1484 ar->num = width;
1485 ar->den = height;
1486 }
1487
1488 if (!ar->den)
1489 {
1490 // Return false if all above failed
1491 return false;
1492 }
1493
1494 ::av_reduce(&ar->num, &ar->den,
1495 ar->num,
1496 ar->den,
1497 1024 * 1024);
1498
1499 return true;
1500}
1501
1502bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_video_size(int *output_width, int *output_height) const
1503{
1504 if (!params.m_videowidth && !params.m_videoheight)
1505 {
1506 // No options, leave as is
1507 return false;
1508 }
1509
1510 int input_width = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->width;
1511 int input_height = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height;
1512 AVRational sar = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->sample_aspect_ratio;
1513
1514 if (params.m_videowidth && params.m_videoheight)
1515 {
1516 // Both width/source set. May look strange, but this is an order...
1517 *output_width = params.m_videowidth;
1518 *output_height = params.m_videoheight;
1519 }
1520 else if (params.m_videowidth)
1521 {
1522 // Only video width
1523 AVRational ar;
1524
1525 *output_width = params.m_videowidth;
1526
1527 if (!get_aspect_ratio(input_width, input_height, sar, &ar))
1528 {
1529 *output_height = input_height;
1530 }
1531 else
1532 {
1533 *output_height = static_cast<int>(params.m_videowidth / av_q2d(ar));
1534 *output_height &= ~(static_cast<int>(0x1)); // height must be multiple of 2
1535 }
1536 }
1537 else //if (params.m_videoheight)
1538 {
1539 // Only video height
1540 AVRational ar;
1541
1542 if (!get_aspect_ratio(input_width, input_height, sar, &ar))
1543 {
1544 *output_width = input_width;
1545 }
1546 else
1547 {
1548 *output_width = static_cast<int>(params.m_videoheight / av_q2d(ar));
1549 *output_width &= ~(static_cast<int>(0x1)); // width must be multiple of 2
1550 }
1551 *output_height = params.m_videoheight;
1552 }
1553
1554 return (input_width > *output_width || input_height > *output_height);
1555}
1556
1557int FFmpeg_Transcoder::update_codec(void *opt, const PROFILE_OPTION_VEC& profile_option_vec) const
1558{
1559 int ret = 0;
1560
1561 for (const PROFILE_OPTION & profile_option : profile_option_vec)
1562 {
1563 if ((m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering && profile_option.m_options & OPT_SW_ONLY) || (!m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering && profile_option.m_options & OPT_HW_ONLY))
1564 {
1565 continue;
1566 }
1567
1568 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Profile codec option -%1%2%3.", profile_option.m_key, *profile_option.m_value ? " " : "", profile_option.m_value);
1569
1570 ret = opt_set_with_check(opt, profile_option.m_key, profile_option.m_value, profile_option.m_flags, virtname());
1571 if (ret < 0)
1572 {
1573 break;
1574 }
1575 }
1576 return ret;
1577}
1578
1579int FFmpeg_Transcoder::prepare_codec(void *opt, FILETYPE filetype) const
1580{
1581 int ret = 0;
1582
1583 for (const PROFILE_LIST & profile : m_profile)
1584 {
1585 if (profile.m_filetype == filetype && profile.m_profile == params.m_profile)
1586 {
1587 ret = update_codec(opt, profile.m_option_codec);
1588 break;
1589 }
1590 }
1591
1592 return ret;
1593}
1594
1595int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_rescaler(AVPixelFormat in_pix_fmt, int in_width, int in_height, AVPixelFormat out_pix_fmt, int out_width, int out_height)
1596{
1597 if (in_pix_fmt != out_pix_fmt || in_width != out_width || in_height != out_height)
1598 {
1599 // Rescale image if required
1600 if (in_pix_fmt != out_pix_fmt)
1601 {
1602 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Initialising pixel format conversion from %1 to %2.", get_pix_fmt_name(in_pix_fmt).c_str(), get_pix_fmt_name(out_pix_fmt).c_str());
1603 }
1604
1605 if (in_width != out_width || in_height != out_height)
1606 {
1607 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Rescaling video size from %1:%2 to %3:%4.",
1608 in_width, in_height,
1609 out_width, out_height);
1610 }
1611
1612 m_sws_ctx = sws_getContext(
1613 // Source settings
1614 in_width, // width
1615 in_height, // height
1616 in_pix_fmt, // format
1617 // Target settings
1618 out_width, // width
1619 out_height, // height
1620 out_pix_fmt, // format
1621 SWS_FAST_BILINEAR, nullptr, nullptr, nullptr); // Maybe SWS_LANCZOS | SWS_ACCURATE_RND
1622 if (m_sws_ctx == nullptr)
1623 {
1624 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate a scaling/conversion context.");
1625 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1626 }
1627 }
1628
1629 return 0;
1630}
1631
1632int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_stream(AVCodecID codec_id)
1633{
1634 AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx = nullptr;
1635 AVStream * output_stream = nullptr;
1636#if IF_DECLARED_CONST
1637 const AVCodec * output_codec = nullptr;
1638#else // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
1639 AVCodec * output_codec = nullptr;
1640#endif // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
1641 AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
1642 int ret;
1643
1644 std::string codec_name;
1645
1646 if (get_hw_encoder_name(codec_id, &codec_name) || m_hwaccel_enc_mode == HWACCELMODE_FALLBACK)
1647 {
1648 // find the encoder
1649 output_codec = avcodec_find_encoder(codec_id);
1650
1651 if (output_codec == nullptr)
1652 {
1653 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not find encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
1654 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1655 }
1656 }
1657 else
1658 {
1659 output_codec = avcodec_find_encoder_by_name(codec_name.c_str());
1660
1661 if (output_codec == nullptr)
1662 {
1663 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not find encoder '%1'.", codec_name.c_str());
1664 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1665 }
1666
1667 //Logging::info(virtname(), "Hardware encoder acceleration active with codec '%1'.", output_codec->name);
1668
1669 m_hwaccel_enc_mode = HWACCELMODE_ENABLED;
1670 }
1671
1672 output_stream = avformat_new_stream(m_out.m_format_ctx, output_codec);
1673 if (output_stream == nullptr)
1674 {
1675 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate stream for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
1676 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1677 }
1678 output_stream->id = static_cast<int>(m_out.m_format_ctx->nb_streams - 1);
1679
1680 output_codec_ctx = avcodec_alloc_context3(output_codec);
1681 if (output_codec_ctx == nullptr)
1682 {
1683 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate an encoding context.");
1684 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1685 }
1686
1687 switch (output_codec->type)
1688 {
1689 case AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO:
1690 {
1691 BITRATE orig_bit_rate;
1692 int orig_sample_rate;
1693
1694 // Set the basic encoder parameters
1695 orig_bit_rate = (m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->bit_rate != 0) ? m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
1696 if (get_output_bit_rate(orig_bit_rate, params.m_audiobitrate, &output_codec_ctx->bit_rate))
1697 {
1698 // Limit bit rate
1699 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Limiting audio bit rate from %1 to %2.",
1700 format_bitrate(orig_bit_rate).c_str(),
1701 format_bitrate(output_codec_ctx->bit_rate).c_str());
1702 }
1703
1704 if (params.m_audiochannels > 0 && get_channels(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get()) > params.m_audiochannels)
1705 {
1706 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Limiting audio channels from %1 to %2.",
1707 get_channels(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get()),
1708 params.m_audiochannels);
1709 set_channels(output_codec_ctx, params.m_audiochannels);
1710 }
1711 else
1712 {
1713 set_channels(output_codec_ctx, m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get());
1714 }
1715
1716#if LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
1717 av_channel_layout_default(&output_codec_ctx->ch_layout, output_codec_ctx->ch_layout.nb_channels);
1718#else // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
1719 output_codec_ctx->channel_layout = static_cast<uint64_t>(av_get_default_channel_layout(output_codec_ctx->channels));
1720#endif // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
1721
1722 output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
1723 orig_sample_rate = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
1724 if (get_output_sample_rate(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->sample_rate, params.m_audiosamplerate, &output_codec_ctx->sample_rate))
1725 {
1726 // Limit sample rate
1727 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Limiting audio sample rate from %1 to %2.",
1728 format_samplerate(orig_sample_rate).c_str(),
1729 format_samplerate(output_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str());
1730 orig_sample_rate = output_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
1731 }
1732
1733 if (output_codec->supported_samplerates != nullptr)
1734 {
1735 // Go through supported sample rates and adjust if necessary
1736 bool supported = false;
1737
1738 for (int n = 0; output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] != 0; n++)
1739 {
1740 if (output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] == output_codec_ctx->sample_rate)
1741 {
1742 // Is supported
1743 supported = true;
1744 break;
1745 }
1746 }
1747
1748 if (!supported)
1749 {
1750 int min_samplerate = 0;
1751 int max_samplerate = INT_MAX;
1752
1753 // Find next lower sample rate in probably unsorted list
1754 for (int n = 0; output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] != 0; n++)
1755 {
1756 if (min_samplerate <= output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] && output_codec_ctx->sample_rate >= output_codec->supported_samplerates[n])
1757 {
1758 min_samplerate = output_codec->supported_samplerates[n];
1759 }
1760 }
1761
1762 // Find next higher sample rate in probably unsorted list
1763 for (int n = 0; output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] != 0; n++)
1764 {
1765 if (max_samplerate >= output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] && output_codec_ctx->sample_rate <= output_codec->supported_samplerates[n])
1766 {
1767 max_samplerate = output_codec->supported_samplerates[n];
1768 }
1769 }
1770
1771 if (min_samplerate != 0 && max_samplerate != INT_MAX)
1772 {
1773 // set to nearest value
1774 if (output_codec_ctx->sample_rate - min_samplerate < max_samplerate - output_codec_ctx->sample_rate)
1775 {
1776 output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = min_samplerate;
1777 }
1778 else
1779 {
1780 output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = max_samplerate;
1781 }
1782 }
1783 else if (min_samplerate != 0)
1784 {
1785 // No higher sample rate, use next lower
1786 output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = min_samplerate;
1787 }
1788 else if (max_samplerate != INT_MAX)
1789 {
1790 // No lower sample rate, use higher lower
1791 output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = max_samplerate;
1792 }
1793 else
1794 {
1795 // Should never happen... There must at least be one.
1796 Logging::error(virtname(), "The codec does not support an audio sample rate of %1.", format_samplerate(output_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str());
1797 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1798 }
1799
1800 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Because the requested value is not supported by codec, the audio sample rate was changed from %1 to %2.",
1801 format_samplerate(orig_sample_rate).c_str(),
1802 format_samplerate(output_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str());
1803 }
1804 }
1805
1806 // If sample format not pre-defined (not AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE), use input file setting.
1807 AVSampleFormat in_sample_format = (m_current_format->sample_format() == AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE) ? m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt : m_current_format->sample_format();
1808 if (output_codec->sample_fmts != nullptr)
1809 {
1810 // Check if input sample format is supported and if so, use it (avoiding resampling)
1811 AVSampleFormat input_fmt_planar = av_get_planar_sample_fmt(in_sample_format);
1812
1813 output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt = AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE;
1814
1815 for (const AVSampleFormat *sample_fmt = output_codec->sample_fmts; *sample_fmt != -1; sample_fmt++)
1816 {
1817 AVSampleFormat output_fmt_planar = av_get_planar_sample_fmt(*sample_fmt);
1818
1819 if (*sample_fmt == in_sample_format ||
1820 (input_fmt_planar != AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE &&
1821 input_fmt_planar == output_fmt_planar))
1822 {
1823 output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt = *sample_fmt;
1824 break;
1825 }
1826 }
1827
1828 // If none of the supported formats match use the first supported
1829 if (output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt == AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE)
1830 {
1831 output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt = output_codec->sample_fmts[0];
1832 }
1833 }
1834 else
1835 {
1836 // If supported sample formats are unknown simply take input format and cross our fingers it'll work...
1837 output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt = in_sample_format;
1838 }
1839
1840 // Set the sample rate for the container.
1841 output_stream->time_base.den = output_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
1842 output_stream->time_base.num = 1;
1843 output_codec_ctx->time_base = output_stream->time_base;
1844
1845 // set -strict -2 for aac (required for FFmpeg 2)
1846 dict_set_with_check(&opt, "strict", "-2", 0);
1847
1848 // Allow the use of the experimental AAC encoder
1849 output_codec_ctx->strict_std_compliance = FF_COMPLIANCE_EXPERIMENTAL;
1850
1851 // Set duration as hint for muxer
1852 if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
1853 {
1854 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
1855 }
1856 else if (m_in.m_format_ctx->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
1857 {
1858 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), output_stream->time_base);
1859 }
1860
1861 //av_dict_set_int(&output_stream->metadata, "DURATION", output_stream->duration, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
1862
1863 // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
1864 m_out.m_audio.set_codec_ctx(output_codec_ctx);
1865 // Save the stream index
1866 m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
1867 // Save output audio stream for faster reference
1868 m_out.m_audio.m_stream = output_stream;
1869
1870 // Update input to output stream map, this is rather boring because currently we only have a single audio stream
1871 add_stream_map(m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx, m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx);
1872 break;
1873 }
1874 case AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO:
1875 {
1876 BITRATE orig_bit_rate;
1877
1878 if (m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering && m_hwaccel_enc_device_ctx != nullptr)
1879 {
1880 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Hardware encoder init: Creating a new hardware frame context for the encoder.", get_hwaccel_API_text(params.m_hwaccel_enc_API).c_str());
1881
1882 m_enc_hw_pix_fmt = get_hw_pix_fmt(output_codec, params.m_hwaccel_enc_device_type, false);
1883
1884 ret = hwframe_ctx_set(output_codec_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), m_hwaccel_enc_device_ctx);
1885 if (ret < 0)
1886 {
1887 return ret;
1888 }
1889 }
1890
1891 output_codec_ctx->codec_id = codec_id;
1892
1893 // Set the basic encoder parameters
1894 orig_bit_rate = (m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->bit_rate != 0) ? m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
1895 if (get_output_bit_rate(orig_bit_rate, params.m_videobitrate, &output_codec_ctx->bit_rate))
1896 {
1897 // Limit sample rate
1898 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Limiting video bit rate from %1 to %2.",
1899 format_bitrate(orig_bit_rate).c_str(),
1900 format_bitrate(output_codec_ctx->bit_rate).c_str());
1901 }
1902
1903 // output_codec_ctx->rc_min_rate = output_codec_ctx->bit_rate * 75 / 100;
1904 // output_codec_ctx->rc_max_rate = output_codec_ctx->bit_rate * 125 / 100;
1905
1906 // output_codec_ctx->qmin = 1;
1907 // output_codec_ctx->qmax = 31;
1908
1909 int width = 0;
1910 int height = 0;
1911 if (get_video_size(&width, &height))
1912 {
1913 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Changing video size from %1/%2 to %3/%4.", output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height, width, height);
1914 output_codec_ctx->width = width;
1915 output_codec_ctx->height = height;
1916 }
1917 else
1918 {
1919 output_codec_ctx->width = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->width;
1920 output_codec_ctx->height = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height;
1921 }
1922
1923 video_stream_setup(output_codec_ctx, output_stream, m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate, m_enc_hw_pix_fmt);
1924
1925 AVRational sample_aspect_ratio = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->sample_aspect_ratio;
1926
1927 if (output_codec_ctx->codec_id != AV_CODEC_ID_VP9 && m_out.m_filetype != FILETYPE_MKV)
1928 {
1929 output_codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio = sample_aspect_ratio;
1930 output_stream->codecpar->sample_aspect_ratio = sample_aspect_ratio;
1931 }
1932
1933 else
1934 {
1935 // WebM and MKV do not respect the aspect ratio and always use 1:1 so we need to rescale "manually".
1942 output_codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio = { 1, 1 };
1943 output_stream->codecpar->sample_aspect_ratio = { 1, 1 };
1944
1945 // Make sure we do not zero width
1946 if (sample_aspect_ratio.num && sample_aspect_ratio.den)
1947 {
1948 output_codec_ctx->width = output_codec_ctx->width * sample_aspect_ratio.num / sample_aspect_ratio.den;
1949 }
1950 //output_codec_ctx->height *= sample_aspect_ratio.den;
1951 }
1952
1953 // Set up optimisations
1954 switch (output_codec_ctx->codec_id)
1955 {
1956 case AV_CODEC_ID_H264:
1957 {
1958 ret = prepare_codec(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, m_out.m_filetype);
1959 if (ret < 0)
1960 {
1961 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set profile for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1962 return ret;
1963 }
1964
1965 // Set constant rate factor to avoid getting huge result files
1966 // The default is 23, but values between 30..40 create properly sized results. Possible values are 0 (lossless) to 51 (very small but ugly results).
1967 //ret = av_opt_set(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "crf", "36", AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
1968 //if (ret < 0)
1969 //{
1970 // Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set 'crf' for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1971 // return ret;
1972 //}
1973
1974 if (m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering)
1975 {
1976 // From libavcodec/vaapi_encode.c:
1977 //
1978 // Rate control mode selection:
1979 // * If the user has set a mode explicitly with the rc_mode option,
1980 // use it and fail if it is not available.
1981 // * If an explicit QP option has been set, use CQP.
1982 // * If the codec is CQ-only, use CQP.
1983 // * If the QSCALE avcodec option is set, use CQP.
1984 // * If bitrate and quality are both set, try QVBR.
1985 // * If quality is set, try ICQ, then CQP.
1986 // * If bitrate and maxrate are set and have the same value, try CBR.
1987 // * If a bitrate is set, try AVBR, then VBR, then CBR.
1988 // * If no bitrate is set, try ICQ, then CQP.
1989
1990 //ret = av_opt_set(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "rc_mode", "CQP", AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
1991 //if (ret < 0)
1992 //{
1993 // Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set 'rc_mode=CQP' for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1994 // return ret;
1995 //}
1996 //ret = av_opt_set(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "qp", "23", AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
1997 //if (ret < 0)
1998 //{
1999 // Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set 'qp' for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2000 // return ret;
2001 //}
2002 output_codec_ctx->global_quality = 34;
2003 }
2004
2005 // Avoid mismatches for H264 and profile
2006 uint8_t *out_val;
2007 ret = av_opt_get(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "profile", 0, &out_val);
2008 if (!ret)
2009 {
2010 if (!strcasecmp(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(out_val), "high"))
2011 {
2012 switch (output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt)
2013 {
2014 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUYV422:
2015 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P:
2016 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ422P:
2017 case AV_PIX_FMT_UYVY422:
2018 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P16LE:
2019 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P16BE:
2020 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P10BE:
2021 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P10LE:
2022 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P9BE:
2023 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P9LE:
2024 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P9BE:
2025 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P9LE:
2026 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P10BE:
2027 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P10LE:
2028 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P16BE:
2029 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P16LE:
2030 case AV_PIX_FMT_NV16:
2031 case AV_PIX_FMT_NV20LE:
2032 case AV_PIX_FMT_NV20BE:
2033 case AV_PIX_FMT_YVYU422:
2034 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P:
2035 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P12BE:
2036 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P12LE:
2037 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P14BE:
2038 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P14LE:
2039 {
2040 ret = av_opt_set(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "profile", "high422", 0);
2041 if (ret < 0)
2042 {
2043 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set profile=high422 for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2044 return ret;
2045 }
2046 break;
2047 }
2048 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P:
2049 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ444P:
2050 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P16LE:
2051 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P16BE:
2052 case AV_PIX_FMT_RGB444LE:
2053 case AV_PIX_FMT_RGB444BE:
2054 case AV_PIX_FMT_BGR444LE:
2055 case AV_PIX_FMT_BGR444BE:
2056 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P9BE:
2057 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P9LE:
2058 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P10BE:
2059 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P10LE:
2060 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP:
2061 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP9BE:
2062 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP9LE:
2063 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP10BE:
2064 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP10LE:
2065 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP16BE:
2066 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP16LE:
2067 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P9BE:
2068 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P9LE:
2069 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P10BE:
2070 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P10LE:
2071 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P16BE:
2072 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P16LE:
2073 case AV_PIX_FMT_XYZ12LE:
2074 case AV_PIX_FMT_XYZ12BE:
2075 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P:
2076 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRAP:
2077 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRAP16BE:
2078 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRAP16LE:
2079 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P12BE:
2080 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P12LE:
2081 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P14BE:
2082 case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P14LE:
2083 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP12BE:
2084 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP12LE:
2085 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP14BE:
2086 case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP14LE:
2087 case AV_PIX_FMT_AYUV64LE:
2088 case AV_PIX_FMT_AYUV64BE:
2089 {
2090 ret = av_opt_set(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "profile", "high444", 0);
2091 if (ret < 0)
2092 {
2093 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set profile=high444 for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2094 return ret;
2095 }
2096 break;
2097 }
2098 default:
2099 {
2100 break;
2101 }
2102 }
2103 }
2104 av_free(out_val);
2105 }
2106 break;
2107 }
2108 case AV_CODEC_ID_VP9:
2109 {
2110 ret = prepare_codec(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, FILETYPE_WEBM);
2111 if (ret < 0)
2112 {
2113 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set profile for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2114 return ret;
2115 }
2116 break;
2117 }
2118 case AV_CODEC_ID_PRORES:
2119 {
2120 ret = prepare_codec(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, FILETYPE_PRORES);
2121 if (ret < 0)
2122 {
2123 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set profile for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2124 return ret;
2125 }
2126
2127 // 0 = ‘proxy’,
2128 // 1 = ‘lt’,
2129 // 2 = ‘standard’,
2130 // 3 = ‘hq’
2131 output_codec_ctx->profile = params.m_level;
2132 break;
2133 }
2134 case AV_CODEC_ID_ALAC:
2135 {
2136 ret = prepare_codec(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, FILETYPE_ALAC);
2137 if (ret < 0)
2138 {
2139 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not set profile for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2140 return ret;
2141 }
2142 break;
2143 }
2144 default:
2145 {
2146 break;
2147 }
2148 }
2149
2150 // Initialise pixel format conversion and rescaling if necessary
2151 get_pix_formats(&m_in.m_pix_fmt, &m_out.m_pix_fmt, output_codec_ctx);
2152
2153 ret = init_rescaler(m_in.m_pix_fmt, m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->width, m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height, m_out.m_pix_fmt, output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height);
2154 if (ret < 0)
2155 {
2156 return ret;
2157 }
2158
2159 // set -strict -2 for aac (required for FFmpeg 2)
2160 dict_set_with_check(&opt, "strict", "-2", 0);
2161
2162 // Allow the use of the experimental AAC encoder
2163 output_codec_ctx->strict_std_compliance = FF_COMPLIANCE_EXPERIMENTAL;
2164
2165#ifdef _DEBUG
2166 print_stream_info(output_stream);
2167#endif // _DEBUG
2168
2169 // Set duration as hint for muxer
2170 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2171 {
2172 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
2173 }
2174 else if (m_in.m_format_ctx->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2175 {
2176 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), output_stream->time_base);
2177 }
2178
2179 //av_dict_set_int(&output_stream->metadata, "DURATION", output_stream->duration, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
2180
2181 // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
2182 m_out.m_video.set_codec_ctx(output_codec_ctx);
2183 // Save the stream index
2184 m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
2185 // Save output video stream for faster reference
2186 m_out.m_video.m_stream = output_stream;
2187
2188 // Update input to output stream map, this is rather boring because currently we only have a single video stream
2189 add_stream_map(m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx);
2190 break;
2191 }
2192 default:
2193 break;
2194 }
2195
2196 // Although docs state this is "Demuxing only", this is actually used by encoders like Matroska/WebM, so we need to set this here.
2197 m_out.m_format_ctx->duration = m_in.m_format_ctx->duration;
2198 if (m_virtualfile->m_flags & VIRTUALFLAG_CUESHEET)
2199 {
2200 av_dict_set_int(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "DURATION", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_duration, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
2201 }
2202 else
2203 {
2204 av_dict_set_int(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "DURATION", m_out.m_format_ctx->duration, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
2205 }
2206
2207 // Some formats want stream headers to be separate.
2208 if (m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags & AVFMT_GLOBALHEADER)
2209 {
2210 output_codec_ctx->flags |= AV_CODEC_FLAG_GLOBAL_HEADER;
2211 }
2212
2213 if (!av_dict_get(opt, "threads", nullptr, 0))
2214 {
2215 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Setting threads to auto for codec %1.", get_codec_name(output_codec_ctx->codec_id));
2216 dict_set_with_check(&opt, "threads", "auto", 0, virtname());
2217 }
2218
2219 // Open the encoder for the stream to use it later.
2220 ret = avcodec_open2(output_codec_ctx, output_codec, &opt);
2221 if (ret < 0)
2222 {
2223 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not open %1 output codec %2 for stream #%3 (error '%4').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), output_stream->index, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2224 return ret;
2225 }
2226
2227 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Opened %1 output codec %2 for stream #%3.", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, true), output_stream->index);
2228
2229 ret = avcodec_parameters_from_context(output_stream->codecpar, output_codec_ctx);
2230 if (ret < 0)
2231 {
2232 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not initialise stream parameters (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2233 return ret;
2234 }
2235
2236 return (output_stream->index);
2237}
2238
2239int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_subtitle_stream(AVCodecID codec_id, StreamRef & input_streamref, const std::optional<std::string> & language)
2240{
2241 AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx = nullptr;
2242 AVStream * output_stream = nullptr;
2243#if IF_DECLARED_CONST
2244 const AVCodec * output_codec = nullptr;
2245#else // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
2246 AVCodec * output_codec = nullptr;
2247#endif // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
2248 AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
2249 int ret;
2250
2251 // find the encoder
2252 output_codec = avcodec_find_encoder(codec_id);
2253
2254 if (output_codec == nullptr)
2255 {
2256 Logging::error(virtname(), "'%1' encoder could not be found.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
2257 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
2258 }
2259
2260 output_stream = avformat_new_stream(m_out.m_format_ctx, output_codec);
2261 if (output_stream == nullptr)
2262 {
2263 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate stream for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
2264 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2265 }
2266 output_stream->id = static_cast<int>(m_out.m_format_ctx->nb_streams - 1);
2267
2268 output_codec_ctx = avcodec_alloc_context3(output_codec);
2269 if (output_codec_ctx == nullptr)
2270 {
2271 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate an encoding context for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
2272 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2273 }
2274
2275 output_stream->time_base = input_streamref.m_stream->time_base;
2276 output_codec_ctx->time_base = output_stream->time_base;
2277
2278 // set -strict -2 for aac (required for FFmpeg 2)
2279 dict_set_with_check(&opt, "strict", "-2", 0);
2280
2281 // Allow the use of the experimental AAC encoder
2282 output_codec_ctx->strict_std_compliance = FF_COMPLIANCE_EXPERIMENTAL;
2283
2284 // Set duration as hint for muxer
2285 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2286 {
2287 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
2288 }
2289 if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2290 {
2291 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
2292 }
2293 else if (m_in.m_format_ctx != nullptr && m_in.m_format_ctx->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2294 {
2295 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), output_stream->time_base);
2296 }
2297
2298 AVCodecContext * input_codec_ctx = input_streamref.m_codec_ctx.get();
2299
2300 if (input_codec_ctx != nullptr && input_codec_ctx->subtitle_header != nullptr)
2301 {
2302 // ASS code assumes this buffer is null terminated so add extra byte.
2303 output_codec_ctx->subtitle_header = static_cast<uint8_t *>(av_mallocz(static_cast<size_t>(input_codec_ctx->subtitle_header_size) + 1));
2304 if (output_codec_ctx->subtitle_header == nullptr)
2305 {
2306 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2307 }
2308 std::memcpy(output_codec_ctx->subtitle_header, input_codec_ctx->subtitle_header, static_cast<size_t>(input_codec_ctx->subtitle_header_size));
2309 output_codec_ctx->subtitle_header_size = input_codec_ctx->subtitle_header_size;
2310 }
2311 else if (output_codec_ctx->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_WEBVTT || output_codec_ctx->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_SUBRIP)
2312 {
2313 // If source had no header, we create a default one
2314 ret = get_script_info(output_codec_ctx,
2315 ASS_DEFAULT_PLAYRESX, ASS_DEFAULT_PLAYRESY,
2316 ASS_DEFAULT_FONT, ASS_DEFAULT_FONT_SIZE, ASS_DEFAULT_COLOUR, ASS_DEFAULT_COLOUR,
2317 ASS_DEFAULT_BACK_COLOUR, ASS_DEFAULT_BACK_COLOUR,
2318 ASS_DEFAULT_BOLD, ASS_DEFAULT_ITALIC, ASS_DEFAULT_UNDERLINE,
2319 ASS_DEFAULT_BORDERSTYLE, ASS_DEFAULT_ALIGNMENT);
2320
2321 if (ret)
2322 {
2323 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not create ASS script info for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
2324 return ret;
2325 }
2326 }
2327
2328 // Open the encoder for the stream to use it later.
2329 ret = avcodec_open2(output_codec_ctx, output_codec, &opt);
2330 if (ret < 0)
2331 {
2332 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not open %1 output codec %2 for stream #%3 (error '%4').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id), output_stream->index, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2333 return ret;
2334 }
2335
2336 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Opened %1 output codec %2 for stream #%3.", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, true), output_stream->index);
2337
2338 ret = avcodec_parameters_from_context(output_stream->codecpar, output_codec_ctx);
2339 if (ret < 0)
2340 {
2341 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not initialise stream parameters (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2342 return ret;
2343 }
2344
2345 if (!language)
2346 {
2347 // Copy language
2348 AVDictionaryEntry *tag = nullptr;
2349
2350 tag = av_dict_get(input_streamref.m_stream->metadata, "language", nullptr, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
2351 if (tag != nullptr)
2352 {
2353 av_dict_set(&output_stream->metadata, "language", tag->value, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
2354 }
2355 }
2356 else
2357 {
2358 // Use predefined value
