2359 av_dict_set(&output_stream->metadata, "language", language->c_str(), AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
2360 }
2361
2362 // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
2363 StreamRef output_streamref;
2364
2365 output_streamref.set_codec_ctx(output_codec_ctx);
2366 // Save the stream index
2367 output_streamref.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
2368 // Save output audio stream for faster reference
2369 output_streamref.m_stream = output_stream;
2370
2371 m_out.m_subtitle.insert(std::make_pair(output_streamref.m_stream_idx, output_streamref));
2372
2373 // Update input to output stream map
2374 add_stream_map(input_streamref.m_stream_idx, output_streamref.m_stream_idx);
2375
2376 return output_streamref.m_stream_idx;
2377}
2378
2379int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_stream_copy(AVCodecID codec_id, AVMediaType codec_type)
2380{
2381 AVStream * output_stream = nullptr;
2382 int ret;
2383
2384 output_stream = avformat_new_stream(m_out.m_format_ctx, nullptr);
2385 if (output_stream == nullptr)
2386 {
2387 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate stream for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
2388 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2389 }
2390 output_stream->id = static_cast<int>(m_out.m_format_ctx->nb_streams - 1);
2391
2392 switch (codec_type)
2393 {
2394 case AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO:
2395 {
2396 ret = avcodec_parameters_copy(output_stream->codecpar, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar);
2397 if (ret < 0)
2398 {
2399 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate an encoding context (error '%2').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2400 return ret;
2401 }
2402
2403 // Set the sample rate for the container.
2404 output_stream->time_base = m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base;
2405
2406 // Set duration as hint for muxer
2407 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
2408
2409 // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
2410 m_out.m_audio.set_codec_ctx(nullptr);
2411 // Save the stream index
2412 m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
2413 // Save output audio stream for faster reference
2414 m_out.m_audio.m_stream = output_stream;
2415
2416 // Update input to output stream map, this is rather boring because currently we only have a single audio stream
2417 add_stream_map(m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx, m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx);
2418 break;
2419 }
2420 case AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO:
2421 {
2422 ret = avcodec_parameters_copy(output_stream->codecpar, m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar);
2423 if (ret < 0)
2424 {
2425 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate an encoding context (error '%2').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2426 return ret;
2427 }
2428
2429 output_stream->time_base = m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base;
2430
2431#ifdef _DEBUG
2432 print_stream_info(output_stream);
2433#endif // _DEBUG
2434
2435 // Set duration as hint for muxer
2436 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
2437
2438 // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
2439 m_out.m_video.set_codec_ctx(nullptr);
2440 // Save the stream index
2441 m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
2442 // Save output video stream for faster reference
2443 m_out.m_video.m_stream = output_stream;
2444
2445 // Update input to output stream map, this is rather boring because currently we only have a single video stream
2446 add_stream_map(m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx);
2447 break;
2448 }
2449 default:
2450 break;
2451 }
2452
2453 output_stream->codecpar->codec_tag = 0;
2454
2455 return 0;
2456}
2457
2458int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_albumart_stream(const AVCodecContext * input_codec_ctx)
2459{
2460 AVCodecContext * output_codec_ctx = nullptr;
2461 AVStream * output_stream = nullptr;
2462 const AVCodec * input_codec = input_codec_ctx->codec;
2463 const AVCodec * output_codec = nullptr;
2464 AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
2465 int ret;
2466
2467 // find the encoder
2468 output_codec = avcodec_find_encoder(input_codec->id);
2469 if (output_codec == nullptr)
2470 {
2471 Logging::error(virtname(), "'%1' encoder could not be found.", avcodec_get_name(input_codec->id));
2472 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
2473 }
2474
2475 // Must be a video codec
2476 if (output_codec->type != AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO)
2477 {
2478 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL TROUBLE! Encoder '%1' is not a video codec.", avcodec_get_name(input_codec->id));
2479 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
2480 }
2481
2482 output_stream = avformat_new_stream(m_out.m_format_ctx, output_codec);
2483 if (output_stream == nullptr)
2484 {
2485 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate stream for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(input_codec->id));
2486 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2487 }
2488 output_stream->id = static_cast<int>(m_out.m_format_ctx->nb_streams - 1);
2489
2490 output_codec_ctx = avcodec_alloc_context3(output_codec);
2491 if (output_codec_ctx == nullptr)
2492 {
2493 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate an encoding context.");
2494 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2495 }
2496
2497 // Ignore missing width/height when adding album arts
2498#if !IF_DECLARED_CONST
2499 m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags |= AVFMT_NODIMENSIONS;
2500#endif // !IF_DECLARED_CONST
2501 // This is required for some reason (let encoder decide?)
2502 // If not set, write header will fail!
2503 //output_codec_ctx->codec_tag = 0; //av_codec_get_tag(of->codec_tag, codec->codec_id);
2504
2505 //output_stream->codec->framerate = { 1, 0 };
2506
2508 // mp4 album arts do not work with ipod profile. Set mp4.
2509 //if (m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->mime_type != nullptr && (!strcmp(m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->mime_type, "application/mp4") || !strcmp(m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->mime_type, "video/mp4")))
2510 //{
2511 // m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->name = "mp4";
2512 // m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->mime_type = "application/mp4";
2513 //}
2514
2515 // copy disposition
2516 // output_stream->disposition = input_stream->disposition;
2517 output_stream->disposition = AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC;
2518
2519 // copy estimated duration as a hint to the muxer
2520 if (output_stream->duration <= 0 && m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration > 0)
2521 {
2522 output_stream->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
2523 }
2524
2525 output_codec_ctx->time_base = { 1, 90000 };
2526 output_stream->time_base = { 1, 90000 };
2527
2528 output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = input_codec_ctx->pix_fmt;
2529 output_codec_ctx->width = input_codec_ctx->width;
2530 output_codec_ctx->height = input_codec_ctx->height;
2531
2532 // Some formats want stream headers to be separate.
2533 if (m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags & AVFMT_GLOBALHEADER)
2534 {
2535 output_codec_ctx->flags |= AV_CODEC_FLAG_GLOBAL_HEADER;
2536 }
2537
2538 // Open the encoder for the stream to use it later.
2539 ret = avcodec_open2(output_codec_ctx, output_codec, &opt);
2540 if (ret < 0)
2541 {
2542 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not open %1 output codec %2 for stream #%3 (error '%4').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(input_codec->id), output_stream->index, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2543 return ret;
2544 }
2545
2546 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Opened album art output codec %1 for stream #%2 (dimensions %3x%4).", get_codec_name(input_codec->id, true), output_stream->index, output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height);
2547
2548 ret = avcodec_parameters_from_context(output_stream->codecpar, output_codec_ctx);
2549 if (ret < 0)
2550 {
2551 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not initialise stream parameters stream #%1 (error '%2').", output_stream->index, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2552 return ret;
2553 }
2554
2555 StreamRef streamref;
2556
2557 streamref.set_codec_ctx(output_codec_ctx);
2558 streamref.m_stream = output_stream;
2559 streamref.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
2560
2561 m_out.m_album_art.push_back(streamref);
2562
2563 return 0;
2564}
2565
2566int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_albumart_frame(AVStream *output_stream, AVPacket *pkt_in)
2567{
2568 AVPacket *tmp_pkt;
2569 int ret = 0;
2570
2571 tmp_pkt = av_packet_clone(pkt_in);
2572 if (tmp_pkt == nullptr)
2573 {
2574 ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2575 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not write album art packet (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2576 return ret;
2577 }
2578
2579 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Adding album art stream #%1.", output_stream->index);
2580
2581 tmp_pkt->stream_index = output_stream->index;
2582 tmp_pkt->flags |= AV_PKT_FLAG_KEY; // Contains a single frame, make sure it's a key frame
2583 tmp_pkt->pos = 0;
2584 tmp_pkt->dts = 0;
2585
2586 ret = store_packet(tmp_pkt, AVMEDIA_TYPE_ATTACHMENT);
2587
2588 av_packet_unref(tmp_pkt);
2589
2590 return ret;
2591}
2592
2593int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output_filestreams(Buffer *buffer)
2594{
2595 m_out.m_filetype = m_current_format->filetype();
2596
2597 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Opening output format '%1'.", m_current_format->desttype().c_str());
2598
2599 // Reset active streams
2600 m_active_stream_msk = 0;
2601 m_inhibit_stream_msk = 0;
2602
2603 // Check if we can copy audio or video.
2604 m_copy_audio = can_copy_stream(m_in.m_audio.m_stream);
2605 m_copy_video = can_copy_stream(m_in.m_video.m_stream);
2606
2607 // Create a new format context for the output container format.
2608 if (m_current_format->format_name() != "m4a")
2609 {
2610 avformat_alloc_output_context2(&m_out.m_format_ctx, nullptr, m_current_format->format_name().c_str(), nullptr);
2611 }
2612 else
2613 {
2614 avformat_alloc_output_context2(&m_out.m_format_ctx, nullptr, nullptr, ".m4a");
2615 }
2616
2617 if (m_out.m_format_ctx == nullptr)
2618 {
2619 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate an output format context.");
2620 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2621 }
2622
2623 if (!m_is_video)
2624 {
2625 m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx = INVALID_STREAM;
2626 }
2627
2628 //video_codec = m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->video_codec;
2629
2630 // Open video streams
2631 if (stream_exists(m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx) && m_current_format->video_codec() != AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
2632 {
2633 m_active_stream_msk |= FFMPEGFS_VIDEO;
2634
2635 if (!m_copy_video)
2636 {
2637 int ret;
2638
2639 ret = add_stream(m_current_format->video_codec());
2640 if (ret < 0)
2641 {
2642 return ret;
2643 }
2644
2645 if (params.m_deinterlace)
2646 {
2647 // Init deinterlace filters
2648 ret = init_deinterlace_filters(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), m_in.m_pix_fmt, m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
2649 if (ret < 0)
2650 {
2651 return ret;
2652 }
2653 }
2654 }
2655 else
2656 {
2657 int ret;
2658
2659 Logging::info(virtname(), "Copying video stream.");
2660
2661 ret = add_stream_copy(m_current_format->video_codec(), AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO);
2662 if (ret < 0)
2663 {
2664 return ret;
2665 }
2666 }
2667 }
2668
2669 // Open audio streams
2670 if (stream_exists(m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx) && m_current_format->audio_codec() != AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
2671 {
2672 m_active_stream_msk |= FFMPEGFS_AUDIO;
2673
2674 if (!m_copy_audio)
2675 {
2676 int ret;
2677
2678 ret = add_stream(m_current_format->audio_codec());
2679 if (ret < 0)
2680 {
2681 return ret;
2682 }
2683 }
2684 else
2685 {
2686 int ret;
2687
2688 Logging::info(virtname(), "Copying audio stream.");
2689
2690 ret = add_stream_copy(m_current_format->audio_codec(), AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO);
2691 if (ret < 0)
2692 {
2693 return ret;
2694 }
2695 }
2696 }
2697
2698 if (stream_exists(m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx) && m_current_format->video_codec() != AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
2699 {
2700 int ret;
2701
2702 // Open subtitle streams
2703 if (m_in.m_subtitle.size())
2704 {
2705 // No copy option, not worth it for a few frames
2706 // Create as many subtitle streams as required
2707 ret = add_subtitle_streams();
2708 if (ret < 0)
2709 {
2710 return ret;
2711 }
2712 }
2713
2714 // Open streams for external subtitle files
2715 ret = add_external_subtitle_streams();
2716 if (ret < 0)
2717 {
2718 return ret;
2719 }
2720 }
2721
2722 if (!params.m_noalbumarts && m_current_format->albumart_supported())
2723 {
2724 for (StreamRef & album_art : m_in.m_album_art)
2725 {
2726 int ret;
2727
2728 ret = add_albumart_stream(album_art.m_codec_ctx.get());
2729 if (ret < 0)
2730 {
2731 return ret;
2732 }
2733 }
2734 }
2735
2736 const int buf_size = 5*1024*1024;
2737 unsigned char *iobuffer = static_cast<unsigned char *>(av_malloc(buf_size + FF_INPUT_BUFFER_PADDING_SIZE));
2738 if (iobuffer == nullptr)
2739 {
2740 Logging::error(virtname(), "Out of memory opening output file: Unable to allocate I/O buffer.");
2741 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2742 }
2743
2744 // open the output file
2745 m_out.m_format_ctx->pb = avio_alloc_context(
2746 iobuffer,
2747 buf_size,
2748 1,
2749 static_cast<void *>(buffer),
2750 nullptr, // read not required
2751 output_write, // write
2752 (m_current_format->audio_codec() != AV_CODEC_ID_OPUS) ? seek : nullptr); // seek
2753
2754 if (m_out.m_format_ctx->pb == nullptr)
2755 {
2756 Logging::error(virtname(), "Out of memory opening output file: Unable to allocate format context.");
2757 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2758 }
2759
2760 return 0;
2761}
2762
2763int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_subtitle_streams()
2764{
2765 for (auto & [key, value] : m_in.m_subtitle)
2766 {
2767 AVCodecID codec_id = m_current_format->subtitle_codec(value.m_stream->codecpar->codec_id); // Get matching output codec
2768
2769 if (codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
2770 {
2771 // No matching output codec
2772 continue;
2773 }
2774
2775 if (map_in_to_out_stream(value.m_stream_idx) != INVALID_STREAM)
2776 {
2777 // Already existing
2778 continue;
2779 }
2780
2781 //m_active_stream_msk |= FFMPEGFS_SUBTITLE;
2782
2783 int ret;
2784
2785 ret = add_subtitle_stream(codec_id, value);
2786 if (ret < 0)
2787 {
2788 return ret;
2789 }
2790 }
2791 return 0;
2792}
2793
2794int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_resampler()
2795{
2796 // Fail save: if channel layout not known assume mono or stereo
2797#if LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2798 if (!m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout.nb_channels)
2799 {
2800 av_channel_layout_default(&m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout, 2);
2801 }
2802#else // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2803 if (!m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout)
2804 {
2805 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout = static_cast<uint64_t>(av_get_default_channel_layout(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels));
2806 }
2807 if (!m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout)
2808 {
2809 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout = AV_CH_LAYOUT_STEREO;
2810 }
2811#endif // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2812
2813 // Only initialise the resampler if it is necessary, i.e.,
2814 // if and only if the sample formats differ.
2815#if LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2816 if (m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt == m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt &&
2817 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate == m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate &&
2818 !av_channel_layout_compare(&m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout, &m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout))
2819#else // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2820 if (m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt == m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt &&
2821 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate == m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate &&
2822 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout == m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout)
2823#endif // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2824 {
2825 // Formats are same
2826 close_resample();
2827 return 0;
2828 }
2829
2830 if ((m_audio_resample_ctx == nullptr) ||
2831 (m_cur_sample_fmt != m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt) ||
2832 (m_cur_sample_rate != m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate) ||
2833 #if LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2834 av_channel_layout_compare(&m_cur_ch_layout, &m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout))
2835#else // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2836 (m_cur_channel_layout != m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout))
2837#endif // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2838 {
2839 int ret;
2840
2841#if LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2842 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Creating audio resampler: %1 -> %2 / %3 -> %4 / %5 -> %6.",
2843 get_sample_fmt_name(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt).c_str(),
2844 get_sample_fmt_name(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt).c_str(),
2845 format_samplerate(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str(),
2846 format_samplerate(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str(),
2847 get_channel_layout_name(&m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout).c_str(),
2848 get_channel_layout_name(&m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout).c_str());
2849#else // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2850 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Creating audio resampler: %1 -> %2 / %3 -> %4 / %5 -> %6.",
2851 get_sample_fmt_name(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt).c_str(),
2852 get_sample_fmt_name(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt).c_str(),
2853 format_samplerate(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str(),
2854 format_samplerate(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str(),
2855 get_channel_layout_name(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels, m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout).c_str(),
2856 get_channel_layout_name(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels, m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout).c_str());
2857#endif // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2858
2859 close_resample();
2860
2861 m_cur_sample_fmt = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt;
2862 m_cur_sample_rate = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
2863#if LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2864 av_channel_layout_copy(&m_cur_ch_layout, &m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout);
2865#else // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2866 m_cur_channel_layout = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout;
2867#endif // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
2868
2869 // Create a resampler context for the conversion.
2870 // Set the conversion parameters.
2871#if SWR_DEP_ALLOC_SET_OPTS
2872 ret = swr_alloc_set_opts2(&m_audio_resample_ctx,
2873 &m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout,
2874 m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt,
2875 m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate,
2876 &m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout,
2877 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt,
2878 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate,
2879 0, nullptr);
2880 if (ret < 0)
2881 {
2882 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate resample context (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2883 return ret;
2884 }
2885#else
2886 m_audio_resample_ctx = swr_alloc_set_opts(nullptr,
2887 static_cast<int64_t>(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout),
2888 m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt,
2889 m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate,
2890 static_cast<int64_t>(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout),
2891 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt,
2892 m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate,
2893 0, nullptr);
2894 if (m_audio_resample_ctx == nullptr)
2895 {
2896 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate a resample context.");
2897 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2898 }
2899#endif
2900
2901 // Open the resampler with the specified parameters.
2902 ret = swr_init(m_audio_resample_ctx);
2903 if (ret < 0)
2904 {
2905 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not open resampler context (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2906 swr_free(&m_audio_resample_ctx);
2907 m_audio_resample_ctx = nullptr;
2908 return ret;
2909 }
2910 }
2911 return 0;
2912}
2913
2914int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_audio_fifo()
2915{
2916 // Create the audio FIFO buffer based on the specified output sample format.
2917 m_audio_fifo = av_audio_fifo_alloc(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt, get_channels(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get()), 1);
2918 if (m_audio_fifo == nullptr)
2919 {
2920 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate an audio FIFO.");
2921 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2922 }
2923 return 0;
2924}
2925
2926int FFmpeg_Transcoder::update_format(AVDictionary** dict, const PROFILE_OPTION_VEC &option_vec) const
2927{
2928 int ret = 0;
2929
2930 for (const PROFILE_OPTION & option : option_vec)
2931 {
2932 if ((option.m_options & OPT_AUDIO) && stream_exists(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx))
2933 {
2934 // Option for audio only, but file contains video stream
2935 continue;
2936 }
2937
2938 if ((option.m_options & OPT_VIDEO) && !stream_exists(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx))
2939 {
2940 // Option for video, but file contains no video stream
2941 continue;
2942 }
2943
2944 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Profile format option -%1%2%3.", option.m_key, *option.m_value ? " " : "", option.m_value);
2945
2946 ret = dict_set_with_check(dict, option.m_key, option.m_value, option.m_flags, virtname());
2947 if (ret < 0)
2948 {
2949 break;
2950 }
2951 }
2952 return ret;
2953}
2954
2955int FFmpeg_Transcoder::prepare_format(AVDictionary** dict, FILETYPE filetype) const
2956{
2957 int ret = 0;
2958
2959 for (const PROFILE_LIST & profile : m_profile)
2960 {
2961 if (profile.m_filetype == filetype && profile.m_profile == params.m_profile)
2962 {
2963 ret = update_format(dict, profile.m_option_format);
2964 break;
2965 }
2966 }
2967
2968 if (filetype == FILETYPE_MP4 || filetype == FILETYPE_PRORES || filetype == FILETYPE_TS || filetype == FILETYPE_HLS)
2969 {
2970 // All
2971 dict_set_with_check(dict, "flags:a", "+global_header", 0, virtname());
2972 dict_set_with_check(dict, "flags:v", "+global_header", 0, virtname());
2973 }
2974
2975 return ret;
2976}
2977
2978int FFmpeg_Transcoder::create_fake_wav_header() const
2979{
2980 // Insert fake WAV header (fill in size fields with estimated values instead of setting to -1)
2981 AVIOContext * output_io_context = static_cast<AVIOContext *>(m_out.m_format_ctx->pb);
2982 Buffer *buffer = static_cast<Buffer *>(output_io_context->opaque);
2983 size_t current_offset = buffer->tell();
2984 size_t read_offset = 0;
2985 WAV_HEADER wav_header;
2986 WAV_LIST_HEADER list_header;
2987 WAV_DATA_HEADER data_header;
2988
2989 buffer->copy(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&wav_header), 0, sizeof(WAV_HEADER));
2990 read_offset = sizeof(WAV_HEADER);
2991
2992 if (wav_header.m_audio_format == 0xfffe)
2993 {
2994 //WAV_HEADER_EX wav_header_ex;
2995 WAV_FACT wav_fact;
2996
2997 //buffer->copy(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&wav_header_ex), read_offset, sizeof(WAV_HEADER_EX));
2998 read_offset += sizeof(WAV_HEADER_EX); // Need to skip extension header
2999
3000 // Check for presence of "fact" chunk
3001 buffer->copy(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&wav_fact), read_offset, sizeof(WAV_FACT));
3002 if (!memcmp(&wav_fact.m_chunk_id, "fact", sizeof(wav_fact.m_chunk_id)))
3003 {
3004 read_offset += sizeof(WAV_FACT); // Also skip fact header
3005 }
3006 }
3007
3008 // Read list header
3009 buffer->copy(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&list_header), read_offset, sizeof(WAV_LIST_HEADER));
3010 read_offset += sizeof(WAV_LIST_HEADER) + list_header.m_data_bytes - 4;
3011 // Read data header
3012 buffer->copy(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&data_header), read_offset, sizeof(WAV_DATA_HEADER));
3013
3014 // Fill in size fields with predicted size
3015 wav_header.m_wav_size = static_cast<unsigned int>(predicted_filesize() - 8);
3016 data_header.m_data_bytes = static_cast<unsigned int>(predicted_filesize() - (read_offset + sizeof(WAV_DATA_HEADER)));
3017#if __BYTE_ORDER == __BIG_ENDIAN
3018 wav_header.m_wav_size = __builtin_bswap32(wav_header.m_wav_size);
3019 data_header.m_data_bytes = __builtin_bswap32(data_header.m_data_bytes);
3020#endif
3021
3022 // Write updated wav header
3023 buffer->seek(0, SEEK_SET);
3024 buffer->writeio(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&wav_header), sizeof(WAV_HEADER));
3025
3026 // Write updated data header
3027 buffer->seek(static_cast<long>(read_offset), SEEK_SET);
3028 buffer->writeio(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&data_header), sizeof(WAV_DATA_HEADER));
3029
3030 // Restore write position
3031 buffer->seek(static_cast<long>(current_offset), SEEK_SET);
3032
3033 return 0;
3034}
3035
3036int FFmpeg_Transcoder::read_aiff_chunk(Buffer *buffer, size_t *buffoffset, const char *ID, uint8_t *chunk, size_t *size) const
3037{
3038 AIFF_CHUNK *p = reinterpret_cast<AIFF_CHUNK*>(chunk);
3039 size_t buffsize = *size;
3040
3041 for (;;)
3042 {
3043 if (!buffer->copy(chunk, *buffoffset, buffsize))
3044 {
3045 return -1;
3046 }
3047
3048 if (buffer->eof())
3049 {
3050 errno = 0;
3051 return -1;
3052 }
3053
3054 if (!memcmp(&p->m_ckID, AIFF_FORMID, sizeof(p->m_ckID)))
3055 {
3056 // Special case: FormChunk has a fixed size
3057 *size = sizeof(AIFF_FORMCHUNK);
3058 }
3059 else
3060 {
3061#if __BYTE_ORDER == __BIG_ENDIAN
3062 *size = p->m_ckSize + 8;
3063#else
3064 *size = __builtin_bswap32(p->m_ckSize) + 8;
3065#endif
3066 }
3067
3068 if (!memcmp(&p->m_ckID, ID, sizeof(p->m_ckID)))
3069 {
3070 // Found
3071 break;
3072 }
3073
3074 // Advance to next potential position
3075 *buffoffset += *size;
3076 }
3077
3078 return 0;
3079}
3080
3081int FFmpeg_Transcoder::create_fake_aiff_header() const
3082{
3083 // Insert fake WAV header (fill in size fields with estimated values instead of setting to -1)
3084 AVIOContext * output_io_context = static_cast<AVIOContext *>(m_out.m_format_ctx->pb);
3085 Buffer *buffer = static_cast<Buffer *>(output_io_context->opaque);
3086 size_t current_offset = buffer->tell();
3087 size_t read_offset = 0;
3088 size_t size;
3089 AIFF_FORMCHUNK form_chunk;
3090 AIFF_COMMONCHUNK common_chunk;
3091
3092 size = sizeof(form_chunk);
3093 if (read_aiff_chunk(buffer, &read_offset, AIFF_FORMID, reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&form_chunk), &size))
3094 {
3095 return -1;
3096 }
3097
3098 read_offset += size;
3099
3100 form_chunk.m_ckSize = static_cast<uint32_t>(predicted_filesize() - 8);
3101#if __BYTE_ORDER != __BIG_ENDIAN
3102 form_chunk.m_ckSize = __builtin_bswap32(form_chunk.m_ckSize);
3103#endif
3104
3105 size = sizeof(common_chunk);
3106 if (read_aiff_chunk(buffer, &read_offset, AIFF_COMMONID, reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&common_chunk), &size))
3107 {
3108 return -1;
3109 }
3110
3111 read_offset += size;
3112
3113 AIFF_SOUNDDATACHUNK sounddata_chunk;
3114
3115 size = sizeof(sounddata_chunk);
3116 if (read_aiff_chunk(buffer, &read_offset, AIFF_SOUNDATAID, reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&sounddata_chunk), &size))
3117 {
3118 return -1;
3119 }
3120
3121 sounddata_chunk.m_ckSize = static_cast<uint32_t>(predicted_filesize() - read_offset);
3122#if __BYTE_ORDER != __BIG_ENDIAN
3123 sounddata_chunk.m_ckSize = __builtin_bswap32(sounddata_chunk.m_ckSize);
3124#endif
3125
3126 // Write updated AIFF header
3127 buffer->seek(0, SEEK_SET);
3128 buffer->writeio(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&form_chunk), sizeof(form_chunk));
3129
3130 // Write updated data header
3131 buffer->seek(static_cast<long>(read_offset), SEEK_SET);
3132 buffer->writeio(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&sounddata_chunk), sizeof(sounddata_chunk));
3133
3134 // Restore write position
3135 buffer->seek(static_cast<long>(current_offset), SEEK_SET);
3136
3137 return 0;
3138}
3139
3140int FFmpeg_Transcoder::write_output_file_header()
3141{
3142 AVDictionary* dict = nullptr;
3143 int ret;
3144
3145 ret = prepare_format(&dict, m_out.m_filetype);
3146 if (ret < 0)
3147 {
3148 return ret;
3149 }
3150
3151 ret = avformat_write_header(m_out.m_format_ctx, &dict);
3152 if (ret < 0)
3153 {
3154 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not write output file header (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3155 return ret;
3156 }
3157
3158 switch (m_current_format->filetype())
3159 {
3160 case FILETYPE_WAV:
3161 {
3162 ret = create_fake_wav_header();
3163 break;
3164 }
3165 case FILETYPE_AIFF:
3166 {
3167 ret = create_fake_aiff_header();
3168 break;
3169 }
3170 default:
3171 {
3172 break;
3173 }
3174 }
3175
3176 return ret;
3177}
3178
3179int FFmpeg_Transcoder::alloc_picture(AVFrame *frame, AVPixelFormat pix_fmt, int width, int height) const
3180{
3181 int ret;
3182
3183 frame->format = pix_fmt;
3184 frame->width = width;
3185 frame->height = height;
3186
3187 // allocate the buffers for the frame data
3188 ret = av_frame_get_buffer(frame, 32);
3189 if (ret < 0)
3190 {
3191 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate frame data (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3192 return ret;
3193 }
3194
3195 return 0;
3196}
3197
3198int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode(AVCodecContext *codec_ctx, AVFrame *frame, int *got_frame, const AVPacket *pkt) const
3199{
3200 int ret;
3201
3202 *got_frame = 0;
3203
3204 if (pkt != nullptr)
3205 {
3206 ret = avcodec_send_packet(codec_ctx, pkt);
3207 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_EOF)
3208 {
3209 // In particular, we don't expect AVERROR(EAGAIN), because we read all
3210 // decoded frames with avcodec_receive_frame() until done, so this should be handled
3211 // as an error.
3212 if (ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN))
3213 {
3214 ret = AVERROR_EXTERNAL;
3215 }
3216
3217 if (is_audio_stream(pkt->stream_index) && stream_exists(m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx))
3218 {
3219 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not send audio packet at PTS=%1 to decoder (error '%2').", ffmpeg_rescale_q(pkt->pts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3220 }
3221 else if (is_video_stream(pkt->stream_index) && stream_exists(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx))
3222 {
3223 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not send video packet at PTS=%1 to decoder (error '%2').", ffmpeg_rescale_q(pkt->pts, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3224 }
3225 else
3226 {
3227 // Should never come here, but what the heck...
3228 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not send packet at PTS=%1 to decoder (error '%2').", pkt->pts, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3229 }
3230 return ret;
3231 }
3232 }
3233
3234 ret = avcodec_receive_frame(codec_ctx, frame);
3235 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN) && ret != AVERROR_EOF)
3236 {
3237 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not receive packet from decoder (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3238 }
3239
3247 *got_frame = (ret >= 0) ? 1 : 0;
3248
3249 return ret;
3250}
3251
3252int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_audio_frame(AVPacket *pkt, int *decoded)
3253{
3254 int data_present = 0;
3255 int ret = 0;
3256
3257 *decoded = 0;
3258
3259 // Decode the audio frame stored in the temporary packet.
3260 // The input audio stream decoder is used to do this.
3261 // If we are at the end of the file, pass an empty packet to the decoder
3262 // to flush it.
3263
3264 // Since FFMpeg version >= 3.2 this is deprecated
3265 bool again = false;
3266
3267 data_present = 0;
3268
3269 // read all the output frames (in general there may be any number of them)
3270 while (ret >= 0)
3271 {
3272 FFmpeg_Frame frame(m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx);
3273
3274 ret = frame.res();
3275 if (ret < 0)
3276 {
3277 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3278 break;
3279 }
3280
3281 ret = decode(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get(), frame, &data_present, again ? nullptr : pkt);
3282 if (!data_present)
3283 {
3284 break;
3285 }
3286
3287 if (ret < 0)
3288 {
3289 // Anything else is an error, report it!
3290 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3291 break;
3292 }
3293
3294 again = true;
3295
3296 *decoded += pkt->size;
3297
3298 // If there is decoded data, convert and store it
3299 if (frame->nb_samples)
3300 {
3301 // Temporary storage for the converted input samples.
3302 uint8_t **converted_input_samples = nullptr;
3303 try
3304 {
3305 int nb_output_samples;
3306
3307 // Initialise the resampler to be able to convert audio sample formats.
3308 ret = init_resampler();
3309 if (ret)
3310 {
3311 throw ret;
3312 }
3313
3314 nb_output_samples = (m_audio_resample_ctx != nullptr) ? swr_get_out_samples(m_audio_resample_ctx, frame->nb_samples) : frame->nb_samples;
3315
3316 // Store audio frame
3317 // Initialise the temporary storage for the converted input samples.
3318 ret = init_converted_samples(&converted_input_samples, nb_output_samples);
3319 if (ret < 0)
3320 {
3321 throw ret;
3322 }
3323
3324 // Convert the input samples to the desired output sample format.
3325 // This requires a temporary storage provided by converted_input_samples.
3326 ret = convert_samples(frame->extended_data, frame->nb_samples, converted_input_samples, &nb_output_samples);
3327 if (ret < 0)
3328 {
3329 throw ret;
3330 }
3331
3332 // Add the converted input samples to the audio FIFO buffer for later processing.
3333 ret = add_samples_to_fifo(converted_input_samples, nb_output_samples);
3334 if (ret < 0)
3335 {
3336 throw ret;
3337 }
3338 ret = 0;
3339 }
3340 catch (int _ret)
3341 {
3342 ret = _ret;
3343 }
3344
3345 if (converted_input_samples != nullptr)
3346 {
3347 av_freep(&converted_input_samples[0]);
3348 av_free(converted_input_samples);
3349 }
3350 }
3351 }
3352 return ret;
3353}
3354
3355int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_video_frame(AVPacket *pkt, int *decoded)
3356{
3357 int data_present;
3358 int ret = 0;
3359
3360 *decoded = 0;
3361
3362 // NOTE1: some codecs are stream based (mpegvideo, mpegaudio)
3363 // and this is the only method to use them because you cannot
3364 // know the compressed data size before analysing it.
3365
3366 // BUT some other codecs (msmpeg4, mpeg4) are inherently frame
3367 // based, so you must call them with all the data for one
3368 // frame exactly. You must also initialise 'width' and
3369 // 'height' before initialising them.
3370
3371 // NOTE2: some codecs allow the raw parameters (frame size,
3372 // sample rate) to be changed at any frame. We handle this, so
3373 // you should also take care of it
3374
3375 // Since FFMpeg version >= 3.2 this is deprecated
3376 bool again = false;
3377
3378 data_present = 0;
3379
3380 // read all the output frames (in general there may be any number of them)
3381 while (ret >= 0)
3382 {
3383 FFmpeg_Frame frame(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx);
3384
3385 ret = frame.res();
3386 if (ret < 0)
3387 {
3388 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3389 break;
3390 }
3391
3392 ret = decode(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), frame, &data_present, again ? nullptr : pkt);
3393 if (!data_present)
3394 {
3395 // No data available
3396 break;
3397 }
3398
3399 if (ret < 0)
3400 {
3401 // Anything else is an error, report it!
3402 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3403 break;
3404 }
3405
3406 if (m_hwaccel_enable_dec_buffering && frame != nullptr)
3407 {
3408 FFmpeg_Frame sw_frame(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx);
3409
3410 ret = sw_frame.res();
3411 if (ret < 0)
3412 {
3413 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3414 return ret;
3415 }
3416
3417 // If decoding is done in hardware, the resulting frame data needs to be copied to software memory
3418 //ret = hwframe_copy_from_hw(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), &sw_frame, frame);
3419
3420 // retrieve data from GPU to CPU
3421 ret = av_hwframe_transfer_data(sw_frame, frame, 0); // hwframe_copy_from_hw
3422 if (ret < 0)
3423 {
3424 Logging::error(filename(), "Error transferring the data to system memory (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3425 break;
3426 }
3427 frame = sw_frame;
3428 }
3429
3430 again = true;
3431 *decoded += pkt->size;
3432
3433 // Sometimes only a few packets contain valid dts/pts/pos data, so we keep it
3434 if (pkt->dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3435 {
3436 int64_t pkt_dts = pkt->dts;
3437 if (pkt_dts > m_pts)
3438 {
3439 m_pts = pkt_dts;
3440 }
3441 }
3442 else if (pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3443 {
3444 int64_t pkt_pts = pkt->pts;
3445 if (pkt_pts > m_pts)
3446 {
3447 m_pts = pkt_pts;
3448 }
3449 }
3450
3451 if (pkt->pos > -1)
3452 {
3453 m_pos = pkt->pos;
3454 }
3455
3456 if (frame != nullptr)
3457 {
3458 if (!(frame->flags & AV_FRAME_FLAG_CORRUPT || frame->flags & AV_FRAME_FLAG_DISCARD))
3459 {
3460 ret = send_filters(&frame, ret);
3461 if (ret)
3462 {
3463 return ret;
3464 }
3465
3466 if (m_sws_ctx != nullptr)
3467 {
3468 FFmpeg_Frame tmp_frame(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx);
3469
3470 ret = tmp_frame.res();
3471 if (ret < 0)
3472 {
3473 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3474 return ret;
3475 }
3476
3477 AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx = m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get();
3478
3479 ret = alloc_picture(tmp_frame, m_out.m_pix_fmt, output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height);
3480 if (ret < 0)
3481 {
3482 return ret;
3483 }
3484
3485 sws_scale(m_sws_ctx,
3486 static_cast<const uint8_t * const *>(frame->data), frame->linesize,
3487 0, frame->height,
3488 tmp_frame->data, tmp_frame->linesize);
3489
3490 tmp_frame->pts = frame->pts;
3491 tmp_frame->best_effort_timestamp = frame->best_effort_timestamp;
3492
3493 frame = tmp_frame;
3494 }
3495
3496 int64_t best_effort_timestamp = frame->best_effort_timestamp;
3497
3498 if (best_effort_timestamp != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3499 {
3500 frame->pts = best_effort_timestamp;
3501 }
3502
3503 if (frame->pts == AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3504 {
3505 frame->pts = m_pts;
3506 }
3507
3508 int64_t video_start_time = m_out.m_video.m_start_time;
3509
3510 if (m_out.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && frame->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3511 {
3512 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base.den != m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base.den || m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base.num != m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base.num)
3513 {
3514 frame->pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(frame->pts, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
3515 video_start_time = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(video_start_time, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
3516 }
3517
3518 // Fix for issue #46: bitrate too high.
3519 // Solution found here https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11466184/setting-video-bit-rate-through-ffmpeg-api-is-ignored-for-libx264-codec
3520 // This is permanently used in the current ffmpeg.c code (see commit: e3fb9af6f1353f30855eaa1cbd5befaf06e303b8 Date:Wed Jan 22 15:52:10 2020 +0100)
3521 frame->pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(frame->pts, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->time_base);
3522 video_start_time = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(video_start_time, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->time_base);
3523 }
3524
3525 frame->quality = m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->global_quality;
3526#if !LAVU_ADD_NEW_FRAME_FLAGS
3527 frame->key_frame = 0; // Leave that decision to encoder
3528#endif
3529 frame->pict_type = AV_PICTURE_TYPE_NONE; // other than AV_PICTURE_TYPE_NONE causes warnings
3530
3531 if (frame->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3532 {
3533 int64_t tmp_pts = frame->pts - video_start_time;
3534 int64_t pos = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(tmp_pts, m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->time_base);
3535 if (pos < 0)
3536 {
3537 pos = 0;
3538 }
3539
3540 if (is_hls())
3541 {
3542 // Issue #90: Insert key frame at start of each subsequent HLS segment
3543 uint32_t next_segment = get_next_segment(pos);
3544
3545 if (goto_next_segment(next_segment) && !m_insert_keyframe)
3546 {
3547 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Force key frame for next segment no. %1 at PTS=%2 (%3).", next_segment, tmp_pts, format_duration(pos).c_str());
3548
3549#if LAVU_ADD_NEW_FRAME_FLAGS
3550 frame->flags |= AV_FRAME_FLAG_KEY; // This is required to reset the GOP counter (insert the next key frame after gop_size frames)
3551#else // !LAVU_ADD_NEW_FRAME_FLAGS
3552 frame->key_frame = 1; // This is required to reset the GOP counter (insert the next key frame after gop_size frames)
3553#endif // !LAVU_ADD_NEW_FRAME_FLAGS
3554 frame->pict_type = AV_PICTURE_TYPE_I;
3555 m_insert_keyframe = true;
3556 }
3557 }
3558
3559 m_frame_map.insert(std::make_pair(pos, frame));
3560 }
3561 else
3562 {
3563 m_frame_map.insert(std::make_pair(0, frame));
3564 }
3565 }
3566 }
3567 }
3568
3569 return ret;
3570}
3571
3572int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_subtitle(AVPacket *pkt, int *decoded)
3573{
3574 StreamRef_map::const_iterator it = m_in.m_subtitle.find(pkt->stream_index);
3575
3576 *decoded = 0;
3577
3578 if (it == m_in.m_subtitle.cend())
3579 {
3580 // Should never happen, this should never be called with anything else than subtitle packets.
3581 int ret = AVERROR_STREAM_NOT_FOUND;
3582 Logging::error(filename(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_subtitle()! Subtitle stream #%1 not found (error '%2').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3583 return ret;
3584 }
3585
3586 // Decode the audio frame stored in the temporary packet.
3587 // The input audio stream decoder is used to do this.
3588 // If we are at the end of the file, pass an empty packet to the decoder
3589 // to flush it.
3590
3591 // Temporary storage of the input samples of the frame read from the file.
3592
3593 int out_stream_idx = map_in_to_out_stream(it->first);
3594
3595 if (out_stream_idx == INVALID_STREAM)
3596 {
3597 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_subtitle()! Unable to map input subtitle stream #%1 to output stream.", it->first);
3598 throw AVERROR(EINVAL);
3599 }
3600
3601 return decode_subtitle(it->second.m_codec_ctx.get(), pkt, decoded, out_stream_idx);
3602}
3603
3604int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_subtitle(AVCodecContext *codec_ctx, AVPacket *pkt, int *decoded, int out_stream_idx)
3605{
3606 FFmpeg_Subtitle subtitle(out_stream_idx);
3607 int data_present = 0;
3608 int ret = 0;
3609
3610 *decoded = 0;
3611
3612 ret = subtitle.res();
3613 if (ret < 0)
3614 {
3615 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode subtitle (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3616 return ret;
3617 }
3618
3619 ret = avcodec_decode_subtitle2(codec_ctx, subtitle, &data_present, pkt);
3620
3621 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EINVAL))
3622 {
3623 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode subtitle frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3624 data_present = 0;
3625 }
3626 else
3627 {
3628 *decoded = ret;
3629 ret = 0;
3630 }
3631
3632 if (data_present)
3633 {
3634 // If there is decoded data, store it
3635 // sub->pts is already in AV_TIME_BASE
3636 m_frame_map.insert(std::make_pair(subtitle->pts, subtitle));
3637 }
3638
3639 return ret;
3640}
3641
3642int FFmpeg_Transcoder::store_packet(AVPacket *pkt, AVMediaType mediatype)
3643{
3644 if (is_hls() && pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3645 {
3646 switch (mediatype)
3647 {
3648 case AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO:
3649 {
3650 int64_t pos = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(pkt->pts - m_out.m_audio.m_start_time, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
3651 if (pos < 0)
3652 {
3653 pos = 0;
3654 }
3655 uint32_t next_segment = get_next_segment(pos);
3656
3657 if (goto_next_segment(next_segment))
3658 {
3659 if (!(m_inhibit_stream_msk & FFMPEGFS_AUDIO))
3660 {
3661 m_inhibit_stream_msk |= FFMPEGFS_AUDIO;
3662
3663 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Buffering audio packets until the next segment no. %1 from position %2 (%3).", next_segment, pos, format_duration(pos).c_str());
3664 }
3665
3666 m_hls_packet_fifo.push(av_packet_clone(pkt));
3667 return 0;
3668 }
3669 break;
3670 }
3671 case AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO:
3672 {
3673 int64_t pos = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(pkt->pts - m_out.m_video.m_start_time, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
3674 if (pos < 0)
3675 {
3676 pos = 0;
3677 }
3678 uint32_t next_segment = get_next_segment(pos);
3679
3680 if (goto_next_segment(next_segment))
3681 {
3682 if (!(m_inhibit_stream_msk & FFMPEGFS_VIDEO))
3683 {
3684 m_inhibit_stream_msk |= FFMPEGFS_VIDEO;
3685
3686 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Buffering video packets until the next segment no. %1 from position %2 (%3).", next_segment, pos, format_duration(pos).c_str());
3687 }
3688
3689 m_hls_packet_fifo.push(av_packet_clone(pkt));
3690 return 0;
3691 }
3692 break;
3693 }
3694 case AVMEDIA_TYPE_SUBTITLE:
3695 {
3696 StreamRef * subtitle = get_out_subtitle_stream(pkt->stream_index);
3697
3698 if (subtitle != nullptr && subtitle->m_stream != nullptr)
3699 {
3700 int64_t pos = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(pkt->pts - subtitle->m_start_time, subtitle->m_stream->time_base);
3701 if (pos < 0)
3702 {
3703 pos = 0;
3704 }
3705 uint32_t next_segment = get_next_segment(pos);
3706
3707 if (goto_next_segment(next_segment))
3708 {
3709 m_hls_packet_fifo.push(av_packet_clone(pkt));
3710 return 0;
3711 }
3712 }
3713 break;
3714 }
3715 default:
3716 {
3717 break;
3718 }
3719 }
3720 }
3721
3722 int ret = av_write_frame(m_out.m_format_ctx, pkt);
3723
3724 if (ret < 0)
3725 {
3726 const char *type;
3727
3728 if (mediatype != AVMEDIA_TYPE_ATTACHMENT)
3729 {
3730 type = av_get_media_type_string(mediatype);
3731
3732 if (type == nullptr)
3733 {
3734 type = "unknown";
3735 }
3736 }
3737 else
3738 {
3739 type = "album art";
3740 }
3741
3742 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not write %1 frame (error '%2').", type, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3743 }
3744
3745 return ret;
3746}
3747
3748int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_frame(AVPacket *pkt)
3749{
3750 int ret = 0;
3751
3752 if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && is_audio_stream(pkt->stream_index) && stream_exists(m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx))
3753 {
3754 if (m_reset_pts & FFMPEGFS_AUDIO && pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3755 {
3756 m_reset_pts &= ~FFMPEGFS_AUDIO; // Clear reset bit
3757
3758 int64_t pkt_pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q(pkt->pts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
3759
3760 m_out.m_audio_pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q(pkt_pts, av_get_time_base_q(), m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
3761
3762 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Reset the PTS from the audio packet to %1.", format_duration(pkt_pts).c_str());
3763 }
3764
3765 if (!m_copy_audio)
3766 {
3767 int decoded = 0;
3768 ret = decode_audio_frame(pkt, &decoded);
3769 }
3770 else
3771 {
3772 // Simply copy packet without recoding
3773 pkt->stream_index = m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx;
3774 if (pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3775 {
3776 pkt->pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(pkt->pts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
3777 }
3778 if (pkt->dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3779 {
3780 pkt->dts = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(pkt->dts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
3781 }
3782 if (pkt->duration)
3783 {
3784 pkt->duration = static_cast<int>(ffmpeg_rescale_q(pkt->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base));
3785 }
3786 pkt->pos = -1;
3787
3788 ret = store_packet(pkt, AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO);
3789 }
3790 }
3791 else if (m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && is_video_stream(pkt->stream_index) && (stream_exists(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx) || is_frameset()))
3792 {
3793 if (m_reset_pts & FFMPEGFS_VIDEO && pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3794 {
3795 m_reset_pts &= ~FFMPEGFS_VIDEO; // Clear reset bit
3796
3797 int64_t pkt_pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q(pkt->pts, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
3798
3799 m_out.m_video_pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q(pkt_pts, av_get_time_base_q(), m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
3800
3801 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Reset PTS from the video packet to %1.", format_duration(pkt_pts).c_str());
3802 }
3803
3804 if (!m_copy_video)
3805 {
3806 int decoded = 0;
3817#ifndef USE_LIBDVD
3818 ret = decode_video_frame(pkt, &decoded);
3819#else //USE_LIBDVD
3820 if (m_virtualfile->m_type != VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
3821 {
3822 ret = decode_video_frame(pkt, &decoded);
3823 }
3824 else
3825 {
3826 int lastret = 0;
3827
3828 do
3829 {
3830 // Decode one frame.
3831 ret = decode_video_frame(pkt, &decoded);
3832
3833 if ((ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN) && ret == lastret) || ret == AVERROR_EOF)
3834 {
3835 // If EAGAIN reported twice or stream at EOF
3836 // quit loop, but this is not an error
3837 // (must process all streams).
3838 break;
3839 }
3840
3841 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
3842 {
3843 Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3844 return ret;
3845 }
3846
3847 lastret = ret;
3848
3849 pkt->data += decoded;
3850 pkt->size -= decoded;
3851 }
3852 while (pkt->size > 0 && (ret == 0 || ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN)));
3853
3854 ret = 0;
3855 }
3856#endif // USE_LIBDVD
3857 }
3858 else
3859 {
3860 // Simply copy packet without recoding
3861 pkt->stream_index = m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx;
3862 av_packet_rescale_ts(pkt, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
3863 pkt->pos = -1;
3864
3865 ret = store_packet(pkt, AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO);
3866 }
3867 }
3868 else if (is_subtitle_stream(pkt->stream_index))
3869 {
3870 // Decode subtitle. No copy option available.
3871 int decoded = 0;
3872 ret = decode_subtitle(pkt, &decoded);
3873 }
3874 else
3875 {
3876 // Finally process album arts
3877 switch (m_in.m_format_ctx->streams[pkt->stream_index]->codecpar->codec_type)
3878 {
3879 case AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO:
3880 {
3881 for (size_t n = 0; n < m_in.m_album_art.size() && n < m_out.m_album_art.size(); n++)
3882 {
3883 AVStream *input_stream = m_in.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
3884
3885 // AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC streams already processed in process_albumarts()
3886 if (pkt->stream_index == input_stream->index && !(input_stream->disposition & AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC))
3887 {
3888 AVStream *output_stream = m_out.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
3889
3890 ret = add_albumart_frame(output_stream, pkt);
3891 break;
3892 }
3893 }
3894 break;
3895 }
3896 default:
3897 {
3898 break;
3899 }
3900 }
3901 }
3902
3903 // If decoding errors should be ignored by command line, reset return code.
3904 // Exemptions that need to be passed on anyway:
3905 // * EAGAIN tells the caller to retry, this is not an error
3906 // * AVERROR_EXTERNAL is an unrecoverable error and should be handled
3907 if (!params.m_decoding_errors && ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN) && ret != AVERROR_EXTERNAL)
3908 {
3909 // Ignore error, go on with transcoding
3910 ret = 0;
3911 }
3912
3913 return ret;
3914}
3915
3916int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_converted_samples(uint8_t ***converted_input_samples, int frame_size)
3917{
3918 int ret;
3919
3920 // Allocate as many pointers as there are audio channels.
3921 // Each pointer will later point to the audio samples of the corresponding
3922 // channels (although it may be nullptr for interleaved formats).
3923
3924 *converted_input_samples = static_cast<uint8_t **>(av_calloc(static_cast<size_t>(get_channels(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get())), sizeof(**converted_input_samples)));
3925
3926 if (*converted_input_samples == nullptr)
3927 {
3928 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate converted input sample pointers.");
3929 return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
3930 }
3931
3932 // Allocate memory for the samples of all channels in one consecutive
3933 // block for convenience.
3934 ret = av_samples_alloc(*converted_input_samples, nullptr,
3935 get_channels(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get()),
3936 frame_size,
3937 m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt, 0);
3938 if (ret < 0)
3939 {
3940 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not allocate converted input samples (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3941 av_freep(&(*converted_input_samples)[0]);
3942 av_free(*converted_input_samples);
3943 return ret;
3944 }
3945 return 0;
3946}
3947
3948int FFmpeg_Transcoder::convert_samples(uint8_t **input_data, int in_samples, uint8_t **converted_data, int *out_samples)
3949{
3950 if (m_audio_resample_ctx != nullptr)
3951 {
3952 int ret;
3953
3954 // Convert the samples using the resampler.
3955 ret = swr_convert(m_audio_resample_ctx, converted_data, *out_samples, const_cast<const uint8_t **>(input_data), in_samples);
3956 if (ret < 0)
3957 {
3958 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not convert input samples (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3959 return ret;
3960 }
3961
3962 *out_samples = ret;
3963 }
3964 else
3965 {
3966 *out_samples = in_samples;
3967
3968 // No resampling, just copy samples
3969 if (!av_sample_fmt_is_planar(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt))
3970 {
3971 // Interleaved format
3972 int samples = in_samples * av_get_bytes_per_sample(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt) * get_channels(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get());
3973 std::memcpy(converted_data[0], input_data[0], static_cast<size_t>(samples));
3974 }
3975 else
3976 {
3977 // Planar format
3978 int samples = in_samples * av_get_bytes_per_sample(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt);
3979 for (int n = 0; n < get_channels(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get()); n++)
3980 {
3981 std::memcpy(converted_data[n], input_data[n], static_cast<size_t>(samples));
3982 }
3983 }
3984 }
3985 return 0;
3986}
3987
3988int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_samples_to_fifo(uint8_t **converted_input_samples, int frame_size)
3989{
3990 int ret;
3991
3992 // Make the audio FIFO as large as it needs to be to hold both,
3993 // the old and the new samples.
3994
3995 ret = av_audio_fifo_realloc(m_audio_fifo, av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo) + frame_size);
3996 if (ret < 0)
3997 {
3998 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not reallocate the audio FIFO.");
3999 return ret;
4000 }
4001
4002 // Store the new samples in the audio FIFO buffer.
4003 ret = av_audio_fifo_write(m_audio_fifo, reinterpret_cast<void **>(converted_input_samples), frame_size);
4004 if (ret < frame_size)
4005 {
4006 if (ret < 0)
4007 {
4008 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not write data to audio FIFO (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4009 }
4010 else
4011 {
4012 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not write data to audio FIFO.");
4013 }
4014 return AVERROR_EXIT;
4015 }
4016
4017 return 0;
4018}
4019
4020int FFmpeg_Transcoder::flush_frames_all(bool use_flush_packet)
4021{
4022 int ret = 0;
4023
4024 if (m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
4025 {
4026 int ret2 = flush_frames_single(m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx, use_flush_packet);
4027 if (ret2 < 0)
4028 {
4029 ret = ret2;
4030 }
4031 }
4032
4033 if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
4034 {
4035 int ret2 = flush_frames_single(m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, use_flush_packet);
4036 if (ret2 < 0)
4037 {
4038 ret = ret2;
4039 }
4040 }
4041
4042 return ret;
4043}
4044
4045int FFmpeg_Transcoder::flush_frames_single(int stream_idx, bool use_flush_packet)
4046{
4047 int ret = 0;
4048
4049 if (stream_exists(stream_idx))
4050 {
4051 int (FFmpeg_Transcoder::*decode_frame_ptr)(AVPacket *pkt, int *decoded) = nullptr;
4052
4053 if (!m_copy_audio && is_audio_stream(stream_idx) && stream_exists(m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx))
4054 {
4055 decode_frame_ptr = &FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_audio_frame;
4056 }
4057 else if (!m_copy_video && is_video_stream(stream_idx) && (stream_exists(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx) || is_frameset()))
4058 {
4059 decode_frame_ptr = &FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_video_frame;
4060 }
4061
4062 if (decode_frame_ptr != nullptr)
4063 {
4064#if !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4065 AVPacket pkt;
4066#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4067 AVPacket *flush_packet = nullptr;
4068
4069 if (use_flush_packet)
4070 {
4071#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4072 flush_packet = av_packet_alloc();
4073#else // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4074 flush_packet = &pkt;
4075
4076 init_packet(flush_packet);
4077#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4078
4079 flush_packet->data = nullptr;
4080 flush_packet->size = 0;
4081 flush_packet->stream_index = stream_idx;
4082 }
4083
4084 // cppcheck-suppress knownConditionTrueFalse
4085 for (int decoded = 1; decoded;)
4086 {
4087 ret = (this->*decode_frame_ptr)(flush_packet, &decoded);
4088 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
4089 {
4090 break;
4091 }
4092 }
4093
4094 av_packet_unref(flush_packet);
4095#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4096 av_packet_free(&flush_packet);
4097#endif // LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4098 }
4099 }
4100
4101 return ret;
4102}
4103
4104int FFmpeg_Transcoder::read_decode_convert_and_store(int *finished)
4105{
4106 // Packet used for temporary storage.
4107 AVPacket pkt;
4108 int ret = 0;
4109
4110 try
4111 {
4112 // Read one frame from the input file into a temporary packet.
4113 ret = av_read_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, &pkt);
4114 if (ret < 0)
4115 {
4116 if (ret == AVERROR_EOF)
4117 {
4118 // If we are the the end of the file, flush the decoder below.
4119 *finished = 1;
4120 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Read input file to EOF.");
4121 }
4122 else
4123 {
4124 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not read frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4125 throw ret;
4126 }
4127 }
4128
4129 if (m_virtualfile->m_flags & VIRTUALFLAG_CUESHEET)
4130 {
4131 // Check for end of cue sheet track
4133 if (is_audio_stream(pkt.stream_index))
4134 {
4135 int64_t pkt_pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q(pkt.pts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
4136 if (pkt_pts > m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_start + m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_duration)
4137 {
4138 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Read to end of track.");
4139 *finished = 1;
4140 ret = AVERROR_EOF;
4141 }
4142 }
4143 }
4144
4145 if (!*finished)
4146 {
4147 // Decode one packet, at least with the old API (!LAV_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE)
4148 // it seems a packet can contain more than one frame so loop around it
4149 // if necessary...
4150 ret = decode_frame(&pkt);
4151
4152 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
4153 {
4154 throw ret;
4155 }
4156 }
4157 else
4158 {
4159 // Flush cached frames, ignoring any errors
4160 flush_frames_all(true);
4161 }
4162
4163 ret = 0; // Errors will be reported by exception
4164 }
4165 catch (int _ret)
4166 {
4167 ret = _ret;
4168 }
4169
4170 av_packet_unref(&pkt);
4171
4172 return ret;
4173}
4174
4175int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_audio_output_frame(AVFrame *frame, int frame_size) const
4176{
4177 int ret;
4178
4179 //
4180 // Set the frame's parameters, especially its size and format.
4181 // av_frame_get_buffer needs this to allocate memory for the
4182 // audio samples of the frame.
4183 // Default channel layouts based on the number of channels
4184 // are assumed for simplicity.
4185
4186 frame->nb_samples = frame_size;
4187#if LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
4188 ret = av_channel_layout_copy(&frame->ch_layout, &m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ch_layout);
4189 if (ret < 0)
4190 {
4191 Logging::error(virtname(), "Unable to copy channel layout (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4192 return ret;
4193 }
4194#else // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
4195 frame->channel_layout = m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout;
4196#endif // !LAVU_DEP_OLD_CHANNEL_LAYOUT
4197 frame->format = m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt;
4198 frame->sample_rate = m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
4199
4200 // Allocate the samples of the created frame. This call will make
4201 // sure that the audio frame can hold as many samples as specified.
4202 // 29.05.2021: Let API decide about alignment. Should be properly set for the current CPU.
4203
4204 ret = av_frame_get_buffer(frame, 0);
4205 if (ret < 0)
4206 {
4207 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could allocate output frame samples (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4208 return ret;
4209 }
4210
4211 return 0;
4212}
4213
4214void FFmpeg_Transcoder::produce_audio_dts(AVPacket *pkt)
4215{
4216 if (pkt->pts == AV_NOPTS_VALUE && pkt->dts == AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4217 {
4218 // Normally we have already added the PTS to the frame when it was created. Just in case
4219 // this failed, and there are no valid PTS/DTS values, we add it here.
4220 int64_t pkt_duration;
4221
4222 // Some encoders to not produce dts/pts.
4223 // So we make some up.
4224 if (pkt->duration)
4225 {
4226 pkt_duration = pkt->duration;
4227
4228#if !LAVC_DEP_TICKSPERFRAME
4229 // This has probably long since been fixed in FFmpeg, so we remove this completly
4230 // instead of replacing it with updated code.
4231 if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_OPUS || m_current_format->filetype() == FILETYPE_TS || m_current_format->filetype() == FILETYPE_HLS)
4232 {
4239 if (pkt_duration > 0 && m_out.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->sample_rate > 0)
4240 {
4241 pkt->duration = pkt_duration = static_cast<int>(av_rescale(pkt_duration, static_cast<int64_t>(m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base.den) * m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ticks_per_frame, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->sample_rate * static_cast<int64_t>(m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base.num)));
4242 }
4243 }
4244#endif
4245 }
4246 else
4247 {
4248 pkt_duration = 1;
4249 }
4250
4251 pkt->dts = m_out.m_audio_pts - 1;
4252 pkt->pts = m_out.m_audio_pts;
4253
4254 m_out.m_audio_pts += pkt_duration;
4255 }
4256}
4257
4258int FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_audio_frame(const AVFrame *frame, int *data_present)
4259{
4260 // Packet used for temporary storage.
4261#if !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4262 AVPacket tmp_pkt;
4263#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4264 AVPacket *pkt;
4265 int ret = 0;
4266
4267#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4268 pkt = av_packet_alloc();
4269#else // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4270 pkt = &tmp_pkt;
4271 init_packet(pkt);
4272#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4273
4274 try
4275 {
4276 // Encode the audio frame and store it in the temporary packet.
4277 // The output audio stream encoder is used to do this.
4278
4279 *data_present = 0;
4280
4281 // send the frame for encoding
4282 ret = avcodec_send_frame(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get(), frame);
4283 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_EOF)
4284 {
4285 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode audio frame (error %1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4286 throw ret;
4287 }
4288
4289 // read all the available output packets (in general there may be any number of them)
4290 while (ret >= 0)
4291 {
4292 *data_present = 0;
4293
4294 ret = avcodec_receive_packet(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get(), pkt);
4295 if (ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN) || ret == AVERROR_EOF)
4296 {
4297 throw ret;
4298 }
4299 else if (ret < 0)
4300 {
4301 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4302 throw ret;
4303 }
4304
4305 *data_present = 1;
4306
4307 // Write one audio frame from the temporary packet to the output buffer.
4308 {
4309 pkt->stream_index = m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx;
4310
4311 produce_audio_dts(pkt);
4312
4313 ret = store_packet(pkt, AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO);
4314 if (ret < 0)
4315 {
4316 throw ret;
4317 }
4318 }
4319 }
4320
4321 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4322 }
4323 catch (int _ret)
4324 {
4325 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4326 ret = _ret;
4327 }
4328
4329#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4330 av_packet_free(&pkt);
4331#endif // LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4332
4333 return ret;
4334}
4335
4336int FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_image_frame(const AVFrame *frame, int *data_present)
4337{
4338 *data_present = 0;
4339
4340 if (frame == nullptr || m_skip_next_frame)
4341 {
4342 // This called internally to flush frames. We do not have a cache to flush, so simply ignore that.
4343 // After seek oprations we need to skip the first frame.
4344 m_skip_next_frame = false;
4345 return 0;
4346 }
4347
4348 if (m_current_format == nullptr)
4349 {
4350 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_image_frame()! Missing format.");
4351 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
4352 }
4353
4354 if (m_buffer == nullptr)
4355 {
4356 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_image_frame()! Cache not open.");
4357 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
4358 }
4359
4360#if !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4361 AVPacket tmp_pkt;
4362#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4363 AVPacket *pkt = nullptr;
4364 int ret = 0;
4365
4366 try
4367 {
4368 FFmpeg_Frame cloned_frame(frame); // Clone frame. Does not copy data but references it, only the properties are copied. Not a big memory impact.
4369
4370 ret = cloned_frame.res();
4371 if (ret < 0)
4372 {
4373 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode image frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4374 throw ret;
4375 }
4376
4377#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4378 pkt = av_packet_alloc();
4379#else // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4380 pkt = &tmp_pkt;
4381 init_packet(pkt);
4382#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4383
4384 uint32_t frame_no = pts_to_frame(m_in.m_video.m_stream, frame->pts);
4385
4386 if (m_current_format->video_codec() == AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG)
4387 {
4388 // The MJEPG codec requires monotonically growing PTS values so we fake some to avoid them going backwards after seeks
4389 cloned_frame->pts = frame_to_pts(m_in.m_video.m_stream, ++m_fake_frame_no);
4390 }
4391
4392 *data_present = 0;
4393
4394 // send the frame for encoding
4395 ret = avcodec_send_frame(m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), cloned_frame);
4396 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_EOF)
4397 {
4398 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode image frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4399 throw ret;
4400 }
4401
4402 // read all the available output packets (in general there may be any number of them
4403 while (ret >= 0)
4404 {
4405 *data_present = 0;
4406
4407 ret = avcodec_receive_packet(m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), pkt);
4408 if (ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN) || ret == AVERROR_EOF)
4409 {
4410 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4411 break;
4412 }
4413 else if (ret < 0)
4414 {
4415 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode image frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4416 throw ret;
4417 }
4418
4419 *data_present = 1;
4420
4421 // Write one video frame from the temporary packet to the output buffer.
4422 {
4423 // Store current video PTS
4424 if (pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4425 {
4426 m_out.m_video_pts = pkt->pts;
4427 }
4428
4429 m_buffer->write_frame(pkt->data, static_cast<size_t>(pkt->size), frame_no);
4430
4431 if (m_last_seek_frame_no == frame_no) // Skip frames until seek pos
4432 {
4433 m_last_seek_frame_no = 0;
4434 }
4435 }
4436
4437 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4438 }
4439 }
4440 catch (int _ret)
4441 {
4442 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4443 ret = _ret;
4444 }
4445
4446#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4447 av_packet_free(&pkt);
4448#endif // LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4449
4450 return ret;
4451}
4452
4453int FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_video_frame(const AVFrame *frame, int *data_present)
4454{
4455 if (m_out.m_video.m_stream == nullptr)
4456 {
4457 return 0; // ignore, avoid crash
4458 }
4459
4460 // Packet used for temporary storage.
4461 if (frame != nullptr)
4462 {
4463#if LAVU_ADD_NEW_FRAME_FLAGS
4464 if (frame->flags & AV_FRAME_FLAG_INTERLACED)
4465 {
4466 if (m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->codec->id == AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG)
4467 {
4468 m_out.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->field_order = (frame->flags & AV_FRAME_FLAG_TOP_FIELD_FIRST) ? AV_FIELD_TT : AV_FIELD_BB;
4469 }
4470 else
4471 {
4472 m_out.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->field_order = (frame->flags & AV_FRAME_FLAG_TOP_FIELD_FIRST) ? AV_FIELD_TB : AV_FIELD_BT;
4473 }
4474 }
4475#else // !LAVU_ADD_NEW_FRAME_FLAGS
4476 if (frame->interlaced_frame)
4477 {
4478 if (m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->codec->id == AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG)
4479 {
4480 m_out.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->field_order = frame->top_field_first ? AV_FIELD_TT : AV_FIELD_BB;
4481 }
4482 else
4483 {
4484 m_out.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->field_order = frame->top_field_first ? AV_FIELD_TB : AV_FIELD_BT;
4485 }
4486 }
4487#endif // !LAVU_ADD_NEW_FRAME_FLAGS
4488 else
4489 {
4490 m_out.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->field_order = AV_FIELD_PROGRESSIVE;
4491 }
4492 }
4493#if !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4494 AVPacket tmp_pkt;
4495#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4496 FFmpeg_Frame *hw_frame = nullptr;
4497 AVPacket *pkt = nullptr;
4498 int ret = 0;
4499
4500 try
4501 {
4502 if (m_hwaccel_enable_enc_buffering && frame != nullptr)
4503 {
4504 hw_frame = new FFmpeg_Frame(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx);
4505 if (hw_frame == nullptr)
4506 {
4507 ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
4508 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode video frame at PTS=%1 (error %2').", ffmpeg_rescale_q(frame->pts, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4509 throw ret;
4510 }
4511
4512 ret = hw_frame->res();
4513 if (ret < 0)
4514 {
4515 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode video frame at PTS=%1 (error %2').", ffmpeg_rescale_q(frame->pts, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4516 throw ret;
4517 }
4518
4519 // If encoding is done in hardware, the resulting frame data needs to be copied to hardware
4520 ret = hwframe_copy_to_hw(m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), hw_frame, frame);
4521 if (ret < 0)
4522 {
4523 throw ret;
4524 }
4525 frame = *hw_frame; // Copy, not clone!
4526 }
4527
4528#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4529 pkt = av_packet_alloc();
4530#else // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4531 pkt = &tmp_pkt;
4532 init_packet(pkt);
4533#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4534
4535 // Encode the video frame and store it in the temporary packet.
4536 // The output video stream encoder is used to do this.
4537
4538 *data_present = 0;
4539
4540 // send the frame for encoding
4541 ret = avcodec_send_frame(m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), frame);
4542 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_EOF)
4543 {
4544 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode video frame (error %1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4545 throw ret;
4546 }
4547
4548 // read all the available output packets (in general there may be any number of them
4549 while (ret >= 0)
4550 {
4551 *data_present = 0;
4552
4553 ret = avcodec_receive_packet(m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get(), pkt);
4554 if (ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN) || ret == AVERROR_EOF)
4555 {
4556 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4557 break;
4558 }
4559 else if (ret < 0)
4560 {
4561 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4562 throw ret;
4563 }
4564
4565 *data_present = 1;
4566
4567 // Write one video frame from the temporary packet to the output buffer.
4568 {
4569 // Fix for issue #46: bitrate too high.
4570 av_packet_rescale_ts(pkt, m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
4571
4572 if (!(m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags & AVFMT_NOTIMESTAMPS))
4573 {
4574 if (pkt->dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE &&
4575 pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE &&
4576 pkt->dts > pkt->pts &&
4577 m_out.m_last_mux_dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4578 {
4579
4580 Logging::warning(virtname(), "Invalid DTS=%1 PTS=%2 in video output, replacing by guess.", pkt->dts, pkt->pts);
4581
4582 pkt->pts =
4583 pkt->dts = pkt->pts + pkt->dts + m_out.m_last_mux_dts + 1
4584 - FFMIN3(pkt->pts, pkt->dts, m_out.m_last_mux_dts + 1)
4585 - FFMAX3(pkt->pts, pkt->dts, m_out.m_last_mux_dts + 1);
4586 }
4587
4588 if (pkt->dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE && m_out.m_last_mux_dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4589 {
4590 int64_t max = m_out.m_last_mux_dts + !(m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags & AVFMT_TS_NONSTRICT);
4591 // AVRational avg_frame_rate = { m_out.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate.den, m_out.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate.num };
4592 // int64_t max = m_out.m_last_mux_dts + ffmpeg_rescale_q(1, avg_frame_rate, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
4593
4594 if (pkt->dts < max)
4595 {
4596 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Non-monotonous DTS in video output stream; previous: %1, current: %2; changing to %3. This may result in incorrect timestamps in the output.", m_out.m_last_mux_dts, pkt->dts, max);
4597
4598 if (pkt->pts >= pkt->dts)
4599 {
4600 pkt->pts = FFMAX(pkt->pts, max);
4601 }
4602 pkt->dts = max;
4603 }
4604 }
4605 }
4606
4607 if (frame != nullptr && !pkt->duration)
4608 {
4609#if !LAVU_DEP_PKT_DURATION
4610 pkt->duration = frame->pkt_duration;
4611#else
4612 pkt->duration = frame->duration;
4613#endif
4614 }
4615
4616 if (pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4617 {
4618 m_out.m_video_pts = pkt->pts;
4619 m_out.m_last_mux_dts = (pkt->dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE) ? pkt->dts : (pkt->pts - pkt->duration);
4620 }
4621
4622 // Write packet to buffer
4623 ret = store_packet(pkt, AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO);
4624 if (ret < 0)
4625 {
4626 throw ret;
4627 }
4628 }
4629
4630 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4631 }
4632 }
4633 catch (int _ret)
4634 {
4635 if (pkt != nullptr)
4636 {
4637 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4638 }
4639 ret = _ret;
4640 }
4641
4642 delete hw_frame;
4643
4644#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4645 av_packet_free(&pkt);
4646#endif // LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4647
4648 return ret;
4649}
4650
4651int FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_subtitle(const AVSubtitle *sub, int out_stream_idx, int *data_present)
4652{
4653 StreamRef * out_streamref = get_out_subtitle_stream(out_stream_idx);
4654
4655 *data_present = 0;
4656
4657 if (out_streamref == nullptr)
4658 {
4659 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_subtitle()! Invalid stream index #%1.", out_stream_idx);
4660 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
4661 }
4662
4663 // Packet used for temporary storage.
4664#if !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4665 AVPacket tmp_pkt;
4666#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4667 AVPacket *pkt;
4668 int ret = 0;
4669
4670#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4671 pkt = av_packet_alloc();
4672#else // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4673 pkt = &tmp_pkt;
4674 init_packet(pkt);
4675#endif // !LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4676
4677 AVSubtitle subtmp;
4678
4679 // Make a local copy, we have to modify it
4680 std::memcpy(&subtmp, sub, sizeof(AVSubtitle));
4681
4682 try
4683 {
4684 int nb;
4685 int64_t sub_pts;
4686
4687 if (subtmp.pts == AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4688 {
4689 Logging::error(virtname(), "Subtitle packets must have a PTS (stream index #%1).", out_streamref->m_stream_idx);
4690 throw AVERROR(EINVAL);
4691 }
4692
4693 // Allocate a packet with 1KB buffer, hope that's sufficient
4694 ret = av_new_packet(pkt, 1024 * 1024);
4695 if (ret < 0)
4696 {
4697 Logging::error(virtname(), "Failed to allocate new packet (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4698 throw ret;
4699 }
4700
4701 // Note: DVB subtitles need one packet to draw them and one other packet to clear them
4702 if (out_streamref->m_codec_ctx->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_DVB_SUBTITLE)
4703 {
4704 nb = 2;
4705 }
4706 else
4707 {
4708 nb = 1;
4709 }
4710
4711 // shift timestamp
4712 sub_pts = subtmp.pts;
4713
4714 //if (out_streamref->m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4715 //{
4716 // pts -= ffmpeg_rescale_q(out_streamref->m_stream->start_time, out_streamref->m_stream->time_base);
4717 //}
4718
4719 for (int i = 0; i < nb; i++)
4720 {
4721 unsigned save_num_rects = subtmp.num_rects;
4722 subtmp.pts = sub_pts;
4723 // Some decoders may return end_display_time as UINT32_MAX, this causes strange results.
4724 if (subtmp.end_display_time == UINT32_MAX)
4725 {
4726 subtmp.end_display_time = 0;
4727 }
4728
4729 // start_display_time is required to be 0
4730 subtmp.pts += ffmpeg_rescale_q(subtmp.start_display_time, AVRational({ 1, 1000 }));
4731 subtmp.end_display_time -= subtmp.start_display_time;
4732 subtmp.start_display_time = 0;
4733 if (i == 1)
4734 {
4735 subtmp.num_rects = 0;
4736 }
4737
4738 // The avcodec_encode_subtitle seems to be not completely ready
4739 ret = avcodec_encode_subtitle(out_streamref->m_codec_ctx.get(), pkt->data, pkt->size, &subtmp);
4740 if (i == 1)
4741 {
4742 subtmp.num_rects = save_num_rects;
4743 }
4744
4745 if (ret < 0)
4746 {
4747 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode subtitle frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4748 throw ret;
4749 }
4750
4751 pkt->size = ret;
4752 pkt->pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q(subtmp.pts, av_get_time_base_q(), out_streamref->m_stream->time_base);
4753 pkt->duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(subtmp.end_display_time, AVRational({ 1, 1000 }), out_streamref->m_stream->time_base);
4754 pkt->stream_index = out_streamref->m_stream_idx;
4755
4756 if (out_streamref->m_codec_ctx->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_DVB_SUBTITLE)
4757 {
4758 // the pts correction is handled here. Maybe handling it in the codec would be better
4759 if (i)
4760 {
4761 pkt->pts += ffmpeg_rescale_q(subtmp.end_display_time, AVRational({ 1, 1000 }), out_streamref->m_stream->time_base);
4762 }
4763 }
4764 pkt->dts = pkt->pts;
4765
4766 ret = store_packet(pkt, AVMEDIA_TYPE_SUBTITLE);
4767 if (ret < 0)
4768 {
4769 throw ret;
4770 }
4771
4772 *data_present = 1;
4773 }
4774 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4775 }
4776 catch (int _ret)
4777 {
4778 av_packet_unref(pkt);
4779 ret = _ret;
4780 }
4781
4782#if LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4783 av_packet_free(&pkt);
4784#endif // LAVC_DEP_AV_INIT_PACKET
4785
4786 return ret;
4787}
4788
4789int FFmpeg_Transcoder::create_audio_frame(int frame_size)
4790{
4791 // Temporary storage of the output samples of the frame written to the file.
4792 FFmpeg_Frame output_frame(m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx);
4793 int ret = 0;
4794
4795 ret = output_frame.res();
4796 if (ret < 0)
4797 {
4798 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not read data from the audio FIFO (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4799 return ret;
4800 }
4801
4802 // Use the maximum number of possible samples per frame.
4803 // If there is less than the maximum possible frame size in the audio FIFO
4804 // buffer use this number. Otherwise, use the maximum possible frame size
4805
4806 frame_size = FFMIN(av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo), frame_size);
4807
4808 // Initialise temporary storage for one output frame.
4809 ret = init_audio_output_frame(output_frame, frame_size);
4810 if (ret < 0)
4811 {
4812 return ret;
4813 }
4814
4815 // Read as many samples from the FIFO buffer as required to fill the frame.
4816 // The samples are stored in the frame temporarily.
4817
4818 ret = av_audio_fifo_read(m_audio_fifo, reinterpret_cast<void **>(output_frame->data), frame_size);
4819 if (ret < frame_size)
4820 {
4821 if (ret < 0)
4822 {
4823 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not read data from the audio FIFO (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4824 }
4825 else
4826 {
4827 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not read data from the audio FIFO.");
4828 ret = AVERROR_EXIT;
4829 }
4830 return ret;
4831 }
4832
4833 // Build correct PTS
4834 if (output_frame->sample_rate)
4835 {
4836 /*
4837 * FFmpeg API docs say:
4838 *
4839 * best_effort_timestamp: frame timestamp estimated using various heuristics, in stream time base.
4840 * Unused for encoding, but we set it anyways.
4841 *
4842 * pts: Presentation timestamp, they say in ffmpeg time_base units, but nevertheless it seems to be
4843 * in stream time base. When not converted the audio comes out wobbly.
4844 */
4845
4846 // Not sure if this is use anywhere, but let's set it anyway.
4847 output_frame->best_effort_timestamp = ffmpeg_rescale_q(m_out.m_audio_pts, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
4848 output_frame->pts = m_out.m_audio_pts;
4849
4850 // duration = `a * b / c` = AV_TIME_BASE * output_frame->nb_samples / output_frame->sample_rate;
4851 int64_t sample_duration = av_rescale(AV_TIME_BASE, output_frame->nb_samples, output_frame->sample_rate);
4852
4853 sample_duration = ffmpeg_rescale_q(sample_duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
4854
4855 m_out.m_audio_pts += sample_duration;
4856 }
4857
4858 int64_t pos = ffmpeg_rescale_q_rnd(output_frame->pts - m_out.m_audio.m_start_time, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
4859
4860 m_frame_map.insert(std::make_pair(pos, output_frame));
4861
4862 return ret;
4863}
4864
4865int FFmpeg_Transcoder::write_output_file_trailer()
4866{
4867 int ret;
4868
4869 ret = av_write_trailer(m_out.m_format_ctx);
4870 if (ret < 0)
4871 {
4872 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not write output file trailer (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4873 return ret;
4874 }
4875
4876 return 0;
4877}
4878
4879time_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::mtime() const
4880{
4881 return m_mtime;
4882}
4883
4884template <size_t size>
4885const char * FFmpeg_Transcoder::tagcpy(char (&out) [ size ], const std::string & in) const // NOLINT(modernize-avoid-c-arrays)
4886{
4887 std::memset(out, ' ', size);
4888 std::memcpy(out, in.c_str(), std::min(size, in.size()));
4889 return out;
4890}
4891
4892void FFmpeg_Transcoder::copy_metadata(AVDictionary **metadata_out, const AVDictionary *metadata_in, bool contentstream)
4893{
4894 AVDictionaryEntry *tag = nullptr;
4895
4896 while ((tag = av_dict_get(metadata_in, "", tag, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX)) != nullptr)
4897 {
4898 std::string value(tag->value);
4899
4900 if (contentstream && m_virtualfile != nullptr && m_virtualfile->m_flags & VIRTUALFLAG_CUESHEET)
4901 {
4902 // Replace tags with cue sheet values
4903 if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "ARTIST"))
4904 {
4905 value = m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_artist;
4906 }
4907 else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "TITLE"))
4908 {
4909 value = m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_title;
4910 }
4911 else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "TRACK"))
4912 {
4913 strsprintf(&value, "%i", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_trackno);
4914 }
4915 }
4916
4917 dict_set_with_check(metadata_out, tag->key, value.c_str(), 0, virtname());
4918
4919 if (contentstream && m_out.m_filetype == FILETYPE_MP3)
4920 {
4921 // For MP3 fill in ID3v1 structure
4922 if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "ARTIST"))
4923 {
4924 tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_artist, value);
4925 }
4926 else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "TITLE"))
4927 {
