4928 tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_title, value);
4929 }
4930 else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "ALBUM"))
4931 {
4932 tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_album, value);
4933 }
4934 else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "COMMENT"))
4935 {
4936 tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_comment, value);
4937 }
4938 else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "YEAR") || !strcasecmp(tag->key, "DATE"))
4939 {
4940 tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_year, value);
4941 }
4942 else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "TRACK"))
4943 {
4944 m_out.m_id3v1.m_title_no = static_cast<char>(std::stoi(value));
4945 }
4946 }
4947 }
4948}
4949
4950int FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_metadata()
4951{
4952 Logging::trace(virtname(), "Processing metadata.");
4953
4954 if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_VORBIS)
4955 {
4956 // For some formats (namely ogg) FFmpeg returns the tags, odd enough, with streams...
4957 copy_metadata(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->metadata);
4958 }
4959
4960 copy_metadata(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, m_in.m_format_ctx->metadata);
4961
4962 if (m_out.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr)
4963 {
4964 // Copy audio stream meta data
4965 copy_metadata(&m_out.m_audio.m_stream->metadata, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->metadata);
4966 }
4967
4968 if (m_out.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
4969 {
4970 // Copy video stream meta data
4971 copy_metadata(&m_out.m_video.m_stream->metadata, m_in.m_video.m_stream->metadata);
4972 }
4973
4974 // Also copy album art meta tags
4975 for (size_t n = 0; n < m_in.m_album_art.size() && n < m_out.m_album_art.size(); n++)
4976 {
4977 AVStream *input_stream = m_in.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
4978 AVStream *output_stream = m_out.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
4979
4980 copy_metadata(&output_stream->metadata, input_stream->metadata, is_audio_stream(input_stream->index) || is_video_stream(input_stream->index));
4981 }
4982
4983 if (m_virtualfile != nullptr && m_virtualfile->m_flags & VIRTUALFLAG_CUESHEET)
4984 {
4985 dict_set_with_check(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "TRACKTOTAL", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_tracktotal, 0, virtname());
4986 dict_set_with_check(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "TRACK", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_trackno, 0, virtname(), true);
4987 dict_set_with_check(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "ARTIST", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_artist.c_str(), 0, virtname(), true);
4988 if (av_dict_get(m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "ALBUM_ARTIST", nullptr, 0) == nullptr)
4989 {
4990 // Issue #78: duplicate ARTIST tag to ALBUM_ARTIST, if target is empty.
4991 dict_set_with_check(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "ALBUM_ARTIST", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_artist.c_str(), 0, virtname(), true);
4992 }
4993 dict_set_with_check(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "TITLE", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_title.c_str(), 0, virtname(), true);
4994 dict_set_with_check(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "ALBUM", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_album.c_str(), 0, virtname(), true);
4995 dict_set_with_check(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "GENRE", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_genre.c_str(), 0, virtname(), true);
4996 dict_set_with_check(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "DATE", m_virtualfile->m_cuesheet_track.m_date.c_str(), 0, virtname(), true);
4997 }
4998
4999 return 0;
5000}
5001
5002int FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_albumarts()
5003{
5004 int ret = 0;
5005
5006 for (size_t n = 0; n < m_in.m_album_art.size() && n < m_out.m_album_art.size(); n++)
5007 {
5008 AVStream *input_stream = m_in.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
5009
5010 if (input_stream->disposition & AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC)
5011 {
5012 AVStream *output_stream = m_out.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
5013
5014 ret = add_albumart_frame(output_stream, &input_stream->attached_pic);
5015 if (ret < 0)
5016 {
5017 break;
5018 }
5019 }
5020 }
5021
5022 return ret;
5023}
5024
5025void FFmpeg_Transcoder::flush_buffers()
5026{
5027 if (m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
5028 {
5029 avcodec_flush_buffers(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get());
5030 }
5031 if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
5032 {
5033 avcodec_flush_buffers(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx.get());
5034 }
5035}
5036
5037int FFmpeg_Transcoder::do_seek_frame(uint32_t frame_no)
5038{
5039 m_have_seeked = true; // Note that we have seeked, thus skipped frames. We need to start transcoding over to fill any gaps.
5040
5041 //m_skip_next_frame = true; /**< @todo Take deinterlace into account. If deinterlace is on the frame number is decreased by one. */
5042
5043 if (m_skip_next_frame)
5044 {
5045 --frame_no;
5046 }
5047
5048 int64_t vstream_pts = frame_to_pts(m_in.m_video.m_stream, frame_no);
5049
5050 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
5051 {
5052 vstream_pts += m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time;
5053 }
5054
5055 return av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, vstream_pts, AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD|AVSEEK_FLAG_FRAME);
5056}
5057
5058int FFmpeg_Transcoder::skip_decoded_frames(uint32_t frame_no, bool forced_seek)
5059{
5060 int ret = 0;
5061 uint32_t next_frame_no = frame_no;
5062
5063 // Seek next undecoded frame
5064 for (; m_buffer->have_frame(next_frame_no); next_frame_no++)
5065 {
5066 std::this_thread::yield();
5067 }
5068
5069 if (next_frame_no > m_virtualfile->m_video_frame_count)
5070 {
5071 // Reached end of file
5072 // Set PTS to end of file
5073 m_out.m_video_pts = m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration;
5074 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
5075 {
5076 m_out.m_video_pts += m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time;
5077 }
5078 // Seek to end of file to force AVERROR_EOF from next av_read_frame() call. Ignore errrors.
5079 av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, m_out.m_video_pts, AVSEEK_FLAG_ANY);
5080 return 0;
5081 }
5082
5083 uint32_t last_frame_no = pts_to_frame(m_in.m_video.m_stream, m_out.m_video_pts);
5084
5085 // Ignore seek if target is within the next FRAME_SEEK_THRESHOLD frames
5086 if (next_frame_no >= last_frame_no /*+ 1*/ && next_frame_no <= last_frame_no + FRAME_SEEK_THRESHOLD)
5087 {
5088 return 0;
5089 }
5090
5091 if (forced_seek || (frame_no != next_frame_no && next_frame_no > 1))
5092 {
5093 // If frame changed, skip to it
5094 ret = do_seek_frame(next_frame_no);
5095
5096 if (ret < 0)
5097 {
5098 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode audio frame: Seek to frame #%1 failed (error '%2').", next_frame_no, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
5099 }
5100 }
5101
5102 return ret;
5103}
5104
5105int FFmpeg_Transcoder::flush_delayed_audio()
5106{
5107 int ret = 0;
5108
5109 if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
5110 {
5111 // Flush the encoder as it may have delayed frames.
5112 int data_written = 0;
5113 do
5114 {
5115 ret = encode_audio_frame(nullptr, &data_written);
5116
5117 if (ret == AVERROR_EOF)
5118 {
5119 // Not an error
5120 break;
5121 }
5122
5123 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
5124 {
5125 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
5126 break;
5127 }
5128 }
5129 while (data_written);
5130 }
5131
5132 return ret;
5133}
5134
5135int FFmpeg_Transcoder::flush_delayed_video()
5136{
5137 int ret = 0;
5138
5139 if (m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
5140 {
5141 // Flush the encoder as it may have delayed frames.
5142 int data_written = 0;
5143 do
5144 {
5145 if (!is_frameset())
5146 {
5147 // Encode regular frame
5148 ret = encode_video_frame(nullptr, &data_written);
5149 }
5150 else
5151 {
5152 // Encode seperate image frame
5153 ret = encode_image_frame(nullptr, &data_written);
5154 }
5155
5156 if (ret == AVERROR_EOF)
5157 {
5158 // Not an error
5159 break;
5160 }
5161 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
5162 {
5163 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not encode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
5164 break;
5165 }
5166 }
5167 while (data_written);
5168 }
5169
5170 return ret;
5171}
5172
5173int FFmpeg_Transcoder::flush_delayed_subtitles()
5174{
5175 return 0;
5176}
5177
5178int FFmpeg_Transcoder::copy_audio_to_frame_buffer(int *finished)
5179{
5180 int output_frame_size;
5181
5182 if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->codec->capabilities & AV_CODEC_CAP_VARIABLE_FRAME_SIZE)
5183 {
5184 // Encode supports variable frame size, use an arbitrary value
5185 output_frame_size = 10000;
5186 }
5187 else
5188 {
5189 // Use the encoder's desired frame size for processing.
5190 output_frame_size = m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->frame_size;
5191 }
5192
5193 // Make sure that there is one frame worth of samples in the audio FIFO
5194 // buffer so that the encoder can do its work.
5195 // Since the decoder's and the encoder's frame size may differ, we
5196 // need to FIFO buffer to store as many frames worth of input samples
5197 // that they make up at least one frame worth of output samples.
5198
5199 while (av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo) < output_frame_size)
5200 {
5201 int ret = 0;
5202
5203 // Decode one frame worth of audio samples, convert it to the
5204 // output sample format and put it into the audio FIFO buffer.
5205
5206 ret = read_decode_convert_and_store(finished);
5207 if (ret < 0)
5208 {
5209 return ret;
5210 }
5211
5212 // If we are at the end of the input file, we continue
5213 // encoding the remaining audio samples to the output file.
5214
5215 if (*finished)
5216 {
5217 break;
5218 }
5219 }
5220
5221 // If we have enough samples for the encoder, we encode them.
5222 // At the end of the file, we pass the remaining samples to
5223 // the encoder.
5224
5225 while (av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo) >= output_frame_size || (*finished && av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo) > 0))
5226 {
5227 int ret = 0;
5228
5229 // Take one frame worth of audio samples from the audio FIFO buffer,
5230 // create a frame and store in audio frame buffer.
5231
5232 ret = create_audio_frame(output_frame_size);
5233 if (ret < 0)
5234 {
5235 return ret;
5236 }
5237 }
5238
5239 return 0;
5240}
5241
5242int FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_single_fr(DECODER_STATUS *status)
5243{
5244 int finished = 0;
5245
5246 *status = DECODER_SUCCESS;
5247
5248 try
5249 {
5250 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && is_frameset())
5251 {
5252 int ret = 0;
5253
5254 // Direct access handling for frame sets: seek to frame if requested.
5255 ret = seek_frame();
5256 if (ret == AVERROR_EOF)
5257 {
5258 *status = DECODER_EOF; // Report EOF, but return no error
5259 throw 0;
5260 }
5261
5262 if (ret < 0)
5263 {
5264 throw ret;
5265 }
5266 }
5267
5268 if (!m_copy_audio && stream_exists(m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx))
5269 {
5270 int ret = 0;
5271
5272 // Copy audio FIFO into frame buffer
5273 ret = copy_audio_to_frame_buffer(&finished);
5274 if (ret < 0)
5275 {
5276 throw ret;
5277 }
5278 }
5279 else
5280 {
5281 int ret = 0;
5282
5283 // If we have no audio stream, we'll only get video data
5284 // or we simply copy audio and/or video frames into the packet queue
5285 ret = read_decode_convert_and_store(&finished);
5286 if (ret < 0)
5287 {
5288 throw ret;
5289 }
5290
5291 if (finished)
5292 {
5293 *status = DECODER_EOF; // Report EOF
5294 }
5295 }
5296
5297 do
5298 {
5299 if (!is_frameset())
5300 {
5301 int64_t delay;
5302
5303 // The following values are arbitrarily chosen and seem to work.
5304 if (is_hls())
5305 {
5306 delay = params.m_segment_duration * 75 / 100; // 75% of the segment duration
5307 }
5308 else
5309 {
5310 delay = 6 * AV_TIME_BASE; // 6 seconds
5311 }
5312
5313 if (!finished && (!m_frame_map.empty() && m_frame_map.cbegin()->first + delay > m_frame_map.crbegin()->first))
5314 {
5315 return 0;
5316 }
5317
5318 while (!m_frame_map.empty())
5319 {
5320 // Take first entry in map
5321 MULTIFRAME_MAP::const_iterator it = m_frame_map.cbegin();
5322
5323 if (is_hls())
5324 {
5325 uint32_t next_segment = get_next_segment(it->first);
5326
5327 if (goto_next_segment(next_segment))
5328 {
5329 // Reached next segment, end current now, and force new.
5330 m_inhibit_stream_msk = m_active_stream_msk;
5331 break;
5332 }
5333 }
5334
5335 // Get multiframe from map
5336 MULTIFRAME multiframe = it->second;
5337
5338 // Drop key from map, we've got a clone in multiframe now.
5339 m_frame_map.erase(it);
5340
5341 if (std::holds_alternative<FFmpeg_Frame>(multiframe))
5342 {
5343 // Object is an audio/video frame
5344 const FFmpeg_Frame & frame = std::get<FFmpeg_Frame>(multiframe);
5345
5346 int stream_idx = frame.m_stream_idx;
5347
5348 if (!stream_exists(stream_idx))
5349 {
5350 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_single_fr()! Invalid stream index in audio/video buffer skipped.");
5351 continue;
5352 }
5353
5354 if (stream_idx == m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx)
5355 {
5356 // Encode audio
5357 int ret = 0;
5358 int data_written;
5359
5360 // Encode one frame worth of audio samples.
5361 ret = encode_audio_frame(frame, &data_written);
5362
5363 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
5364 {
5365 throw ret;
5366 }
5367 }
5368 else if (stream_idx == m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx)
5369 {
5370 // Encode video
5371 int ret = 0;
5372 int data_written = 0;
5373 ret = encode_video_frame(frame, &data_written);
5374
5375 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
5376 {
5377 throw ret;
5378 }
5379 }
5380 }
5381 else if (std::holds_alternative<FFmpeg_Subtitle>(multiframe))
5382 {
5383 // Object is a subtitle
5384 const FFmpeg_Subtitle & subtitle = std::get<FFmpeg_Subtitle>(multiframe);
5385
5386 int stream_idx = subtitle.m_stream_idx;
5387
5388 if (!stream_exists(stream_idx))
5389 {
5390 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_single_fr()! Invalid stream index in subtitle buffer skipped.");
5391 continue;
5392 }
5393
5394 // Encode subtitles
5395
5396 int ret = 0;
5397 int data_written = 0;
5398
5399 ret = encode_subtitle(subtitle, stream_idx, &data_written);
5400
5401 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
5402 {
5403 throw ret;
5404 }
5405 }
5406 }
5407 }
5408 else
5409 {
5410 // Frame sets: no audio, no subtitles, no output stream (index)
5411 while (!m_frame_map.empty())
5412 {
5413 // Although I abhore "auto", it seems that nodes are declared slightly different throughout
5414 // several std::map implementations. To avoid #ifdef orgies, I resign: Using "auto" here
5415 // is much more coherent.
5416 auto nh = m_frame_map.extract(m_frame_map.cbegin());
5417 const MULTIFRAME & multiframe = nh.mapped();
5418 int ret = 0;
5419 int data_written = 0;
5420
5421 // Encode video
5422 ret = encode_image_frame(std::get<FFmpeg_Frame>(multiframe), &data_written);
5423
5424 if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
5425 {
5426 throw ret;
5427 }
5428 }
5429 }
5430
5431 if (is_hls() && m_active_stream_msk == m_inhibit_stream_msk)
5432 {
5433 // Start new HLS segment
5434 int ret = 0;
5435
5436 ret = start_new_segment();
5437 if (ret < 0)
5438 {
5439 throw ret;
5440 }
5441 }
5442 } while (finished && !m_frame_map.empty()); // Ensure we've processed all frames in our buffer
5443
5444 // If we are at the end of the input file and have encoded
5445 // all remaining samples, we can exit this loop and finish.
5446
5447 if (finished && m_frame_map.empty())
5448 {
5449 flush_delayed_audio();
5450 flush_delayed_video();
5451 flush_delayed_subtitles();
5452
5453 *status = DECODER_EOF; // Report EOF
5454 }
5455 }
5456 catch (int _ret)
5457 {
5458 *status = (_ret != AVERROR_EOF ? DECODER_ERROR : DECODER_EOF); // If _ret == AVERROR_EOF, simply signal EOF
5459 return _ret;
5460 }
5461
5462 return 0;
5463}
5464
5465int FFmpeg_Transcoder::seek_frame()
5466{
5467 if (!m_last_seek_frame_no)
5468 {
5469 // No current seek frame, check if new seek frame was stacked.
5470 {
5471 std::lock_guard<std::recursive_mutex> lock_seek_to_fifo_mutex(m_seek_to_fifo_mutex);
5472
5473 while (!m_seek_to_fifo.empty())
5474 {
5475 uint32_t frame_no = m_seek_to_fifo.front();
5476 m_seek_to_fifo.pop();
5477
5478 if (!m_buffer->have_frame(frame_no))
5479 {
5480 // Frame not yet decoded, so skip to it.
5481 m_last_seek_frame_no = frame_no;
5482 break;
5483 }
5484 }
5485 }
5486
5487 if (m_last_seek_frame_no)
5488 {
5489 int ret = 0;
5490
5491 // The first frame that FFmpeg API returns after av_seek_frame is wrong (the last frame before seek).
5492 // We are unable to detect that because the pts seems correct (the one that we requested).
5493 // So we position before the frame requested, and simply throw the first away.
5494
5495 //#define PRESCAN_FRAMES 3
5496 uint32_t seek_frame_no = m_last_seek_frame_no.exchange(0);
5497#ifdef PRESCAN_FRAMES
5498 if (seek_frame_no > PRESCAN_FRAMES)
5499 {
5500 seek_frame_no -= PRESCAN_FRAMES;
5501 //m_skip_next_frame = true; /**< @todo Take deinterlace into account */
5502 }
5503 else
5504 {
5505 seek_frame_no = 1;
5506 }
5507
5508#endif
5509 ret = skip_decoded_frames(seek_frame_no, true);
5510 if (ret < 0)
5511 {
5512 return ret;
5513 }
5514 }
5515 }
5516 return 0;
5517}
5518
5519int FFmpeg_Transcoder::start_new_segment()
5520{
5521 bool opened = false;
5522
5523 encode_finish();
5524
5525 // Go to next requested segment...
5526 uint32_t next_segment = m_current_segment + 1;
5527
5528 // ...or process any stacked seek requests.
5529 while (!m_seek_to_fifo.empty())
5530 {
5531 uint32_t segment_no = m_seek_to_fifo.front();
5532 m_seek_to_fifo.pop();
5533
5534 // No check if m_segment_duration == 0, values <= 0 not accepted
5535 // Cast is OK here, the result will always be small enough for an int32.
5536 uint32_t min_seek_segments = static_cast<uint32_t>(params.m_min_seek_time_diff / params.m_segment_duration);
5537 if (min_seek_segments && next_segment + min_seek_segments >= segment_no)
5538 {
5539 Logging::info(virtname(), "Discarding seek request to HLS segment no. %1, less than %2 seconds (%3 segments) away.", segment_no, params.m_min_seek_time_diff / AV_TIME_BASE, min_seek_segments);
5540 continue;
5541 }
5542
5543 if (!m_buffer->segment_exists(segment_no) || !m_buffer->tell(segment_no)) // NOT EXIST or NO DATA YET
5544 {
5545 int ret = 0;
5546
5547 m_reset_pts = FFMPEGFS_AUDIO | FFMPEGFS_VIDEO; // Note that we have to reset audio/video pts to the new position
5548 m_have_seeked = true; // Note that we have seeked, thus skipped frames. We need to start transcoding over to fill any gaps.
5549
5550 Logging::info(virtname(), "Performing seek request to HLS segment no. %1.", segment_no);
5551
5552 int64_t pos = (segment_no - 1) * params.m_segment_duration;
5553
5554 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx && stream_exists(m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx) && m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
5555 {
5556 int64_t vstream_pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q(pos, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
5557
5558 if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
5559 {
5560 vstream_pts += m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time;
5561 }
5562
5563 ret = av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, vstream_pts, AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD);
5564 }
5565 else if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx && stream_exists(m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx) && m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr)
5566 {
5567 int64_t astream_pts = ffmpeg_rescale_q(pos, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
5568
5569 if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
5570 {
5571 astream_pts += m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time;
5572 }
5573
5574 ret = av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx, astream_pts, AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD);
5575 }
5576
5577 if (ret < 0)
5578 {
5579 Logging::error(virtname(), "Seek failed on input file (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
5580 return ret;
5581 }
5582
5583 flush_buffers();
5584
5585 close_output_file();
5586
5587 purge_hls_fifo(); // We do not need the packets for the next frame, we start a new one at another position!
5588
5589 ret = open_output(m_buffer);
5590 if (ret < 0)
5591 {
5592 return ret;
5593 }
5594
5595 next_segment = segment_no;
5596
5597 opened = true;
5598
5599 break;
5600 }
5601
5602 Logging::info(virtname(), "Discarded seek request to HLS segment no. %1.", segment_no);
5603 }
5604
5605 // Set current segment
5606 m_current_segment = next_segment;
5607 m_inhibit_stream_msk = 0;
5608 m_insert_keyframe = false;
5609
5610 Logging::info(virtname(), "Starting HLS segment no. %1 of %2.", m_current_segment, m_virtualfile->get_segment_count());
5611
5612 if (!m_buffer->set_segment(m_current_segment, m_virtualfile->m_predicted_size / m_virtualfile->get_segment_count()))
5613 {
5614 return AVERROR(errno);
5615 }
5616
5617 if (!opened)
5618 {
5619 int ret = 0;
5620
5621 // Process output file, already done by open_output() if file has been newly opened.
5622 ret = process_output();
5623 if (ret)
5624 {
5625 return ret;
5626 }
5627 }
5628
5629 // Flush delayed packets to disk, if any
5630 while (!m_hls_packet_fifo.empty())
5631 {
5632 int ret = 0;
5633 AVPacket *pkt = m_hls_packet_fifo.front();
5634 m_hls_packet_fifo.pop();
5635
5636 ret = av_write_frame(m_out.m_format_ctx, pkt);
5637
5638 if (ret < 0)
5639 {
5640 Logging::error(virtname(), "Could not write frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
5641 return ret;
5642 }
5643
5644 av_packet_unref(pkt);
5645 }
5646 return 0;
5647}
5648
5649BITRATE FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_prores_bitrate(int width, int height, const AVRational &framerate, bool interleaved, int profile)
5650{
5651 unsigned int mindist;
5652 size_t match = UINT_MAX;
5653
5654 // Find best match resolution
5655 mindist = UINT_MAX;
5656 for (size_t i = 0; i < m_prores_bitrate.size(); i++)
5657 {
5658 unsigned int x = static_cast<unsigned int>(width - m_prores_bitrate[i].m_width);
5659 unsigned int y = static_cast<unsigned int>(height - m_prores_bitrate[i].m_height);
5660 unsigned int dist = (x * x) + (y * y);
5661
5662 if (dist < mindist)
5663 {
5664 mindist = dist;
5665 match = i;
5666 }
5667
5668 if (!dist)
5669 {
5670 // Exact match, won't find a better one.
5671 break;
5672 }
5673 }
5674
5675 if (match == UINT_MAX)
5676 {
5677 return 0;
5678 }
5679
5680 width = m_prores_bitrate[match].m_width;
5681 height = m_prores_bitrate[match].m_height;
5682
5683 // Find best match framerate
5684 double framerateX = av_q2d(framerate);
5685 mindist = UINT_MAX;
5686 for (size_t i = match; width == m_prores_bitrate[i].m_width && height == m_prores_bitrate[i].m_height; i++)
5687 {
5688 unsigned int dist = UINT_MAX;
5689 for (size_t j = 0; j < MAX_PRORES_FRAMERATE && m_prores_bitrate[i].m_framerate[j].m_framerate; j++)
5690 {
5691 unsigned int x = static_cast<unsigned int>(framerateX - m_prores_bitrate[i].m_framerate[j].m_framerate);
5692 unsigned int y = static_cast<unsigned int>(interleaved - m_prores_bitrate[i].m_framerate[j].m_interleaved);
5693
5694 dist = (x * x) + (y * y);
5695
5696 if (dist < mindist)
5697 {
5698 mindist = dist;
5699 match = i;
5700 }
5701
5702 if (!dist)
5703 {
5704 // Exact match, won't find a better one.
5705 break;
5706 }
5707 }
5708
5709 if (!dist)
5710 {
5711 // Exact match, won't find a better one.
5712 break;
5713 }
5714 }
5715
5716 if (match == UINT_MAX)
5717 {
5718 return 0;
5719 }
5720
5721 return m_prores_bitrate[match].m_bitrate[static_cast<size_t>(profile)] * (1000 * 1000);
5722}
5723
5724bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::audio_size(size_t *filesize, AVCodecID codec_id, BITRATE bit_rate, int64_t duration, int channels, int sample_rate, AVSampleFormat sample_format)
5725{
5726 BITRATE output_audio_bit_rate;
5727 int output_sample_rate;
5728 bool success = true;
5729
5730 get_output_bit_rate(bit_rate, params.m_audiobitrate, &output_audio_bit_rate);
5731 get_output_sample_rate(sample_rate, params.m_audiosamplerate, &output_sample_rate);
5732
5733 switch (codec_id)
5734 {
5735 case AV_CODEC_ID_AAC:
5736 {
5737 // Try to predict the size of the AAC stream (this is fairly accurate, sometimes a bit larger, sometimes a bit too small
5738 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5739 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1025 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead (empirically determined value)
5740 break;
5741 }
5742 case AV_CODEC_ID_MP3:
5743 {
5744 // Kbps = bits per second / 8 = Bytes per second x 60 seconds = Bytes per minute x 60 minutes = Bytes per hour
5745 // This is the sum of the size of
5746 // ID3v2, ID3v1, and raw MP3 data. This is theoretically only approximate
5747 // but in practice gives excellent answers, usually exactly correct.
5748 // Cast to 64-bit int to avoid overflow.
5749
5750 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE)) + ID3V1_TAG_LENGTH;
5751 break;
5752 }
5753 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_U8:
5754 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S8:
5755 {
5756 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_U8); // Unsigned/signed 8 have the same width
5757
5758 // File size:
5759 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5760 // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
5761 // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
5762 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5763 break;
5764 }
5765 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S8_PLANAR:
5766 {
5767 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_U8P);
5768
5769 // File size:
5770 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5771 // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
5772 // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
5773 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5774 break;
5775 }
5776 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_U16LE:
5777 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_U16BE:
5778 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S16LE:
5779 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S16BE:
5780 {
5781 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S16); // Unsigned/signed 16 have the same width
5782
5783 // File size:
5784 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5785 // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
5786 // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
5787 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5788 break;
5789 }
5790 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S16LE_PLANAR:
5791 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S16BE_PLANAR:
5792 {
5793 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S16P); // Unsigned/signed 16 have the same width
5794
5795 // File size:
5796 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5797 // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
5798 // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
5799 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5800 break;
5801 }
5802 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_U24LE: // U/S24 uses U/S32 storage
5803 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_U24BE:
5804 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S24LE:
5805 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S24BE:
5806 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_U32LE:
5807 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_U32BE:
5808 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S32LE:
5809 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S32BE:
5810 {
5811 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S32); // Unsigned/signed 32 have the same width
5812
5813 // File size:
5814 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5815 // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
5816 // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
5817 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5818 break;
5819 }
5820 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S24LE_PLANAR: // S24 uses S32 storage
5821 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S32LE_PLANAR:
5822 {
5823 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S32P);
5824
5825 // File size:
5826 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5827 // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
5828 // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
5829 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5830 break;
5831 }
5832 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S64LE:
5833 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S64BE:
5834 {
5835 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S64);
5836
5837 // File size:
5838 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5839 // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
5840 // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
5841 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5842 break;
5843 }
5844 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_F16LE:
5845 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_F24LE:
5846 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_F32BE:
5847 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_F32LE:
5848 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_F64BE:
5849 case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_F64LE:
5850 {
5851 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_FLT);
5852
5853 // File size:
5854 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5855 // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
5856 // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
5857 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5858 break;
5859 }
5860 case AV_CODEC_ID_VORBIS:
5861 {
5862 // Kbps = bits per second / 8 = Bytes per second x 60 seconds = Bytes per minute x 60 minutes = Bytes per hour
5863 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5864 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(900 * (*filesize) / 1000); // OGG files seem to be rather smaller than expected (empirically determined value)
5865 break;
5866 }
5867 case AV_CODEC_ID_OPUS:
5868 {
5869 // Kbps = bits per second / 8 = Bytes per second x 60 seconds = Bytes per minute x 60 minutes = Bytes per hour
5870 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5871 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1020 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead (empirically determined value)
5872 break;
5873 }
5874 case AV_CODEC_ID_ALAC:
5875 {
5876 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S16);
5877
5878 // File size:
5879 // Apple Lossless Audio Coding promises a compression rate of 60-70%. The actual result ranges
5880 // between 30 and over 50%, heavily depending on the input.
5881 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5882 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(620 * (*filesize) / 1000); // Estimate 38% compression rate (empirically determined value)
5883 break;
5884 }
5885 case AV_CODEC_ID_AC3:
5886 {
5887 // Kbps = bits per second / 8 = Bytes per second x 60 seconds = Bytes per minute x 60 minutes = Bytes per hour
5888 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5889 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1025 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead (empirically determined value)
5890 break;
5891 }
5892 case AV_CODEC_ID_FLAC:
5893 {
5894 int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(sample_format != AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE ? sample_format : AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S16);
5895
5896 // File size:
5897 // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
5898 // We do not add the overhead for headers, as this is an estimation and not exact anyways.
5899 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels >= 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE);
5900 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(600 * (*filesize) / 1000); // Estimate 40% compression rate (empirically determined value)
5901 break;
5902 }
5903 case AV_CODEC_ID_NONE:
5904 {
5905 break;
5906 }
5907 default:
5908 {
5909 success = false;
5910 break;
5911 }
5912 }
5913 return success;
5914}
5915
5916bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::video_size(size_t *filesize, AVCodecID codec_id, BITRATE bit_rate, int64_t duration, int width, int height, bool interleaved, const AVRational &framerate)
5917{
5918 BITRATE out_video_bit_rate;
5919 bool success = true;
5920
5921 get_output_bit_rate(bit_rate, params.m_videobitrate, &out_video_bit_rate);
5922
5923 switch (codec_id)
5924 {
5925 case AV_CODEC_ID_MPEG1VIDEO:
5926 {
5927 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5928 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1020 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead
5929 break;
5930 }
5931 case AV_CODEC_ID_MPEG2VIDEO:
5932 {
5933 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5934 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1020 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead
5935 break;
5936 }
5937 case AV_CODEC_ID_H264:
5938 {
5939 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5940 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1050 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead
5941 break;
5942 }
5943 case AV_CODEC_ID_H265:
5944 {
5945 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5946 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1250 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead
5947 break;
5948 }
5949 case AV_CODEC_ID_THEORA:
5950 {
5951 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5952 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1025 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead
5953 break;
5954 }
5955 case AV_CODEC_ID_VP8:
5956 {
5957 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5958 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1020 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead
5959 break;
5960 }
5961 case AV_CODEC_ID_VP9:
5962 {
5963 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5964 *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1450 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead
5965 break;
5966 }
5967 case AV_CODEC_ID_AV1:
5968 {
5969 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5970 //*filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1150 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add overhead
5971 break;
5972 }
5973 case AV_CODEC_ID_PRORES:
5974 {
5975 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * get_prores_bitrate(width, height, framerate, interleaved, params.m_level) / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
5976 break;
5977 }
5978 case AV_CODEC_ID_PNG:
5979 case AV_CODEC_ID_BMP:
5980 case AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG:
5981 {
5982 // Max. file size = (pixel dimensions x bit depth) / 8 for an uncompressed BMP,
5983 // more than sufficient for JPG/PNG as they should never get this large.
5984 *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(width * height * 24 / 8); // Get the max. size
5985 break;
5986 }
5987 case AV_CODEC_ID_NONE:
5988 {
5989 break;
5990 }
5991 default:
5992 {
5993 success = false;
5994 break;
5995 }
5996 }
5997 return success;
5998}
5999
6000bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::total_overhead(size_t *filesize, FILETYPE filetype)
6001{
6002 bool success = true;
6003
6004 switch (filetype)
6005 {
6006 //
6007 // Audio only
6008 //
6009 case FILETYPE_MP3:
6010 {
6011 // The FFmpeg API always adds an IDv2 header, size of which is unknown and
6012 // really hard to determine. So we simply add something reasonable (empirically determined value).
6013 *filesize += 250000;
6014 break;
6015 }
6016 case FILETYPE_WAV:
6017 {
6018 // This could actually precise, but yet the FFmpeg API always adds an IDv2 header,
6019 // size of which is unknown and really hard to determine. The header is small, ~30 bytes,
6020 // so we ignore that deliberatly.
6021 *filesize += sizeof(WAV_HEADER) + sizeof(WAV_LIST_HEADER) + sizeof(WAV_DATA_HEADER);
6022 break;
6023 }
6024 case FILETYPE_AIFF:
6025 {
6026 // These two "chunks" will always be there, others may be there, may be not. Their
6027 // size is hard to precalculate and small (~100 bytes), so we disregard the rest.
6028 *filesize += sizeof(AIFF_FORMCHUNK) + sizeof(AIFF_COMMONCHUNK);
6029 break;
6030 }
6031 case FILETYPE_OPUS:
6032 case FILETYPE_ALAC:
6033 case FILETYPE_FLAC:
6034 {
6035 break;
6036 }
6037 //
6038 // Video
6039 //
6040 case FILETYPE_TS:
6041 case FILETYPE_HLS:
6042 {
6043 *filesize += 1600000; // empirically determined value
6044 break;
6045 }
6046 case FILETYPE_MP4:
6047 case FILETYPE_OGG:
6048 case FILETYPE_WEBM:
6049 case FILETYPE_MOV:
6050 case FILETYPE_PRORES:
6051 case FILETYPE_MKV:
6052 {
6053 break;
6054 }
6055 //
6056 // Stills
6057 //
6058 case FILETYPE_PNG:
6059 case FILETYPE_JPG:
6060 case FILETYPE_BMP:
6061 {
6062 break;
6063 }
6064 //
6065 // Invalid
6066 //
6067 case FILETYPE_UNKNOWN:
6068 {
6069 success = false;
6070 break;
6071 }
6072 }
6073
6074 return success;
6075}
6076
6077size_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::calculate_predicted_filesize() const
6078{
6079 if (m_in.m_format_ctx == nullptr)
6080 {
6081 return 0;
6082 }
6083
6084 if (m_current_format == nullptr)
6085 {
6086 // Should ever happen, but better check this to avoid crashes.
6087 return 0;
6088 }
6089
6090 size_t filesize = 0;
6091
6092 int64_t file_duration = m_in.m_format_ctx->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE ? m_in.m_format_ctx->duration : 0;
6093 BITRATE input_audio_bit_rate = 0;
6094 int input_sample_rate = 0;
6095 BITRATE input_video_bit_rate = 0;
6096
6097 if (m_fileio->duration() != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
6098 {
6099 file_duration = m_fileio->duration();
6100 }
6101
6102 if (stream_exists(m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx))
6103 {
6104 input_sample_rate = m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->sample_rate;
6105 input_audio_bit_rate = (m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->bit_rate != 0) ? m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
6106 }
6107
6108 if (stream_exists(m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx))
6109 {
6110 input_video_bit_rate = (m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->bit_rate != 0) ? m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
6111 }
6112
6113 if (input_audio_bit_rate)
6114 {
6115 int channels = get_channels(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx.get());
6116
6117 if (!audio_size(&filesize, m_current_format->audio_codec(), input_audio_bit_rate, file_duration, channels, input_sample_rate, m_cur_sample_fmt))
6118 {
6119 Logging::warning(filename(), "Unsupported audio codec '%1' for format %2.", get_codec_name(m_current_format->audio_codec()), m_current_format->desttype().c_str());
6120 }
6121 }
6122
6123 if (input_video_bit_rate)
6124 {
6125 if (m_is_video)
6126 {
6127 int width = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->width;
6128 int height = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->height;
6129 bool interleaved = params.m_deinterlace ? false : (m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->field_order != AV_FIELD_PROGRESSIVE); // Deinterlace only if source is interlaced
6130 AVRational framerate = m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate;
6131
6132 if (!video_size(&filesize, m_current_format->video_codec(), input_video_bit_rate, file_duration, width, height, interleaved, framerate))
6133 {
6134 Logging::warning(filename(), "Unsupported video codec '%1' for format %2.", get_codec_name(m_current_format->video_codec()), m_current_format->desttype().c_str());
6135 }
6136 }
6137 // else /** @todo Feature #2260: Add picture size */
6138 // {
6139 // }
6140 }
6141
6142 // Support #2654: Test Code
6143 // add total overhead
6144 total_overhead(&filesize, m_current_format->filetype());
6145
6146 return filesize;
6147}
6148
6149int64_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::duration() const
6150{
6151 return SAFE_VALUE(m_virtualfile, m_duration, 0);
6152}
6153
6154size_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::predicted_filesize() const
6155{
6156 return SAFE_VALUE(m_virtualfile, m_predicted_size, 0);
6157}
6158
6159uint32_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::video_frame_count() const
6160{
6161 return SAFE_VALUE(m_virtualfile, m_video_frame_count, 0);
6162}
6163
6164uint32_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::segment_count() const
6165{
6166 return SAFE_VALUE(m_virtualfile, get_segment_count(), 0);
6167}
6168
6169int FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_finish()
6170{
6171 int ret = 0;
6172
6173 if (!is_frameset())
6174 {
6175 // If not a frame set, write trailer
6176
6177 // Write the trailer of the output file container.
6178 ret = write_output_file_trailer();
6179 }
6180
6181 if (is_hls())
6182 {
6183 m_buffer->finished_segment();
6184
6185 // Get segment VIRTUALFILE object
6186 std::string seg_filename(m_buffer->virtualfile()->m_destfile + "/" + make_filename(m_current_segment, params.current_format(m_buffer->virtualfile())->fileext()));
6187 LPVIRTUALFILE virtualfile = find_file(seg_filename);
6188
6189 if (virtualfile != nullptr)
6190 {
6191 virtualfile->m_predicted_size = m_buffer->buffer_watermark(m_current_segment);
6192
6193 stat_set_size(&virtualfile->m_st, virtualfile->m_predicted_size);
6194 }
6195 }
6196 else //if (m_virtualfile->m_flags & VIRTUALFLAG_CUESHEET)
6197 {
6198 // Save actual result size of the file
6199 stat_set_size(&m_virtualfile->m_st, m_buffer->buffer_watermark());
6200 }
6201
6202 return ret;
6203}
6204
6205const ID3v1 * FFmpeg_Transcoder::id3v1tag() const
6206{
6207 return &m_out.m_id3v1;
6208}
6209
6210int FFmpeg_Transcoder::input_read(void * opaque, unsigned char * data, int size)
6211{
6212 FileIO * io = static_cast<FileIO *>(opaque);
6213
6214 if (io == nullptr)
6215 {
6216 Logging::error(nullptr, "input_read(): Internal error: FileIO is NULL!");
6217 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
6218 }
6219
6220 if (io->eof())
6221 {
6222 // At EOF
6223 return AVERROR_EOF;
6224 }
6225
6226 int read = static_cast<int>(io->readio(reinterpret_cast<char *>(data), static_cast<size_t>(size)));
6227
6228 if (read != size && io->error())
6229 {
6230 // Read failed
6231 return AVERROR(io->error());
6232 }
6233
6234 return read;
6235}
6236
6237#if LAVF_WRITEPACKET_CONST
6238int FFmpeg_Transcoder::output_write(void * opaque, const uint8_t * data, int size)
6239#else
6240int FFmpeg_Transcoder::output_write(void * opaque, unsigned char * data, int size)
6241#endif
6242{
6243 Buffer * buffer = static_cast<Buffer *>(opaque);
6244
6245 if (buffer == nullptr)
6246 {
6247 Logging::error(nullptr, "input_write(): Internal error: FileIO is NULL!");
6248 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
6249 }
6250
6251#if LAVF_WRITEPACKET_CONST
6252 int written = static_cast<int>(buffer->writeio(data, static_cast<size_t>(size)));
6253#else
6254 int written = static_cast<int>(buffer->writeio(static_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), static_cast<size_t>(size)));
6255#endif
6256 if (written != size)
6257 {
6258 // Write error
6259 return (AVERROR(errno));
6260 }
6261 return written;
6262}
6263
6264int64_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::seek(void * opaque, int64_t offset, int whence)
6265{
6266 FileIO * io = static_cast<FileIO *>(opaque);
6267 int64_t res_offset = 0;
6268
6269 if (io == nullptr)
6270 {
6271 Logging::error(nullptr, "seek(): Internal error: FileIO is NULL!");
6272 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
6273 }
6274
6275 if (whence & AVSEEK_SIZE)
6276 {
6277 // Return file size
6278 res_offset = static_cast<int64_t>(io->size());
6279 }
6280 else
6281 {
6282 whence &= ~(AVSEEK_SIZE | AVSEEK_FORCE);
6283
6284 if (!io->seek(offset, whence))
6285 {
6286 // OK: Return position
6287 res_offset = offset;
6288 }
6289 else
6290 {
6291 // Error
6292 res_offset = AVERROR(errno);
6293 }
6294 }
6295
6296 return res_offset;
6297}
6298
6299bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::close_resample()
6300{
6301 if (m_audio_resample_ctx)
6302 {
6303 swr_free(&m_audio_resample_ctx);
6304 m_audio_resample_ctx = nullptr;
6305 return true;
6306 }
6307
6308 return false;
6309}
6310
6311int FFmpeg_Transcoder::purge_audio_fifo()
6312{
6313 int audio_samples_left = 0;
6314
6315 if (m_audio_fifo != nullptr)
6316 {
6317 audio_samples_left = av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo);
6318 av_audio_fifo_free(m_audio_fifo);
6319 m_audio_fifo = nullptr;
6320 }
6321
6322 return audio_samples_left;
6323}
6324
6325size_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::purge_multiframe_map()
6326{
6327 size_t frames_left = m_frame_map.size();
6328
6329 m_frame_map.clear();
6330
6331 return frames_left;
6332}
6333
6334size_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::purge_hls_fifo()
6335{
6336 size_t hls_packets_left = m_hls_packet_fifo.size();
6337
6338 while (!m_hls_packet_fifo.empty())
6339 {
6340 AVPacket *pkt = m_hls_packet_fifo.front();
6341 m_hls_packet_fifo.pop();
6342
6343 av_packet_unref(pkt);
6344 }
6345
6346 return hls_packets_left;
6347}
6348
6349void FFmpeg_Transcoder::purge()
6350{
6351 std::string outfile;
6352 int audio_samples_left = purge_audio_fifo();
6353 size_t frames_left = purge_multiframe_map();
6354 size_t hls_packets_left = purge_hls_fifo();
6355
6356 if (m_out.m_format_ctx != nullptr && m_out.m_format_ctx->url != nullptr)
6357 {
6358 outfile = m_out.m_format_ctx->url;
6359 }
6360 else if (m_virtualfile != nullptr)
6361 {
6362 outfile = m_virtualfile->m_virtfile;
6363 }
6364
6365 const char *p = outfile.empty() ? nullptr : outfile.c_str();
6366 if (audio_samples_left)
6367 {
6368 Logging::warning(p, "%1 audio samples left in buffer and not written to target file!", audio_samples_left);
6369 }
6370
6371 if (frames_left)
6372 {
6373 Logging::warning(p, "%1 frames left in buffer and not written to target file!", frames_left);
6374 }
6375
6376 if (hls_packets_left)
6377 {
6378 Logging::warning(p, "%1 HLS packets left in buffer and not written to target file!", hls_packets_left);
6379 }
6380}
6381
6382bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::close_output_file()
6383{
6384 bool closed = false;
6385
6386 purge();
6387
6388 close_resample();
6389
6390 sws_freeContext(m_sws_ctx);
6391 m_sws_ctx = nullptr;
6392
6393 // Close output file
6394 m_out.m_audio.reset();
6395 m_out.m_video.reset();
6396
6397 m_out.m_album_art.clear();
6398 m_out.m_subtitle.clear();
6399
6400 if (m_out.m_format_ctx != nullptr)
6401 {
6402 closed = true;
6403
6404 if (m_out.m_format_ctx->pb != nullptr)
6405 {
6406 // 2017-09-01 - xxxxxxx - lavf 57.80.100 / 57.11.0 - avio.h
6407 // Add avio_context_free(). From now on it must be used for freeing AVIOContext.
6408#if (LIBAVFORMAT_VERSION_INT >= AV_VERSION_INT(57, 80, 0))
6409 av_freep(&m_out.m_format_ctx->pb->buffer);
6410 avio_context_free(&m_out.m_format_ctx->pb);
6411#else
6412 av_freep(m_out.m_format_ctx->pb);
6413#endif
6414 m_out.m_format_ctx->pb = nullptr;
6415 }
6416
6417 avformat_free_context(m_out.m_format_ctx);
6418
6419 m_out.m_format_ctx = nullptr;
6420 }
6421
6422 return closed;
6423}
6424
6425bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::close_input_file()
6426{
6427 bool closed = false;
6428
6429 m_in.m_audio.reset();
6430 m_in.m_video.reset();
6431
6432 m_in.m_album_art.clear();
6433 m_in.m_subtitle.clear();
6434
6435 if (m_in.m_format_ctx != nullptr)
6436 {
6437 closed = true;
6438
6439 if (m_close_fileio && m_fileio != nullptr)
6440 {
6441 m_fileio->closeio();
6442 save_delete(&m_fileio);
6443 }
6444
6445 if (m_in.m_format_ctx->pb != nullptr)
6446 {
6447 // 2017-09-01 - xxxxxxx - lavf 57.80.100 / 57.11.0 - avio.h
6448 // Add avio_context_free(). From now on it must be used for freeing AVIOContext.
6449#if (LIBAVFORMAT_VERSION_INT >= AV_VERSION_INT(57, 80, 0))
6450 avio_context_free(&m_in.m_format_ctx->pb);
6451#else
6452 av_freep(m_in.m_format_ctx->pb);
6453#endif
6454 m_in.m_format_ctx->pb = nullptr;
6455 }
6456
6457 avformat_close_input(&m_in.m_format_ctx);
6458 m_in.m_format_ctx = nullptr;
6459 }
6460
6461 free_filters();
6462
6463 return closed;
6464}
6465
6466void FFmpeg_Transcoder::closeio()
6467{
6468 bool closed = false;
6469
6470 // Close input file
6471 closed |= close_input_file();
6472
6473 // Close output file
6474 closed |= close_output_file();
6475
6476 // Free hardware device contexts if open
6477 hwdevice_ctx_free(&m_hwaccel_dec_device_ctx);
6478 hwdevice_ctx_free(&m_hwaccel_enc_device_ctx);
6479
6480 // Closed anything (anything had been open to be closed in the first place)...
6481 if (closed)
6482 {
6483 Logging::trace(nullptr, "FFmpeg transcoder closed.");
6484 }
6485}
6486
6487const char *FFmpeg_Transcoder::filename() const
6488{
6489 return (m_virtualfile != nullptr ? m_virtualfile->m_origfile.c_str() : "");
6490}
6491
6492const char *FFmpeg_Transcoder::destname() const
6493{
6494 return (m_virtualfile != nullptr ? m_virtualfile->m_destfile.c_str() : "");
6495}
6496
6497const char *FFmpeg_Transcoder::virtname() const
6498{
6499 return (m_virtualfile != nullptr ? m_virtualfile->m_virtfile.c_str() : "");
6500}
6501
6502// create
6503int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_deinterlace_filters(AVCodecContext *codec_ctx, AVPixelFormat pix_fmt, const AVRational & avg_frame_rate, const AVRational & time_base)
6504{
6505 const AVFilter * buffer_src = avfilter_get_by_name("buffer");
6506 const AVFilter * buffer_sink = avfilter_get_by_name("buffersink");
6507 AVFilterInOut * outputs = avfilter_inout_alloc();
6508 AVFilterInOut * inputs = avfilter_inout_alloc();
6509 //enum AVPixelFormat pix_fmts[] = { AV_PIX_FMT_GRAY8, AV_PIX_FMT_NONE };
6510 int ret = 0;
6511
6512 m_buffer_sink_context = nullptr;
6513 m_buffer_source_context = nullptr;
6514 m_filter_graph = nullptr;
6515
6516 try
6517 {
6518 if (!avg_frame_rate.den && !avg_frame_rate.num)
6519 {
6520 // No framerate, so this video "stream" has only one picture
6521 throw static_cast<int>(AVERROR(EINVAL));
6522 }
6523
6524 m_filter_graph = avfilter_graph_alloc();
6525
6526 if (outputs == nullptr || inputs == nullptr || m_filter_graph == nullptr)
6527 {
6528 throw static_cast<int>(AVERROR(ENOMEM));
6529 }
6530
6531 // buffer video source: the decoded frames from the decoder will be inserted here.
6532 std::string args;
6533
6534 strsprintf(&args, "video_size=%dx%d:pix_fmt=%d:time_base=%d/%d:pixel_aspect=%d/%d",
6535 codec_ctx->width, codec_ctx->height, pix_fmt,
6536 time_base.num, time_base.den,
6537 codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio.num, FFMAX(codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio.den, 1));
6538
6539 //AVRational fr = av_guess_frame_rate(m_m_out.m_format_ctx, m_pVideoStream, nullptr);
6540 //if (fr.num && fr.den)
6541 //{
6542 // av_strlcatf(buffersrc_args, sizeof(buffersrc_args), ":framerate=%d/%d", fr.num, fr.den);
6543 //}
6544 //
6545 //args.snprintf("%d:%d:%d:%d:%d", m_pCodecContext->width, m_pCodecContext->height, m_pCodecContext->format, 0, 0); // 0, 0 ok?
6546
6547 ret = avfilter_graph_create_filter(&m_buffer_source_context, buffer_src, "in", args.c_str(), nullptr, m_filter_graph);
6548 if (ret < 0)
6549 {
6550 Logging::error(virtname(), "Cannot create buffer source (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6551 throw ret;
6552 }
6553
6554 //av_opt_set(m_pBufferSourceContext, "thread_type", "slice", AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
6555 //av_opt_set_int(m_pBufferSourceContext, "threads", FFMAX(1, av_cpu_count()), AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
6556 //av_opt_set_int(m_pBufferSourceContext, "threads", 16, AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
6557
6558 // buffer video sink: to terminate the filter chain.
6559
6560 std::array<enum AVPixelFormat, 3> pixel_fmts;
6561
6562 pixel_fmts[0] = pix_fmt;
6563 pixel_fmts[1] = AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
6564
6565 ret = avfilter_graph_create_filter(&m_buffer_sink_context, buffer_sink, "out", nullptr, nullptr, m_filter_graph);
6566
6567 if (ret < 0)
6568 {
6569 Logging::error(virtname(), "Cannot create buffer sink (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6570 throw ret;
6571 }
6572
6573 // Cannot change FFmpeg's API, so we hide this warning
6574#pragma GCC diagnostic push
6575#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"
6576#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-conversion"
6577 ret = av_opt_set_int_list(m_buffer_sink_context, "pix_fmts", pixel_fmts.data(), AV_PIX_FMT_NONE, AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
6578#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
6579
6580 if (ret < 0)
6581 {
6582 Logging::error(nullptr, "Cannot set output pixel format (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6583 throw ret;
6584 }
6585
6586 // Endpoints for the filter graph.
6587 outputs->name = av_strdup("in");
6588 outputs->filter_ctx = m_buffer_source_context;
6589 outputs->pad_idx = 0;
6590 outputs->next = nullptr;
6591 inputs->name = av_strdup("out");
6592 inputs->filter_ctx = m_buffer_sink_context;
6593 inputs->pad_idx = 0;
6594 inputs->next = nullptr;
6595
6596 // args "null" passthrough (dummy) filter for video
6597 // args "null" passthrough (dummy) filter for audio
6598
6599 // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31163120/c-applying-filter-in-ffmpeg
6600 const char * filters;
6601 //filters = "yadif=mode=send_frame:parity=auto:deint=interlaced";
6602 filters = "yadif=mode=send_frame:parity=auto:deint=all";
6603 //filters = "yadif=0:-1:0";
6604 //filters = "bwdif=mode=send_frame:parity=auto:deint=all";
6605 //filters = "kerndeint=thresh=10:map=0:order=0:sharp=1:twoway=1";
6606 //filters = "zoompan=z='min(max(zoom,pzoom)+0.0015,1.5)':d=1:x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)':y='ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)'";
6607
6608 // vaapi_deinterlace=rate=field
6609 // format=nv12,hwupload,deinterlace_vaapi,hwdownload,format=nv12
6610 // deinterlace_vaapi,scale_vaapi=w=1280:h=720,hwdownload,format=nv12
6611
6612 ret = avfilter_graph_parse_ptr(m_filter_graph, filters, &inputs, &outputs, nullptr);
6613 if (ret < 0)
6614 {
6615 Logging::error(virtname(), "avfilter_graph_parse_ptr failed (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6616 throw ret;
6617 }
6618
6619 ret = avfilter_graph_config(m_filter_graph, nullptr);
6620 if (ret < 0)
6621 {
6622 Logging::error(virtname(), "avfilter_graph_config failed (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6623 throw ret;
6624 }
6625
6626 Logging::debug(virtname(), "Deinterlacing initialised with filters '%1'.", filters);
6627 }
6628 catch (int _ret)
6629 {
6630 ret = _ret;
6631 }
6632
6633 if (inputs != nullptr)
6634 {
6635 avfilter_inout_free(&inputs);
6636 }
6637 if (outputs != nullptr)
6638 {
6639 avfilter_inout_free(&outputs);
6640 }
6641
6642 return ret;
6643}
6644
6645int FFmpeg_Transcoder::send_filters(FFmpeg_Frame *srcframe, int & ret)
6646{
6647 ret = 0;
6648
6649 if (m_buffer_source_context != nullptr)
6650 {
6651 try
6652 {
6653 FFmpeg_Frame filterframe(srcframe->m_stream_idx);
6654
6655 ret = filterframe.res();
6656 if (ret < 0)
6657 {
6658 Logging::error(virtname(), "Unable to allocate filter frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6659 throw ret;
6660 }
6661
6662 // push the decoded frame into the filtergraph
6663 ret = av_buffersrc_add_frame_flags(m_buffer_source_context, *srcframe, AV_BUFFERSRC_FLAG_KEEP_REF);
6664 if (ret < 0)
6665 {
6666 Logging::warning(virtname(), "Error while feeding the frame to filtergraph (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6667 throw ret;
6668 }
6669
6670 // pull filtered frames from the filtergraph
6671 ret = av_buffersink_get_frame(m_buffer_sink_context, filterframe);
6672 if (ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN) || ret == AVERROR_EOF)
6673 {
6674 // Not an error, go on
6675 ret = 0;
6676 }
6677 else if (ret < 0)
6678 {
6679 Logging::error(virtname(), "Error while getting frame from filtergraph (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6680 throw ret;
6681 }
6682 else
6683 {
6684 // All OK; copy filtered frame and unref original
6685 filterframe->pts = (*srcframe)->pts;
6686 filterframe->best_effort_timestamp = (*srcframe)->best_effort_timestamp;
6687
6688 *srcframe = filterframe;
6689 }
6690 }
6691 catch (int _ret)
6692 {
6693 ret = _ret;
6694 }
6695 }
6696
6697 return ret;
6698}
6699
6700// free
6701
6702void FFmpeg_Transcoder::free_filters()
6703{
6704 if (m_buffer_sink_context != nullptr)
6705 {
6706 avfilter_free(m_buffer_sink_context);
6707 m_buffer_sink_context = nullptr;
6708 }
6709
6710 if (m_buffer_source_context != nullptr)
6711 {
6712 avfilter_free(m_buffer_source_context);
6713 m_buffer_source_context = nullptr;
6714 }
6715
6716 if (m_filter_graph != nullptr)
6717 {
6718 avfilter_graph_free(&m_filter_graph);
6719 m_filter_graph = nullptr;
6720 }
6721}
6722
6723int FFmpeg_Transcoder::stack_seek_frame(uint32_t frame_no)
6724{
6725 if (frame_no > 0 && frame_no <= video_frame_count())
6726 {
6727 std::lock_guard<std::recursive_mutex> lock_seek_to_fifo_mutex(m_seek_to_fifo_mutex);
6728 m_seek_to_fifo.push(frame_no); // Seek to this frame next decoding operation
6729 return 0;
6730 }
6731 else
6732 {
6733 errno = EINVAL;
6734 Logging::error(virtname(), "stack_seek_frame() failed: Frame %1 was requested, but is out of range (1...%2)", frame_no, video_frame_count() + 1);
6735 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
6736 }
6737}
6738
6739int FFmpeg_Transcoder::stack_seek_segment(uint32_t segment_no)
6740{
6741 if (segment_no > 0 && segment_no <= segment_count())
6742 {
6743 std::lock_guard<std::recursive_mutex> lock_seek_to_fifo_mutex(m_seek_to_fifo_mutex);
6744 m_seek_to_fifo.push(segment_no); // Seek to this segment next decoding operation
6745 return 0;
6746 }
6747 else
6748 {
6749 errno = EINVAL;
6750 Logging::error(virtname(), "stack_seek() failed: Segment no. %1 was requested, but is out of range (1...%2)", segment_no, video_frame_count() + 1);
6751 return AVERROR(EINVAL);
6752 }
6753}
6754
6755bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::is_multiformat() const
6756{
6757 if (m_current_format == nullptr)
6758 {
6759 return false;
6760 }
6761 else
6762 {
6763 return m_current_format->is_multiformat();
6764 }
6765}
6766
6767
6768bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::is_frameset() const
6769{
6770 if (m_current_format == nullptr)
6771 {
6772 return false;
6773 }
6774 else
6775 {
6776 return m_current_format->is_frameset();
6777 }
6778}
6779
6780bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::is_hls() const
6781{
6782 if (m_current_format == nullptr)
6783 {
6784 return false;
6785 }
6786 else
6787 {
6788 return m_current_format->is_hls();
6789 }
6790}
6791
6792bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::have_seeked() const
6793{
6794 return m_have_seeked;
6795}
6796
6797enum AVPixelFormat FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_format_static(AVCodecContext *input_codec_ctx, const enum AVPixelFormat *pix_fmts)
6798{
6799 FFmpeg_Transcoder * pThis = static_cast<FFmpeg_Transcoder *>(input_codec_ctx->opaque);
6800 return pThis->get_format(input_codec_ctx, pix_fmts);
6801}
6802
6803enum AVPixelFormat FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_format(__attribute__((unused)) AVCodecContext *input_codec_ctx, const enum AVPixelFormat *pix_fmts) const
6804{
6805 if (params.m_hwaccel_dec_device_type == AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_NONE)
6806 {
6807 // We should never happen to end up here...
6808 Logging::error(filename(), "Unable to decode this file using hardware acceleration: Internal error! No hardware device type set.");
6809 return AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
6810 }
6811
6812 AVPixelFormat pix_fmt_expected = m_dec_hw_pix_fmt;
6813
6814 for (const AVPixelFormat *p = pix_fmts; *p != AV_PIX_FMT_NONE; p++)
6815 {
6816 if (*p == pix_fmt_expected)
6817 {
6818 return pix_fmt_expected;
6819 }
6820 }
6821
6822 Logging::error(filename(), "Unable to decode this file using hardware acceleration. Expected format '%1' not supported.", get_pix_fmt_name(pix_fmt_expected).c_str());
6823
6824 return AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
6825}
6826
6827int FFmpeg_Transcoder::hwdevice_ctx_create(AVBufferRef ** hwaccel_enc_device_ctx, AVHWDeviceType dev_type, const std::string & device) const
6828{
6829 std::string active_device(device);
6830 int ret;
6831
6832 if (active_device == "AUTO" && dev_type == AV_HWDEVICE_TYPE_VAAPI)
6833 {
6834 active_device = "/dev/dri/renderD128"; //** @todo HWACCEL - Try to autodetect rendering device
6835 }
6836
6837 ret = av_hwdevice_ctx_create(hwaccel_enc_device_ctx, dev_type, !active_device.empty() ? active_device.c_str() : nullptr, nullptr, 0);
6838 if (ret < 0)
6839 {
6840 Logging::error(virtname(), "Failed to create a %1 device (error '%2').", hwdevice_get_type_name(dev_type), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6841 return ret;
6842 }
6843 return 0;
6844}
6845
6846int FFmpeg_Transcoder::hwdevice_ctx_add_ref(AVCodecContext *input_codec_ctx)
6847{
6848 if (m_hwaccel_dec_device_ctx == nullptr)
6849 {
6850 int ret = AVERROR(EINVAL);
6851 Logging::error(virtname(), "INTERNAL ERROR: FFmpeg_Transcoder::hwdevice_ctx_add_ref()! HW decoder device context is NULL (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6852 return ret;
6853 }
6854
6855 input_codec_ctx->hw_device_ctx = av_buffer_ref(m_hwaccel_dec_device_ctx);
6856 if (input_codec_ctx->hw_device_ctx == nullptr)
6857 {
6858 int ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
6859 Logging::error(virtname(), "A hardware device reference create failed (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6860 return ret;
6861 }
6862
6863 input_codec_ctx->opaque = static_cast<void*>(this);
6864 input_codec_ctx->get_format = &FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_format_static;
6865
6866 return 0;
6867}
6868
6869void FFmpeg_Transcoder::hwdevice_ctx_free(AVBufferRef **hwaccel_device_ctx)
6870{
6871 if (*hwaccel_device_ctx != nullptr)
6872 {
6873 av_buffer_unref(hwaccel_device_ctx);
6874 *hwaccel_device_ctx = nullptr;
6875 }
6876}
6877
6878int FFmpeg_Transcoder::hwframe_ctx_set(AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx, AVCodecContext *input_codec_ctx, AVBufferRef *hw_device_ctx) const
6879{
6880 AVBufferRef *hw_new_frames_ref;
6881 AVHWFramesContext *frames_ctx = nullptr;
6882 int ret = 0;
6883
6884 hw_new_frames_ref = av_hwframe_ctx_alloc(hw_device_ctx);
6885 if (hw_new_frames_ref == nullptr)
6886 {
6887 ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
6888 Logging::error(virtname(), "hwframe_ctx_set(): Failed to create hwframe context (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6889 return ret;
6890 }
6891
6892 frames_ctx = reinterpret_cast<AVHWFramesContext *>(hw_new_frames_ref->data);
6893 frames_ctx->format = m_enc_hw_pix_fmt;
6894 frames_ctx->sw_format = /*input_codec_ctx->sw_pix_fmt; */find_sw_fmt_by_hw_type(params.m_hwaccel_enc_device_type);
6895 frames_ctx->width = input_codec_ctx->width;
6896 frames_ctx->height = input_codec_ctx->height;
6897
6898 frames_ctx->initial_pool_size = 20; // Driver default seems to be 17
6899
6900 ret = av_hwframe_ctx_init(hw_new_frames_ref);
6901 if (ret < 0)
6902 {
6903 Logging::error(virtname(), "hwframe_ctx_set(): Failed to initialise hwframe context (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6904 av_buffer_unref(&hw_new_frames_ref);
6905 return ret;
6906 }
6907
6908 output_codec_ctx->hw_frames_ctx = av_buffer_ref(hw_new_frames_ref);
6909 if (output_codec_ctx->hw_frames_ctx == nullptr)
6910 {
6911 ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
6912 Logging::error(virtname(), "hwframe_ctx_set(): A hardware frame reference create failed (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6913 }
6914
6915 av_buffer_unref(&hw_new_frames_ref);
6916
6917 return ret;
6918}
6919
6920//int FFmpeg_Transcoder::hwframe_ctx_set(AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx, AVCodecContext *input_codec_ctx, AVBufferRef *hw_device_ctx)
6921//{
6922// // If the decoder runs in hardware, we should use the decoder's frames context. This will save us from
6923// // having to transfer frames from hardware to software and vice versa.

6955// frames_ctx->format = m_hw_pix_fmt;

6958// frames_ctx->height = input_codec_ctx->height;

6964// av_buffer_unref(&hw_new_frames_ref);
6965// return ret;
6966// }

6968// output_codec_ctx->hw_frames_ctx = av_buffer_ref(hw_new_frames_ref);
6969// if (!output_codec_ctx->hw_frames_ctx)
6970// {

6972// ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
6973// }

6978// }
6979
6980// return 0;
6981//}
6982
6983int FFmpeg_Transcoder::hwframe_copy_from_hw(AVCodecContext * /*ctx*/, FFmpeg_Frame *sw_frame, const AVFrame * hw_frame) const
6984{
6985 int ret;
6986
6987 ret = av_frame_copy_props(*sw_frame, hw_frame);
6988 if (ret < 0)
6989 {
6990 Logging::error(filename(), "Failed to copy frame properties (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6991 return ret;
6992 }
6993
6994 ret = av_hwframe_transfer_data(*sw_frame, hw_frame, 0);
6995 if (ret < 0)
6996 {
6997 Logging::error(filename(), "Error while transferring frame data from surface (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
6998 return ret;
6999 }
7000
7001 return 0;
7002}
7003
7004int FFmpeg_Transcoder::hwframe_copy_to_hw(AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx, FFmpeg_Frame *hw_frame, const AVFrame * sw_frame) const
7005{
7006 int ret;
7007
7008 ret = av_frame_copy_props(*hw_frame, sw_frame);
7009 if (ret < 0)
7010 {
7011 Logging::error(virtname(), "Failed to copy frame properties (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
7012 return ret;
7013 }
7014
7015 ret = av_hwframe_get_buffer(output_codec_ctx->hw_frames_ctx, *hw_frame, 0);
7016 if (ret < 0)
7017 {
7018 Logging::error(virtname(), "Failed to copy frame buffers to hardware memory (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
7019 return ret;
7020 }
7021
7022 if ((*hw_frame)->hw_frames_ctx == nullptr)
7023 {
7024 ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
7025 Logging::error(virtname(), "Failed to copy frame buffers to hardware memory (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
7026 return ret;
7027 }
7028
7029 ret = av_hwframe_transfer_data(*hw_frame, sw_frame, 0);
7030 if (ret < 0)
7031 {
7032 Logging::error(virtname(), "Error while transferring frame data to surface (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
7033 return ret;
7034 }
7035
7036 return 0;
7037}
7038
7050int FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_hw_decoder_name(AVCodecID codec_id, std::string *codec_name) const
7051{
7052 std::string codec_name_buf;
7053 int ret = 0;
7054
7055 switch (params.m_hwaccel_dec_API)
7056 {
7057 case HWACCELAPI_VAAPI:
7058 {
7059 ret = get_hw_vaapi_codec_name(codec_id, &codec_name_buf);
7060 break;
7061 }
7062 case HWACCELAPI_MMAL:
7063 {
7064 ret = get_hw_mmal_decoder_name(codec_id, &codec_name_buf);
7065 break;
7066 }
7067 //case HWACCELAPI_V4L2M2M:
7068 //{
7069 // ret = get_hw_v4l2m2m_decoder_name(codec_id, &codec_name_buf);
7070 // break;
7071 //}
7072 case HWACCELAPI_NONE:
7073 default:
7074 {
7075 ret = AVERROR_DECODER_NOT_FOUND;
7076 break;
7077 }
7078 }
7079
7080 if (codec_name != nullptr)
7081 {
7082 if (!ret)
7083 {
7084 *codec_name = codec_name_buf;
7085 }
7086 else
7087 {
7088 codec_name->clear();
7089 }
7090 }
7091
7092 return ret;
7093}
7094
7095int FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_hw_encoder_name(AVCodecID codec_id, std::string *codec_name) const
7096{
7097 std::string codec_name_buf;
7098 int ret = 0;
7099
7100 switch (params.m_hwaccel_enc_API)
7101 {
7102 case HWACCELAPI_VAAPI:
7103 {
7104 ret = get_hw_vaapi_codec_name(codec_id, &codec_name_buf);
7105 break;
7106 }
7107 case HWACCELAPI_OMX:
7108 {
7109 ret = get_hw_omx_encoder_name(codec_id, &codec_name_buf);
7110 break;
7111 }
7112 //case HWACCELAPI_V4L2M2M:
7113 //{
7114 // ret = get_hw_v4l2m2m_encoder_name(codec_id, &codec_name_buf);
7115 // break;
7116 //}
7117 case HWACCELAPI_NONE:
7118 default:
7119 {
7120 ret = AVERROR_DECODER_NOT_FOUND;
7121 break;
7122 }
7123 }
7124
7125 if (codec_name != nullptr)
7126 {
7127 if (!ret)
7128 {
7129 *codec_name = codec_name_buf;
7130 }
7131 else
7132 {
7133 codec_name->clear();
7134 }
7135 }
7136
7137 return ret;
7138}
7139
7140int FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_hw_vaapi_codec_name(AVCodecID codec_id, std::string *codec_name) const
7141{
7142 int ret = 0;
7155 switch (codec_id)
7156 {
7157 case AV_CODEC_ID_H264:
7158 {
7159 *codec_name = "h264_vaapi";
7160 break;
7161 }
7188 //case AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG:
7189 //{
7190 // *codec_name = "mjpeg_vaapi";
7191 // break;
7192 //}
7193 case AV_CODEC_ID_MPEG2VIDEO:
7194 {
7195 *codec_name = "mpeg2_vaapi";
7196 break;
7197 }
7198 case AV_CODEC_ID_HEVC:
7199 {
7200 *codec_name = "hevc_vaapi";
7201 break;
7202 }
7203 case AV_CODEC_ID_VC1:
7204 {
7205 *codec_name = "vc1_vaapi";
7206 break;
7207 }
7208 case AV_CODEC_ID_VP8:
7209 {
7210 *codec_name = "vp9_vaapi";
7211 break;
7212 }
7213 case AV_CODEC_ID_VP9:
7214 {
7215 *codec_name = "vp9_vaapi";
7216 break;
7217 }
7218 default:
7219 {
7220 ret = AVERROR_DECODER_NOT_FOUND;
7221 break;
7222 }
7223 }
7224
7225 return ret;
7226}
7227
7228int FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_hw_mmal_decoder_name(AVCodecID codec_id, std::string *codec_name) const
7229{
7230 int ret = 0;
7240 switch (codec_id)
7241 {
7242 case AV_CODEC_ID_H264:
7243 {
7244 *codec_name = "h264_mmal";
7245 break;
7246 }
7264 case AV_CODEC_ID_MPEG2VIDEO:
7265 {
7266 *codec_name = "mpeg2_mmal";
7267 break;
7268 }
7269 case AV_CODEC_ID_MPEG4:
7270 {
7271 *codec_name = "mpeg4_mmal";
7272 break;
7273 }
7287 case AV_CODEC_ID_VC1:
7288 {
7289 *codec_name = "vc1_mmal";
7290 break;
7291 }
7292 default:
7293 {
7294 ret = AVERROR_DECODER_NOT_FOUND;
7295 break;
7296 }
7297 }
7298
7299 return ret;
7300}
